campaigns.title: COVID-19 Coalition
campaigns.description: The COVID-19 pandemic is something that has led to extreme panic and suffering across not only Canada, but the world. Many have died, and countless are left panicked at home unsure of whether or not they have contracted the virus. Due to global panic, the economy is taking a hit and people across the world have been forced to cancel events as a result of social distancing.   While the Canadian government is doing their best to slow the spread of COVID-19, we still feel the effects every day. Greater Vancouver and the Lower Mainland have been ravaged by empty stores and a fear of social contact. As a result of new social distancing recommendations put forth by the World Health Organization and the BC government, many are stuck in their houses and cannot access essential goods and services that they need to live. The elderly need help with their groceries, the immunocompromised need help with daily errands, and the general population needs information that is vital to keep them safe. Many people simply need a helping hand. Someone to drive out and grab them something. Someone to give them information about how to stay clean and to avoid contracting the virus. Others just need somebody to talk to.  There are currently many groups in and around the Greater Vancouver and Lower Mainland community, but few know about these services and they will be better off collaborating to maximize their impacts. This fundraiser is aimed at collecting funds to cover groceries and to pay for errands that people need to have done while in quarantine (if needed), to make it easier for volunteers to get out and help, to create vital informational materials, and to fund care homes as well as homeless shelters.  The first step is to create a website that will include information, a sign up for those who need help and those who are able to give help, and volunteer opportunities for anyone who is able to come out during this tumultuous time. After, the money will be used to further fund initiatives that will secure goods for the homeless, help the immunodeficient, and fund other impactful programs. This platform will also allow various groups and organizations that are working towards the same goal to come together.   Another important step is to ensure that people who are feeling symptoms do not leave their homes. This means that they will need people to help them run their errands and to get equipment in order to sustain themselves. We can help contain this virus if we all work together.  If you‚Äö√Ñ√¥d like more information as to where your money will be going, or how you can help in other ways, please reach out and I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll get back to you ASAP.  Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s unite to fight this emergency, and let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s unite to fight COVID-19.

campaigns.title: Covid 19 Shutdown - Nachbarschaftshilfe Jena
campaigns.description: Die Coronakrise und der damit verbundene Shutdown in Jena und ganz Deutschland trifft wirtschaftlich am schwersten die kleinen. Freiberufler und Selbstst‚àö¬ßndige, K‚àö¬∫nstler und Musiker, kleine L‚àö¬ßden ohne weitere Mitarbeiter und ohne M‚àö‚àÇglichkeit (Stand 16.03.2020) staatliche Hilfen wie zum Beispiel Kurzarbeitsgeld zu beziehen.  Viele der Betroffenen machen sich aktuell durch den immensen Wegfall von Einnahmen zurecht Sorgen um ihre Existenz, da es f‚àö¬∫r sie aktuell keine M‚àö‚àÇglichkeit gibt aktiv f‚àö¬∫r den Lebensunterhalt zu sorgen.  Da wir uns in einer Ausnahmesituation befinden, die uns alle gleicherma‚àö√ºen trifft, m‚àö‚àÇchte ich gerne hiermit einen Nachbarschaftshilfe Fond ins Leben rufen, der lokal in Jena diejenigen unterst‚àö¬∫tzt, die durch den Shutdown in finanzielle Schwierigkeiten geraten sind und erstmal nicht auf staatliche Hilfe bauen k‚àö‚àÇnnen.  Da es mich pers‚àö‚àÇnlich als Selbstst‚àö¬ßndigen auch treffen kann, weiss ich um die generelle aktuelle Unsicherheit und m‚àö‚àÇchte da etwas dagegen unternehmen, wo ich etwas bewegen kann, auf lokaler Ebene.  Wir k‚àö‚àÇnnen nicht alle Probleme l‚àö‚àÇsen, aber wir k‚àö‚àÇnnen denen, die aktuell auf sich alleine gestellt sind, ein paar Kopfschmerzen nehmen. Daf‚àö¬∫r soll das Geld aus dieser Kampagne verwendet werden.  Falls ihr zu den Leuten geh‚àö‚àÇrt, die dringend Hilfe ben‚àö‚àÇtigen, wendet euch an mich.  Es ist an der Zeit zusammenzuhalten und uns um unsere Stadt zu k‚àö¬∫mmern.  0774X LOCAL HEROES  Sebastian Heering Downtown Jena

campaigns.title: Corona virus relief for Tall Oaks
campaigns.description: #smallbusinessreliefI have had so many wonderful clients, friends, and even people I dont know contact me and ask if the ranch needs anything in this crazy time. I am in the same boat as many small businesses,¬¨‚Ä† where i rely on our daily business to support the horses and pay the bills that keep the ranch going. As you guys know, If I can't do business,teaching lessons etc, I don't get paid.¬¨‚Ä†Even with all the craziness,¬¨‚Ä† the ranch has to operate as normal for the horses sake! They still will need to have to have their feet done by our farrier, and need their usual feed and supplements, and routine vet care.¬¨‚Ä† In turn, me purchasing our feed and paying our farrier supports other small businesses.¬¨‚Ä†If anyone has a favourite Tall Oaks horse, this is where you can help support them ! $40 will pay for a horses feet¬¨‚Ä† to be trimmed by our wonderful farrier,(Elfta Hilzman) and helps keep her business going too.$17 buys a bale of hay and supports our feed store which is an amazing family owned small business that we have purchased from for years.¬¨‚Ä†Any money we raise that is not used for Ranch expenses during this time will be payed forward, to another small business that needs it!It has also come my attention that some of our boarders have lost jobs, or had hours drastically reduced, so if we can raise enough I would love to help them out with some of their horses essential costs also. I cant wait to have everyone back to the ranch once this all is over.¬¨‚Ä† We have an amazing community that we are proud to be a part of!Thank you so much for supporting small businesses!

campaigns.title: Kentuckiana Service Industry Covid19 Bailout
campaigns.description: Louisville has suffered an enormous $60 million¬¨‚Ä† (and counting) loss in tourism from the global coronavirus pandemic.This is an extreme, devastating loss for the backbone of the Louisville hospitality industry.It's only a matter of hours before our state(s) shut down all bars, restaurants, and tipped employee establishments.As a 20-year veteran of the industry, I know what it's like to live paycheck to paycheck.¬¨‚Ä† Over the years, I've been tipped well.I've also lived in (and out) of my car because I couldn't afford housing while attending college.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†Less than 20% of Americans have $1,000.00 in savings.¬¨‚Ä†Two weeks, a month..without income... it's detrimental. Imagine the families just keeping it together, day to day, WITHOUT the current problems.If you were planning on visiting Louisville for the upcoming events we host pre-Derby, please consider donating your ""tip budget"" as if you had attended.If you can donate the cost of a 12 -pack of toilet paper or the cost of some baby wipes, that would help, too.I created this campaign in a moment of inspiration that demanded action.Donations will be held (i.e. not dispersed) until I can meet with the¬¨‚Ä† right organizations that will help determine how to appropriately distribute the donations.Take ACTION now.¬¨‚Ä†If you love America's native spirit, DONATE NOW!The tourism and hospitality industry is Kentucky's third largest industry, employing over 27,000 workers in Louisville alone.Part of the proceeds will be donated to our local USBG KY Chapter (United States Bartenders Guild).A portion will also be committed to Apron. Their current campaign is accepting applicants for industry workers who've been diagnosed with Covid-19. Here are some additional ideas that are relevant:* bus passes/Tarc cards* donations to single-parent organizations* financial literacy webinar (looking for someone to donate their time for this)* pet food bank* donated goods and services with auctions on a FB Live Watch Party to generate more contributionsThis is a mission in progress!#bourbontourism

campaigns.title: Support Boho Yoga during COVID-19
campaigns.description: Hi friends! Boho Yoga is a small, community based yoga school in McMinnville, OR. Started in 2017 by Rose Schneider   Lesley Anderson, Boho Yoga has become a staple in our small community for yoga, meditation   alternative wellness resources. Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, we are in need of #SmallBusinessRelief from our community in order to survive   thrive.  In February 2020, Boho Yoga expanded their studio with the addition of a new 1000 sq/ft ""Boho Annex"". This space was intended to expand our current offerings and help support two other local businesses offering Tai Chi   martial arts (Boreal Wellness), and fun, fast paced movement classes¬¨‚Ä† (Fresh Air Movement).¬¨‚Ä†  In early March, Boho Yoga decided to reduce the number of classes being offered and limit the number of students per class in order to maintain social distancing recommendations. After a short period of time, Rose   Lesley made the very tough decision to shut the doors and cancel remaining in-person classes until further notice.¬¨‚Ä† Although the State of Oregon did not require us to shut or doors until very recently, we knew we could not keep our doors open   our classes going with the information we received about the spread of COVID-19 pandemic.¬¨‚Ä†  Our student's health and well-being is our top priority.¬¨‚Ä†  Since closing the doors, Lesley   Rose have been working hard on updating their business model, learning new skills, and researching how best to bring more yoga into the home's of their students.  Rose   Lesley are optimistic about the opportunities that increasing virtual offerings could have for their classes, their privates, their events and their 200-hour Yoga Alliance Certified yoga teacher training program,¬¨‚Ä† now and for many years to come.¬¨‚Ä†   Boho Yoga has been providing free yoga   meditation classes everyday from their Instagram account since the beginning of March and will be launching their first filmed series of classes, online privates, and a Pro web-series on in-depth yoga topics on April 1st. (Side note: April 1st is Boho Yoga's 3 year anniversary!).  Lesley and Rose were able to work with their landlord on rent deferral, and so far they have been able to pay all their bills, but with the loss of income from in-person classes   sub leasing contracts, Boho Yoga needs financial community support to survive the next several months.¬¨‚Ä†  If we are able to reach our goal of $5,000 we will not only be able to survive, but thrive. Over $3,000 of this will go directly to paying rent   utilities and the remaining $2,000 will allow us to purchase a (gently used) desktop computer for editing, a high quality camera for filming, a small microphone system, and enough funds to bring back (at least) two additional teachers to help serve our community's yoga needs.¬¨‚Ä†  We believe in the power of yoga to help heal the mind, body   spirit and couldn't be more proud of this amazing community in Yamhill County that we are a part of. We are in this together.   Thank you so much for your support   encouragement.¬¨‚Ä† Stay well friends   keep taking care of each other. We love you. May the force be with you.¬¨‚Ä† Xo Boho Yoga Co-Founders, Rose Schneider   Lesley Ramaa Anderson   www.bohoyogastudio.com ¬¨‚Ä† Facebook: www.facebook.com/bohoyogastudio Instagram: @bohoyogastudio  P.s. Thanks to the #SmallBusinessRelief fund from GoFundMe, if Boho Yoga is able to raise  $500 or more , they will grant us a matching $500. This will be extremely helpful to us. Thank you for supporting small business!

campaigns.title: Corona Crisis! Help Egyptische gezinnen in nood!
campaigns.description: Het Coronavirus zorgt voor een enorme crisis wereldwijd, maar in Egypte zijn de mensen afhankelijk van het toerisme. Nu dat compleet stil valt zijn al veel mensen hun baan verloren en er is totaal geen vangnet waardoor mensen straks gaan sterven van de honger.Ik ben zelf werkzaam in de sociale sector in de daklozen opvang in Amsterdam en besef mij vaak hoe ""goed"" wij het hier in Nederland¬¨‚Ä† hebben. Op mijn vakanties heb ik meerdere mensen met jonge gezinnen ontmoet waarbij vaak 1 persoon keihard werkt om het hele gezin te onderhouden. Hun verhalen en positieve instelling ontroeren mij elke keer weer.¬¨‚Ä†Ik ben net terug uit Egypte en zou heel graag deze mensen willen helpen door ze de komende maanden te voorzien van voedsel om deze tijden van de pandemie door te komen.¬¨‚Ä†Helpt u mee en steunt u samen met mij deze¬¨‚Ä† hardwerkende mensen in tijden van nood?¬¨‚Ä†Elke euro is er ‚àö¬©‚àö¬©n en is hard nodig!¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Medical Supplies for WuHan, China's Coronavirus
campaigns.description: The Coronavirus is a rapidly spreading epidemic centered in China, with thousands of cases being introduced everyday.   It has led to more than 210 deaths so far (as of 1/30/20) with no cure, and it is very hard to detect with symptoms largely resembling the common cold, further contributing to the danger that it presents. 8,100 cases have been confirmed in mainland China, and the virus continues to spread globally. In WuHan, China, where the virus started, there has been a shortage of medical supplies for those in need, further worsening the situation.   We are determined to raise as much money as possible, setting a starting goal of $5000, to buy medical supplies such as face masks, goggles, and gloves for the doctors and citizens who need them. Thank you so much for your support!

campaigns.title: Washington COVID-19 - Feed The Children Campaign
campaigns.description: Gov. Jay Inslee is planning to announce the closure of all K-12 schools, public and private, in King, Snohomish and Pierce counties for more than a month, according to a source with knowledge of the situation.  Under the executive order, schools can hold classes until Monday, March 16. They must close by March 17 and remain closed until April 24.  Across the three counties, nearly 563,600 attend public or charter schools. Roughly 216,700 of them qualify for subsidized meals, leaving many of the 43 school districts there scrambling to plan for feeding children during an extended closure.  Students with disabilities and children experiencing homelessness also are likely to bear the brunt of long periods without schools open. For many students who don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t have stable housing arrangements, school can be the one constant in their lives.  As a community we need to band together and help our children to never go without a meal. The ~1MM target covers for a meal for one child, so we have to do more. Please generously contribute.   I will be working closely with the Governer's office to make sure all funds get directed to our state for quick and appropriate distribution of funds.

campaigns.title: Help Fight CoViD-19
campaigns.description: Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit UNICEF USA, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.  More information about UNICEF USA: The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) works in more than 190 countries and territories to put children first. UNICEF has helped save more children's lives than any other humanitarian organization, by providing health care and immunizations, safe water and sanitation, nutrition, education, emergency relief and more. UNICEF USA supports UNICEF's work through fundraising, advocacy and education in the United States. UNICEF does not endorse any brand, company, product, or service.

campaigns.title: Shane's Wedding
campaigns.description: I would like to tell you about Shane. I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve had heartache and worried about my son for many years. It took him a while, but I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m so very proud to see the man he has become.  We all know the path he took and the mistakes he made. I was so heartbroken that I had to let go. It was the single, most difficult decision I ever had to make in my life to walk away and let fate decide his future.  I can thankfully say today, three years later, that Shane has become the son that I can be proud of. He has held a steady job for the past three years and has led a clean and sober life. Every time I see him, the tears well up in my eyes at my pride in this young man.  The reason I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m writing this is that Shane is planning on getting married this July 22. It is not going to be an extravagant wedding, it will be held in the backyard of a family member, in the afternoon, after he‚Äö√Ñ√¥s done working.  It pains me that I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m not financially able to help out. I would so like to make this a special occasion for him. So, hat in hand, I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m beseeching friends and family to help out, whatever you can afford, be it one dollar, or some sort of decoration or such thing. I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m trying to do an island wedding and am working with what little funds I have.  I am doing a fundraising and the link is listed below. No hard feelings, whatever you can donate will be much appreciated.  Please¬¨‚Ä† donate‚Äö√Ñ¬∂thank you! And God Bless!

My classmates and I will be traveling to the The Gambia, Western Africa in May 2018 alongside The African Cultural Exchange. During our mission, we will be providing much needed health care in underserved hospitals and communities to men, women and children. ¬¨‚Ä†  In past years, the Mercy College PA Program has participated in many successful medical mission trips. Being able to provide care to those in need has always been a passion of mine. ¬¨‚Ä† I sincerely appreciate your help in helping me reach my goal. ¬¨‚Ä†Any donation amount is greatly appreciated and I thank you in advance for your contribution and support, it really means a lot to me.     https://youtu.be/C-ET_3FOvDw

campaigns.title: COVID19 Performing Arts Professionals Crisis Fund
campaigns.description: The  Actors'   Entertainers' Benevolent Fund of Queensland ¬¨‚Ä†is raising urgently needed funds to support the performing arts professionals in Queensland who are in crisis as a result of COVID-19.   The Fund is a registered charity and has been the place Queensland performing arts professionals turn when in crisis or need for over 45 years. And now more than ever, we need your support. COVID-19 is crippling our industry.   Today, there are nearly 5000 people in Queensland who identify as performing arts professionals. Hundreds have already lost¬¨‚Ä† their livelihoods , and thousands more will find themselves without income soon. This is millions of dollars in lost income, and the number will only climb.  Our goal is to support every Queensland performing arts professional effected by COVID-19, and to do that we need your help.   We aim to raise $1,250,000 as a starting point to ensure that every call for help thus far can be answered.   $50,000 may support 200 performers short term.  $100,000 could help 400.  $250,000 could help 1000.  $500,000 could help 2000.  $1,000,000 could help 4000.   $1,250,000 will help the 5000 people we know are in trouble. For now at least.   The Fund have dedicated $25,000 to kick-start this fundraiser.   If you can help, now is the time to give. No amount is too small.  Every donation of $2 or more is fully tax deductible. Together we can help support our performers in this, their time of need.

campaigns.title: Helping NYC Restaurants Workers During COVID- 19
campaigns.description: As we all try and cope with COVID-19 (coronavirus), there are a lot of people in New York City impacted by this new restaurant/ bar ban. Many of our neighbors are in difficult positions.    Over the past 10 years, I have worked alongside some of the greatest people in the restaurant and bar industry. Bartenders, barbacks, bussers, porters, DJs, servers, bottle service, delivery people, and much more.  Sadly a lot of them are undocumented or not even on the books at some of your favorite restaurants and bars. And it's often not by choice.  I am asking you to join me in supporting them. We want to help at least 5 businesses, and help as many people who work at these establishments. We are focusing on those who cannot get unemployment benefits because they have been off the books for three years or the bartender/ server that only gets paid in cash. Many of them are unable to work at home but still have rent and other bills to pay. This is a dire and stressful position to be in, and we shouldn't take this for granted.   As soon as we receive funds we will start highlighting   dispersing immediately.¬¨‚Ä† By donating as little as a dollar you can help pay someone's cellphone, the electric bill,¬¨‚Ä† or buy some groceries.  With the economic impacts of COVID-19 hitting New York City, it's only going to get more tough for a lot of people.  We may need to socially distance ourselves to flatten the curve of infection, but we also need to reach out and support our neighbors best we can. Luckily the internet makes that pretty easy. Donate now.¬¨‚Ä†  Let's come together like we all say we would in a time of crisis.  Thank you,  Chao¬¨‚Ä†   Chao Williams has honed his craft in the hospitality industry everywhere from Ciprianis to Mansion, and Tenjune Nightclub. With 10 years of experience in the industry, Chao is set to launch your soon - to- be favorite online destination for Nightlife..... Livevibez @livevibezparty   https://www.instagram.com/livevibezparty/

campaigns.title: COVID19 - DONARE KIT PER VALUTARE SIEROCONVERSIONE
campaigns.description: ‚àö√†¬¨‚Ä† disponibile un nuovo  test per la valutazione della sieroconversione nelle infezioni da COVID-19 .  Grazie all'utilizzo di questo KIT, in soli 10 minuti, si potranno sapere informazioni importanti circa lo ""stato di salute"" del sistema immunitario del cittadino. Il progetto raccoglie fondi per acquistare KIT da donare alle strutture sanitarie e mezzi mobili di soccorso che in questo modo, in pochissimo tempo, potranno valutare la sieroconversione nelle infezioni da COVID-19.  La sieroconversione ‚àö¬Æ il passaggio dallo stato di sieronegativit‚àö‚Ä† (assenza di anticorpi nel sangue) allo stato di sieropositivit‚àö‚Ä† (presenza di anticorpi nel sangue). Quando un agente infettante, esempio il COVID-19, penetra nell'organismo, infatti, vengono in genere prodotti anticorpi diretti contro di esso; ci‚àö‚â§ accade nel 70% circa dei soggetti quindi non in tutti.  La sieroconversione, in generale, NON avviene subito dopo l'ingresso dell'agente infettante nell'organismo (momento del contagio, in cui serve il test oggi in uso negli ospedali per il COVID-19 per fare la diagnosi se sei o non sei infettato dal Virus COVID-19), ma avviene a distanza di tempo, (in cui serve il test per la rilevazione di anticorpi nel sangue ma dopo che sia trascorso un tempo sufficientemente lungo). Il test PCR oggi in uso negli ospedali sono test adeguati per la fase precoce dell'infezione (1-2 settimane dal contagio)  Il test anticorpale ‚àö¬Æ un test adeguato per la valutazione della sieroconverisone da COVID-19, se cio‚àö¬Æ si sono sviluppati anticorpi adeguati anti-virus (  3 settimane dal contagio)  Il test si fa su una goccia di sangue, come il test della glicemia per il diabete. L'iniziativa ‚àö¬Æ promossa da R4H, dal Rotary Club ASSAGO Milanofiori, da MEDnoTE s.r.l , da ULTRADENT inc. e da ARCO Onlus.  I primi KIT disponibili verranno donati a HSR e Humanitas.  R4H  ‚àö¬Æ un'associazione senza scopo di lucro che si occupa di promuovere iniziative socialmente utili nel campo della salute, prevenzione, stili di vita, ambiente.  sito WEB ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†   Rotary Club ASSAGO Milanofiori ‚àö¬Æ uno dei 49 Club del Distretto 2041 del Rotary International. Alcuni soci del Club sono anche soci fondatori di R4H    MEDnoTE s.r.l. ‚àö¬Æ uno SPIN-OFF Universitario (UNI-TS) e START-UP innovativa e svolge prevalentemente attivit‚àö‚Ä† di ricerca clinica e traslazionale (biologica applicata alla clinica). Il presidente di MEDnoTE ‚àö¬Æ il prof. Daniele Generali,¬¨‚Ä†   (f.f. Direttore di U.O. campaigns.title: Hellas Grill Corona Gutscheine
campaigns.description: Sehr geehrte G‚àö¬ßste,  wir alle durchleben gerade eine turbulente und schwere Zeit. F‚àö¬∫r uns Gastronomen und vor allem unsere Angestellten ist es ganz besonders erdr‚àö¬∫ckend.¬¨‚Ä†  Ich wei‚àö√º, dass auch andere Branchen genau so schwer unter der aktuellen Lage zu leiden haben wie wir, jedoch bin ich zun‚àö¬ßchst einmal darauf bedacht,meinen 25 Angestellten und Ihren Familien weiterhin eine Lebensgrundlage bieten zu k‚àö‚àÇnnen. Da wir im Moment vor‚àö¬∫bergehend durch die beh‚àö‚àÇrdliche Ma‚àö√ºnahme f‚àö¬∫r einen Monat geschlossen sind, belaufen sich unsere Einnahmen z.Zt. auf 0‚Äö√á¬®.  Wir haben bis jetzt auf etwas Hilfe von der Bundes- oder Landesregierung gehofft, mussten gestern jedoch ern‚àö¬∫chternd feststellen, dass die neu beschlossenen Soforthilfen nur f‚àö¬∫r Unternehmen bis zu 10 Angestellten gEltern. Alles was dar‚àö¬∫ber liegt, soll aller Voraussicht tats‚àö¬ßchlich auf Kredite zur‚àö¬∫ckgreifen. Nur wie sollen wir diese Kredite zur‚àö¬∫ckzahlen, wenn wir kein Einkommen haben? Bitte verstehen Sie mich nicht falsch: Ich begr‚àö¬∫‚àö√ºe diese Ma‚àö√ºnahme sehr, sind doch unter unseren G‚àö¬ßsten auch eine Vielzahl an Einzel- und Kleinstunternehmer.¬¨‚Ä† Aber was ist mit uns, die mehr Leuten ‚àö¬∫ber Jahre und Jahrzehnten Arbeit geben?  Aus diesem Grund habe ich mich zu diesem Schritt entschlossen. Aber: wir wollen auch etwas daf‚àö¬∫r zur‚àö¬∫ck geben. Abgesehen davon, dass wir in unserem Eingangsbereich eine Liste unserer Unterst‚àö¬∫tzer bis zum Ende des Jahres aush‚àö¬ßngen, m‚àö‚àÇchten wir f‚àö¬∫r alle Spenden einen Gutschein ‚àö¬∫ber die gleiche Summe des Spendenbetrages  ausgeben. Wir werden nach der Aktion alle Namen, die durchihre Spende einen Gutschein bekommen, sammeln und f‚àö¬∫r jeden einen dementsprechenden Gutschein zum Abholen vorbereiten. Sollte jemand von zu weit au‚àö√ºerhalb einen Gutschein bekommen, so schreiben Sie uns einfach eine Nachricht auf Facebook. Diesen Gutschein schicken wir auch per Post. F‚àö¬∫r alle Wuppertaler: Bitte holen Sie den Gutschein unter Vorlage des Ausweises und der Spendenquittung bei uns ab, sobald wir wieder ge‚àö‚àÇffnet sind.  Bitte beachten Sie: der Gutschein kann nur ausgegeben werden, wenn Sie bei Ihrer Spende ihren Namen angeben.¬¨‚Ä†  Ich danke Ihnen von ganzem Herzen und hoffe, dass wir uns ganz bald wieder sehen. Und wer wei‚àö√º, vielleicht bringen Sie ja einen Gutschein mit!¬¨‚Ä†  Ihr Alexander Tsiflidis und das gesamte Hellas Team!

Michigan's¬¨‚Ä†Gov. Gretchen Whitmer signed an executive order effective on March 24th ordering non-essential businesses to temporarily close and Michiganders to stay at home in response to the spread of the novel coronavirus and its related disease COVID-19, effective through April¬¨‚Ä†13. Common Ground is deemed as an essential business which means we will continue to serve the public during these uncertain times.¬¨‚Ä†To help us keep our employees and those we serve safe, we need your help!  As we continue to serve more people, our supply of Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) decreases. If you're able to spare as little as $5, please consider donating to Common Ground, your donation can help us purchase necessary items, such as sanitizers, wipes, gloves, etc. The more we're able to protect our employees, the more we will be able to serve. campaigns.title: COVID-19 Ventilator Open Source Project
campaigns.description: The Problem:    Due to the COVID-19 virus, in the coming months, projections suggest the US could have a shortfall of over 800,000 ventilators. The US is likely to need over 1 million ventilators to treat COVID-19 patients but only has around 160,000 ventilators nationwide. Currently, US manufacturers produce just 14,000 ventilators per year and some ventilator manufacturers are ramping up production by 40%, so in a year they can produce 20,000 ventilators.¬¨‚Ä† There is simply no way for current manufacturers to even put a small dent in the number of ventilators required.    The Backstory:    COVID-19 Ventilators, Inc. was formed to tackle this challenge.¬¨‚Ä† The design team has created and is building a prototype of an Emergency Ventilator, the brainchild of CEO, Tarik Yousef.¬¨‚Ä† Yousef is a Columbus, Ohio resident - an engineer by training and a small business owner, manufacturing fine furniture. Motivated by the data and the pandemic risks we‚Äö√Ñ√¥re currently facing, he pulled a team of medical, engineering, and software experts together to design a system that can be both manufactured to support Ohio‚Äö√Ñ√¥s critical hospital capacity challenges and shared for others to modify and source for their own local needs.¬¨‚Ä†   In less than two weeks, the team worked to create a system that mimics traditional ventilators, but at a much lower cost. ¬¨‚Ä† Once the initial design was complete, Yousef connected with co-founders Liz Stump and Amanat Ahmad to set up COVID-19 Ventilators, Inc. to rapidly build a partner network to secure manufacturing and production materials, processes, and facility space for the various components. The organization is currently pending approval for 501(c)(3) status.    The Solution:    The Emergency Ventilator has comparable functionality to more sophisticated models, with high precision sensors to ensure patient safety and provide real time data and a computer learning algorithm that detects changes and adjusts in real time.¬¨‚Ä† Partnering with medical professionals, Yousef has developed a product that he says is, ‚Äö√Ñ√∫one of the only emergency ventilators being developed with a proper control interface, allowing medical professionals full access to volume, pressure settings, and data monitoring, similar to traditional ventilators.‚Äö√Ñ√π    The Need:    This project is moving extremely quickly - the design process started on March 16, 2020, and a functional prototype of the Emergency Ventilator was built and is in testing in less than two weeks.¬¨‚Ä† To turn the prototype into a scalable reality that can save lives, COVID-19 Ventilators, Inc. needs funding to build a small batch of Emergency Ventilators that can be tested in real life settings as early as the week of March 23, 2020.¬¨‚Ä† The initial prototype is completing basic in-house testing, however, we need your financial contribution immediately to:   Support the initial investment costs of the prototype and non-profit set-up Complete the final components of the first prototype Build 10 additional prototypes for clinical testing and FDA approval  As we raise additional funds, all money will be invested in future Emergency Ventilator production costs.¬¨‚Ä† If funds are raised and not needed, they will be directed towards other non-profits supporting COVID-19 community needs.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†   More information and for contact information, please see our website at:  www.covid19ventilator.org

campaigns.title: 3D Printed and Laser Cut Face Shields for COVID-19
campaigns.description: Our Makerspace, Makers Workshop in Maynard, MA, has the capacity to handle small scale manufacturing. In the current pandemic this is an asset we can lend to our community. Because of this we have worked long and hard through various PPE concepts and designs to figure out how we can do the most good with what we have.  We are making FACE SHIELDS. This design uses minimal 3D filament, and can be printed faster than other open source PPE designs that have been circulating. The headband is reusable and this design has been specifically approved of, and asked for by Emerson Hospital; they requested ‚Äö√Ñ√∫‚Äö√Ñ¬∂as many as we can make.‚Äö√Ñ√π  Challenge accepted.  We have access through one of Makers Workshop‚Äö√Ñ√¥s members to a large quantity of Petg, the clear shield component of these visors. We can cut 1 shield in about 20-40 seconds on our laser cutters, and we currently have a very large quantity of this raw material, enough to produce thousands. However, the 3D printed head pieces takes 5-7 Hours to print 2.  The Makers Workshop community is 3D Printing as many of the head bands as we can. Our printers and running nonstop, our member's printers are running nonstop, and friends in our extended network are also making as many as they can throughout the country. ¬¨‚Ä†  However, we still COULD be producing completed shields much more quickly, potentially hundreds per day, and¬¨‚Ä†we have started receiving requests from more hospitals daily.   ...so we NEED YOUR HELP.¬¨‚Ä†  Money raised here will go towards: -Shipping costs to get 3D Printed Parts to Us for Assembly -The Cost of Materials including filament and elastic, some of which are in short demand which is causing inflated prices.¬¨‚Ä† ... and other costs of business related directly to facilitating this project.¬¨‚Ä†  We are setting a low goal, but the more that we raise, the quicker we can produce for our hospitals, and the more we can produce.¬¨‚Ä†  ALSO,¬¨‚Ä†  If you have a 3D printer and are able to join the team printing parts (THE MORE THE MERRIER), please email info@makersworkshop.com to get the file and coordinate getting the parts to us so that we can assemble and deliver to Emerson Hospital, Acton Medical, and our growing list of organizations requesting them. ¬¨‚Ä†Feel free to email with any questions as well.  Thank you in advance. We can do this.  -Michael, Brooke, and the Makers Workshop Community

campaigns.title: Help me escape the Corona virus.
campaigns.description: Hello,   I'm currently living in the Guangdong province in the South of China. As many people know, the Coronavirus has gripped the country here. My entire province is on lock-down (more or less) until the middle of February 17th, with talks of extending it to March.   Food on the store shelves is scarce right now and there is little information about the situation. Right now, my employer is refusing to pay our salaries until we return to work, so I'm short on funds and flight prices out of China, when they aren't cancelled aren't always cheap.  I'm seeking help to get myself out of China on the next available flight back home. The Gofundme is going entirely to the cost of travel and to cover survival expenses while I sort out when I'll be able to return to work.

campaigns.title: Seattle Artists Relief Fund Amid COVID-19
campaigns.description: The Seattle arts community has held and nurtured me for years. Those of us in the arts community and those of us who are close to the arts community know the financial pressures that have long been increasing for those in the arts - especially for artists of color.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  Seattle has so far been the city hardest hit by the COVID-19 coronavirus. This scary and tragic¬¨‚Ä† time has a lot of people staying close to home in order to try to help prevent the spread of this virus that can be devastating to our elderly, disabled, and medically compromised friends and neighbors.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  The widespread cancellation of group events has had a disproportionate impact on the Seattle arts community - especially those who rely on gigs to pay their bills. Creatives are people whose very existence relies on what they create and people being able to access their work. Musicians, DJ‚Äö√Ñ√¥s, independent chefs, caterers, actors, directors, writers, spoken word artists, teaching artists, all of these peoples jobs rely on people showing up for events but events are being canceled.¬¨‚Ä†  I know that so far every speaking engagement I had for the next month has been cancelled or postponed, and I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m in the very rare and privileged position to be able to weather this financially. Many are not.¬¨‚Ä† We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re seeing canceled events through the end of this month and it's probably going to continue to grow. A large percentage of artists supplement their incomes with part time jobs often in the service industry which is another industry that is being hit hard.¬¨‚Ä†  So if you love Seattle art and the Seattle arts community, and you have the resources to, please consider pitching in to our relief fund. If you are familiar with similar fundraisers I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve done in the past (like for last year‚Äö√Ñ√¥s snowpocalypse), you know that this money goes directly to people in the Seattle area in need.  This fund is aimed at helping those in the greater Seattle arts community who have been financially impacted by cancellations due to COVID-19, with priority given to to BIPOC artists, transgender   nonbinary artists, and disabled artists - but we will try to help as many artists with need in Seattle as we can.  If you are an artist in need of funds,  Click Here ¬¨‚Ä† to take our survey and apply for relief.  We can get through this together.

campaigns.title: COVID-19 East Side Seattle Financial Help
campaigns.description: The Puget Sound community has held and nurtured us for years. The Puget Sound has so far been hard hit by the COVID-19 coronavirus. This scary and tragic time has a lot of people staying close to home in order to try to help prevent the spread of this virus that can be devastating to our elderly, disabled, and medically compromised friends and neighbors.   The widespread cancellation of small business-like Uber drivers, cleaning services, and cooking services has had a disproportionate impact on the community - especially those who rely on daily pay checks to pay their bills. Cleaning crew, Cooking Service Crew, and Uber drivers; all of these people‚Äö√Ñ√¥s jobs rely on people showing up or they go to someone‚Äö√Ñ√¥s home.   Due to stay home policy, Uber drivers are without any passengers and every household has denied any cleaning or cooking services for several months in future. The cancellation may continue to grow. The entire income of these people often in the service industry which is the industry that is being hit hard.   So, if you love your community, and you have the resources to, please consider pitching in to the relief fund. If you are familiar with similar fundraisers, you know that this money goes directly to people in the Puget Sound area in need.  This fund is aimed at helping those in the Puget Sound community who have been financially impacted by cancellations of household services due to COVID-19. Depending on funding levels and number of requests, priority may be given to people from communities that have been historically and systemically economically disadvantaged in the Puget Sound Area. But we will try to help as many with need as we can as long as we have funds. We will basically keep going until we run out of money or this crisis ends - whichever comes sooner.   Where your funds go : 100% of these funds will go to who have lost income due to cancellations and work stoppage due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is emergency funding to help Uber Drivers, Cleaning Crews, and Cooking Crew in need with rent, food, utilities, and medical needs. The amount given to each is determined based on how many funds we receive, how much have lost due to cancellations, and how many apply. We use these factors to calculate what percentage of each individual request we can pay each individual. We are currently giving a minimum of $500 and a maximum of $5000 to each family.   How Funds will get to the individuals: We will send funds to the mailing address, PayPal or Zelle indicated in the application. We've partnered with  API Chaya  and others shown in the ""Team"" below to serve as an accountability and oversight partner.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  More overseer will be added as they volunteer.

campaigns.title: Moms&Children Enrichment Services in Corona,Queens
campaigns.description: Greetings and thank you so much for taking the time to visit my page.  My heart is full and excited to share my business with the Corona/Elmhurst communities. With professional/academic experience working in Harlem, Bed-Stuy, along with out-of state experience in the Roxbury/Dorchester/Jamaica Plain communities in Boston, I am truly proud and ecstastic to share my learnings, resources and heart into my own local community.¬¨‚Ä†  With your financial support, I will be able to provide workforce development to moms in the community, due to a variety of societal circumstances, are unable to secure FT/PT work experience and training to add financial support their families. I also provide AP/Honor Roll teen scholars and artists the opportunity to tutor and teach Arts enrichment activities ranging from Intro to Dance, Intro to Vocal and Intro to Theatre/Improv.  In addition, my business offers enrichment activities ranging from early childhood enrichment, tutoring and school age afterschool and arts-based enrichment programs for the Corona/Elmhurst community. ¬¨‚Ä†All quality services are offered at low-cost, affordable options with proven impact on the school readiness and future career success of our community's children.   As a born and raises native to the Corona/Elmhurst area, I can attest that access to quality and affordable enrichment and tutoring has and remains completely underrepresented. Leaving our children at tremendous academic advantage by the time they reach high school/ college level.  As both a parent and native to the Corona/Elmhurst community, it is my intention, goal and mission to provide much needed enrichment and social services resources into my hometown and broader historically underrepresented communities in Queens, NY. ¬¨‚Ä†Having worked and volunteered countless hours over the past 20 years in the nonprofit /social services / education enrichment industries, I'm determined ""to be the change in the world I want to see"".  Help me infuse opportunity and hope into the future of Corona/Elmhurst children and families. One Smile at a time.¬¨‚Ä†  Donate $5 Today! Thank you for your support in the movement.

So while we are working and while we are healthy let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s get resources to each other now! A quid! Two quid! A billion sod it lets help now before quarantine! And before no hope for some,¬¨‚Ä† let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s do this Brucie
campaigns.location_city: Pudsey, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom

campaigns.title: Help Cooking For Freedom buy food during Covid19
campaigns.description: Cooking For Freedom is a group made up of people seeking asylum in Ireland who decided to organise to cook for ourselves and our families. We are parents and people living in a Direct Provision centre in Dublin. Due to the Corona Virus pandemic we are trying to keep oursleves, our families and each other safe with all the advice from medical experts. Social distancing is incredibly hard for us when we are forced to live in centres where we have to eat in canteens and share communal spaces. There are lots of kids and people with medical conditions and its difficult for all of us to stay in our rooms without enough supplies.¬¨‚Ä† We need help and support from others to do our best to prevent the spread of Covid19.¬¨‚Ä†  We want to raise some money so that we can buy groceries and supplies that will allow us to cook healthy nutritious and eat in our own rooms.¬¨‚Ä† If you can please donate some money to support us to do this, and if you can't donate please share with others who could.  In these difficult times its more important than ever that we continue to support and look after each other.    Together we will get through this.    Stay safe and thanks  3   About us:   http://cookingforfreedom.ie/about-us.php    https://www.rte.ie/amp/1014346/

campaigns.title: West Sydney COVID-19 Mutual Aid
campaigns.description: The current and ongoing pandemic surrounding the outbreak of COVID-19 has resulted in a scary time. As we battle the Virus, keeping each other safe and healthy, all whilst worrying about employment security, our future and much more, we need to ensure that we are also working in solidarity to protect our communities. In Western Sydney, with Emerton shops having shut down, this has left many families and households in public housing in a very difficult position. The sick, the elderly and those without means of independent transport are left in vulnerable positions, low on basic supplies and amenities needed to survive, and will be at risk of jeopardising their health and safety by fending for themselves to obtain already scarce supplies.It has become apparent that our governments, self-fulfilling political institutions and charities remain oblivious to the struggle of people in our local communities. In upholding the traditions of mutual aid, it is upon us to do the work, for solidarity, for community self defence. Collective care is our best weapon to fight the Virus. As a collective comprised of members of the community, as well as people working in social services we have a direct understanding of which and what supplies are needed and where they need to go to be the most beneficial. We have spent our time on the ground at the forefront, door knocking and checking in on residents and families and helping with what they need far more rapidly than social services, whilst maintaining strict health and safety sanitary measures.Whilst we are absolutely grateful for the donations we have received in the form of supplies, due the uncertainty of the length of pandemic, the scarcity of spare supplies and the volume of residents we hope to help has meant this won't be sustainable in the long run. As many have contacted us offering financial donations, we have set this up as a means of helping out. No amount is too little. Let us prove to ourselves that, rather than relying on the self-fulfilling political institutions and careerist politicians, we have the capacities to care for, nurture, build and support our own communities. If not you, then who? If not now, then when?*Disclaimer*Whilst our target budget was set at a particular amount, this was purely the generic target set by GoFund me, ¬¨‚Ä†the reality is that our financial target at this point remains to be dynamic and relative to the duration of the pandemic and how many people we are able to assist in the long run.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Coronavirus Fighters
campaigns.description: Hello my name is GenZjab and i want too help out my community ""Wenatchee"" and hopefully if this gets enough recognition i would really want to help out the country fight off the coronavirus. Many of us are fortunate enough to by the necessities to keep us from harm of the virus however there are also many people that do not have enough money to buy simple necessities. That's why I want to help out my community by buying simple necessities like hand sanitizer, face mask, soap(for washing hands) and food for many people here where i live. It'll mean alot too me if you guys can help me out by donating money and like i said if hopefully this gets enough of recognition i can help out the country:)

campaigns.title: Please Help Stop the Spread of COVID-19
campaigns.description: Aviva has spent years preparing for her Bat mitzvah (‚óä√´√∑‚àë√∑¬∫‚óä‚Ñ¢ ‚óä√ª√∑¬•‚óä¬∂√∑‚àû‚óä√Ø√∑‚àè‚óä√Æ), a Jewish coming of age ritual. Unfortunately, her special day has been postponed due to the Coronavirus Pandemic. Although she is disappointed, it doesn't pale in comparison to the people who are affected by this disease, especially those who are most vulnerable in our society.¬¨‚Ä†  Aviva has asked that we help make a difference on behalf of her and Emanuel Congregation Chicago by raising money to benefit the Coronavirus Relief Fund. The COVID-19 pandemic has killed more than 5,000 people and spread to more than 100 countries. Donations to this fund will help stop the spread of COVID-19 and support urgent response efforts.¬¨‚Ä†  Please help Aviva and Emanuel Congregation Chicago raise money to fight the Coronavirus and help those most in need.

campaigns.title: Help Hubei Province Fight Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Ivy International Group (IIG), in partnership with our international education community, including all who support our students, is facilitating a fundraiser for the  Hubei Charity Federation (HBCF).  ¬¨‚Ä† HBCF works to support those impacted by the Novel Coronavirus in Hubei Province, the center of the crisis and the most severely hit so far.   This is a matching gift campaign.¬¨‚Ä† IIG will match -  dollar for dollar  - all donations received up to $15,000. All donations received will go towards this effort.  To date, February 12th, the outbreak has affected hundreds of thousands of people. There have been over 43,000 confirmed cases and 800 deaths worldwide. The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared it a  Public Health Emergency of International Concern ,¬¨‚Ä†help and support is urgently needed.  The Hubei Charity Federation - a China-based humanitarian aid organization - is working tirelessly to contain this virus and protect the world. The donated funds will be used in the efforts to fight against the virus and treat patients in Hubei Province.¬¨‚Ä†   Coronavirus is the common enemy of every human being across the world. As an individual, we can do so little - but together we can make a real impact. Our contributions will have real significance for those suffering and working to contain and fight the virus in Hubei Province.¬¨‚Ä†  Remember, Ivy International Group will match - dollar for dollar - all donations received up to $15,000!   Thank you for your contribution and please share this page!   All the best, The Ivy International Group Family   More information on the Hubei Charity Foundation can be found on¬¨‚Ä†  http://www.hbcf.org.cn/  . campaigns.title: RACCOLTA FONDI PER EMERGENZA  COVID-19 IN SARDEGNA
campaigns.description: Questa raccolta fondi servir‚àö‚Ä† per finanziare l'acquisto di strumenti necessari per contrastare l'emergenza data dall'espansione del virus COVID-19.  Molto spesso non sappiamo a chi rivolgerci per donare e per questa ragione pubblichiamo questa raccolta.   Essendo ormai stato adottato da questa splendida regione ed avendo organizzato in Sardegna molte mostre fotografiche negli anni precedenti, io sottoscritto Stefano Lotumolo, fotografo freelance, insieme alla mia ragazza Ludovica Cristofaro di Olbia e tanti altri amici Sardi abbiamo sentito il bisogno di supportare, per quanto possibile, la Sardegna.  Con Simonetta Selloni, giornalista della Nuova Sardegna, ci siamo confrontati ed abbiamo deciso che la raccolta dovesse avere come beneficiario chi si trova veramente in ¬¨‚Ä†situazioni di necessit‚àö‚Ä†.  Chiunque si stia impegnando per contenere nel miglior modo possibile questa emergenza, gli infermieri, i medici, i volontari che sono sul campo quotidianamente. Forniremo mascherine, tamponi, tutto ci‚àö‚â§ che possa essere utile per sostenerli in sicurezza, altrimenti gli ospedali diverranno come al Nord luogo di contagio.  Saremo in contatto con molte associazioni della regione ed il nostro supporto, il supporto di tutta una regione, sar‚àö‚Ä† mirato e diretto.  La consegna del denaro avverr‚àö‚Ä† in maniera trasparente e sar‚àö‚Ä† visibile, centesimo per centesimo, sulla nostra pagina Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/stefanolotumoloofficial/.   Ognuno di voi pu‚àö‚â§ condividere la raccolta. Pu‚àö‚â§ parteciparvi. Facciamo arrivare questo messaggio a pi‚àöœÄ persone possibili. Restiamo uniti. Andr‚àö‚Ä† tutto bene.

campaigns.title: Battle Against The Coronavirus
campaigns.description: In the first month of this year, however, a sudden outbreak of the novel Coronavirus turned the entire world into a mess and put everyone on alert. This novel Coronavirus is a contagious virus originated from Wuhan, China that can cause symptoms such as fever, cough, breathing difficulties, pneumonia, severe respiratory syndromes, and even death. It expanded rapidly after it was developed through different ways of transmission including animals to humans and humans to humans, just like how common cold is spread.  Several countries around the globe including Italy, China, United States, Japan, Australia, France, Germany, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, Korea, and Finland were already found to be infected with this lethal virus. According to the Chinese government officials, this novel Coronavirus first appeared in a seafood market on December 12, 2019. Within a short month, the number of people who are confirmed to be infected with this coronavirus had already become 86,657 along with 2305 deaths. the W.H.O (World Health Organization) declared the outbreak of this novel Coronavirus to be a global health emergency. Starting from February 1, 2020, travel to China , Italy , Iran, South Correa was restricted and this would lead to huge economic downfalls in every single country. Currently, tons of doctors and medical workers were fighting against the Coronavirus at the front line, and many of them had sacrificed their lives. With a tremendous amount of infected patients, China and many countries were facing medical shortages. Most of the hospitals in China desperately need supplies including masks, goggles, and protective suits. Without these types of equipment, the medical workers can be easily exposed to the Coronavirus and this can make the situation worse. So, we need your help! We appreciate everyone that is willing to participate in this fundraiser and all of the generous contributions from you will be used to purchase protective medical equipment including protective suits, N95 masks, and medical goggles. All of these were in urgent need for those medical workers in the front line. We will ensure all funds that we received will be used to purchase these types of equipment and we will update the processes. Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s all fight against the Coronavirus together

campaigns.title: The Jerseys - COVID-19 Live Stream Fundraiser
campaigns.description: We are raising money for The Jerseys living expenses during the COVID-19 outbreak by providing a live stream show on Facebook. Due to the social distancing measures imposed all their performances up and down the country have been cancelled.

campaigns.title: COVID-19: Chromebooks for Students without Access
campaigns.description: Hello Friends,  In light of the Corona Virus pandemic, the bay area  schools have been asked to move online .   Seventeen of my¬¨‚Ä† thirty students do not have access to computers at home . Because of this I fear that their education will suffer due to their lack of resources.  I am asking for your financial support in order to purchase the supplies needed to make sure that these students get a chance to stay up to standard during this shelter in place order.  The money donated will go to giving the kids, who do not have an accessible computer at home, a chromebook and supplies so that they will be able to join in our zoom online classes and complete their given assignments.  The chrome books cost about  $250 per unit  and I have  seventeen students  without computer access in my class. Getting them access to a chrome book is my main priority. I am also trying to supply students with headsets so that they can communicate during the online classes as well as when they video conference in groups. Lastly, any extra funds will go to books for their required bookclubs and extra supplies when needed.  These chrome books will be able to be reused in following years to make sure all student are able to complete computer assignments at home.  The financial goal of this go fund me will be  $5,000  but any donation would be a gift to us during these uncertain times.  Any help would be appreciated by classroom 16 during this time! We hope to keep learning and exploring regardless of whether in the classroom or beyond.  Ms. Richards

campaigns.title: Emergency Housing During COVID-19
campaigns.description: We are raising money to cover housing for two weeks for an unhoused person in our community, who lives out of their car. During this time of COVID-19 and talk of a mandatory quarantine/city lockdown, we feel it to be important to secure shelter for this community member who was recently released from a week-long hospitalization last month and just yesterday received four shots in their brain to offset the neurological symptoms and pain caused by the car accident in which they were a mere passenger.   Please share what you can as well as this link. We appreciate your support in advance! Our goal is to have them housed by today. Thank you for your consideration!

campaigns.description: Trying to keep my barbers alive for the next 30 days while we‚Äö√Ñ√¥re shut down because of coronavirus! Anything would be great thanks!

campaigns.title: NYC Freelancers/Artist relief fund- Covid-19
campaigns.description: UPDATE SUNDAY MARCH 22- The first $1000 dollars were sent today to the first round of applicants! Very excited to help in anyway possible your donations are helping many.  UPDATE Tuesday March 17- First Donations will go out Next week!! At this moment there are a lot more applications than Donations therefore I have to pause taking new applications and try to focus more on spreading the word and get more donations to help more people. If you have any connections to any non profits or other networks that could help or are interested to team up please connect with me, For now please donate if you can or please share it with your friends!    UPDATE Sunday march 15- Applications are coming fast- However the donations are not coming as fast as the applications- Please if you have the means or know people who can help. Share this gofund me with them.    Many industries in NYC are shutting down due to the Coronavirus, causing a lot of us to loose gigs and jobs that we rely on. This unanticipated loss of income is putting a heavy stress on our financial day to day life. Many of us are unsure of how we will pay for things like rent, food, and medical bills. It's time to come together and support each other in any way possible. Now, some of us are more stable than others:¬¨‚Ä† and thats when this gofund me page comes. Give what you can, when you can‚Äö√Ñ¬∂. and if you can't at this moment it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s OK too. You can also help by sharing this fundraiser on your wall, or passing it along among friends or people who you think could potentially give at this time.    How will funds be distributed? There are hundreds and hundreds of New Yorkers who could benefit from this: we all have a friend who is a photographer, actor, artist, performer etc‚Äö√Ñ¬∂ EVERYONE is welcome to apply, however those whose income has been severely disrupted or even come to a halt as a result of COVID are especially encouraged to apply. The goal is to get funds out to most applicants within 4-5 business days. The idea is to support as many people as possible so it may not be feasible to provide the full amount of money requested. The amount provided will be dependent on the amount of donations and volume of requests which are received IF YOU NEED HELP PLEASE TAKE THIS SURVEY   https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/H5X5YWL    for full transparency all funds will be distribute by Jonah Larrama who is base in Bushwick Brooklyn NYC Instagram @jonahlarrama IMDB Jonah Larrama FB: Jonah Larrama      For other resources check:¬¨‚Ä†  https://docs.google.com/document/d/1htY4q6Aq2cg1OU7p2Q6i9x8EZy-aOxgLooUp6kgxZzw/mobilebasic?fbclid=IwAR3x2VMFVig4Eod3IkYQmOAXebmSfXVHCN9N8xWtjKdPZJgnUSoLclWyfNM        https://covid19freelanceartistresource.wordpress.com/?fbclid=IwAR1Z1VF99VwqQtuDkWzVJYBLoYGL1YjwmaHjejaFTIcuKrwJIdcWPEZ0iP8 ¬¨‚Ä†    Bartender Emergency program  https://www.usbgfoundation.org/beap?fbclid=IwAR3UCX78h7x1ybt6AIvq_RbWenvoVS2aJTqCTmGG2Jv9lKd3BHYDN2cquBY       https://www.gofundme.com/f/nyc-lowincome-artistfreelancer-relief-fund?utm_medium=copy_link utm_source=customer utm_campaign=p_lico+share-sheet ¬¨‚Ä†   The Hebrew Free Loan Society is given free interest loans; Things you'll need¬¨‚Ä† 1- live in NYC 5 boroughs 2-Have annual Pre tax household below 85k for one person and so on.. 3-Provide one guarantor who has credit, credit report etc Check their application here:  https://hfls.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2020-coronavirus-bridge-loan-application.pdf       Not NYC but wanted to share   Seattle:¬¨‚Ä† https://www.gofundme.com/f/for-artists ¬¨‚Ä†  Texas:¬¨‚Ä† https://www.ilostmygig.com/

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Emergency Fund for Shauna Horn
campaigns.description: Dear Family and Friends,  It‚Äö√Ñ√¥s with a heavy heart that I notify you all that my mother, Shauna Horn has been diagnosed with COVID-19. With my father being unable to work because of his disability, my mother is the sole provider of our family of five. My mother works in healthcare as the Director of Operations for a Physician Services Group and she‚Äö√Ñ√¥s on the leadership team at their sister hospital in South Carolina; she is on the front lines of this. At this time, my mother is showing aggressive symptoms and will be hospitalized in the coming days. With my mother being sick, my father unable to work, and with me in Kansas City working with the University of Missouri Kansas City, financially we cannot do it. Due to the overwhelming nature of these events, we are asking for help to cover medical and living expenses.  I am overwhelmed and thankful by the number of people reaching out and asking how they can support. First, please pray. While we are in a turbulent time now, we have a long road ahead of us. Second, please consider giving your support as we begin this long journey of healing and rebuilding. I will continue to update you as things develop, but know that I believe we will overcome this.   Thank you so much for your support, ¬¨‚Ä† Justice Horn

We cannot afford to lose our jobs , that help support our families with a roof over our head and food on our table.   I am a father of a¬¨‚Ä† child who has special needs.. Anyone who has a family or friend with special needs knows how hard it is to keep up financially with ongoing day to day therapies. Without these therapies,the future of our child is also in danger.I am asking to please donate whatever your can through our GoFundMe page.  We love the people of Albany Park and hope we will be able to continue our business here. We hope we can continue to serve you and build more friendships in the future. Thank you for the consideration.  Dimitri and staff

campaigns.title: Pittsburgh Covid-19 LGBTQIA Emergency Relief Fund
campaigns.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has exposed the particular vulnerability of our LGBTQIA+ people, especially those of color. Due to our community disproportionately experiencing a lifelong arc of violence and discrimination, many of our community members are impoverished and housing unstable.  Many folks in our community are self-employed or in the service economy, living with disabilities, chronic illnesses, and/or compromised immune systems.¬¨‚Ä†  Realizing a need for mutual aid for our communities at this time, and inspired by Ijeoma Oluo's efforts to support her community of fellow artists in Seattle  ¬¨‚Ä† Amita Swadhin organizer of CVOID-19 Relief Fund For LGBTQI+ BIPOC, Sisters PGH launched this fund on March 18th, 2020 and has since invited our trusted comrades Ciora Thomas,¬¨‚Ä† Aiden James Nevils, Aude Giglietti, Virginia Beck, Jim De‚Äö√Ñ√¥poe, Christina Acuna Castillo, to help manage the financial records and design and manage the process of fund distribution. We are all also open to other partnerships and relationships that would help this fund reach as many LGBTQIA people and organizations in Allegheny County as possible!!  We are prioritizing displaced LGBTQIA+ people because we have historically and currently faced increased barriers - including fewer ties to familial support networks, being simultaneously underserved and over-surveilled by welfare state systems, our needs have been surplus to mainstream political formations, and we tend to work in the gig economy (making us eligible to even receive unemployment.).¬¨‚Ä†  We recognize that the nation-state does not provide a safety net for so many people and that the United States government‚Äö√Ñ√¥s response to COVID-19 has only deepened pre-existing hierarchies that make specific communities more vulnerable to premature death. We hope for a world in which universal basic income, universal health care, and other functioning social systems exist. We know that what we are doing is an imperfect solution to a very large problem, but we are trying anyway.  We talked with other mutual aid funds about how they decided to distribute the money they raised and decided that we wanted to absolutely avoid parsing through people‚Äö√Ñ√¥s narratives and deciding whose needs were more important than others. We agree with Adrienne Maree Brown who quotes Lao Tzu (author of Tao Te Ching) in Emergent Strategy: ‚Äö√Ñ√∫If you do not trust the people, they will become untrustworthy.‚Äö√Ñ√π  We are choosing to trust the people. We are not social workers and we refuse to replicate that position and dynamic. Most of the pool of people who have requested funds thus far are not employed full time, have a chronic illness or disability, and were already struggling prior to COVID-19 closures. Now our community is facing an even more urgent need, and we ask our community to respond.  The application to receive funds will go LIVE March 20th, 2020 and will stay open for as long as we are able to distribute funds to our communities, meaning, we will need as much support as possible to continue supporting our LGBTQIA communities of Allegheny County.  We will continue to update here and within the campaign of our progress as we move along.  Thank you for your support!    More information about sisTers PGH: SisTers PGH is a transLED, transgender community center, that provides supportive services, shelter and housing for the trans and non binary communities of Pittsburgh, PA. SisTers PGH, also offers outreach, trans inclusion training, advocacy, and People's Pride PGH while offering opportunities for our trans communities too thrive instead of survive.   A primary function of SisTers PGH is to amplify the voices of trans people within conversations around housing access, art, city/state leadership, mental health support, medical care, employment opportunities, and education..   We have learned via lived experience, that transgender leadership amplifies our ability to serve our communities in capacities that are truly effective and influential. In the words of Tarana Burke ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Victims know what they need; give them the resources to do it.‚Äö√Ñ√π Having Trans leaders provides a voice that can garner the creation of inclusionary change within cisgender dominant spaces.   SisTers Community Center functions as a safe and brave space for our trans and nonbinary community members of Pittsburgh. Those seeking daytime respite from homelessness and/or needing supportive services like food, clothing, toiletries, tutoring/GED Prep, Name Change services, employment, medical or mental health referrals, case management, housing, and rent/utility support.   Bimonthly Groups will also be held for the trans communities with topics that vary into mental health, safety, gender, sexual health, drug addiction, leadership, race, housing and healing, just to name a few.  www.sisterspgh.org

campaigns.title: Ayuda para salvar a nuestros Abuelos #Covid19
campaigns.description: Amlul + Gala Gonz‚àö¬∞lez necesitan  vuestra ayuda para auxiliar a NUESTROS MAYORES , quienes m‚àö¬∞s  est‚àö¬∞n sufriendo los efectos del COVID-19.    ¬¨‚Ä† Durante las ‚àö‚à´ltimas semanas todos estamos experimentando una situaci‚àö‚â•n nueva e inesperada desde el punto vista social y sanitario y  ahora m‚àö¬∞s que nunca, podemos ayudar a los que m‚àö¬∞s est‚àö¬∞n sufriendo.      El cuidado de los mayores se est‚àö¬∞ complicando por falta de recursos y contagio del personal.   Los j‚àö‚â•venes tenemos la responsabilidad de actuar ahora mas que nunca  y cuidar de todos nuestros abuelos con  un peque‚àö¬±o gesto de generosidad.     Los fondos recaudados ir‚àö¬∞n a Asociaci‚àö‚â•n Ben‚àö¬©fica Geri‚àö¬∞trica Ib‚àö¬©rica , voluntarios que llevan m‚àö¬∞s de 20 a‚àö¬±os trabajando por los m‚àö¬∞s ancianos, y tiene su sede en Madrid.    A trav‚àö¬©s de su proyecto ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Abrazos Solidarios‚Äö√Ñ√π   buscan cubrir todas las necesidades de nuestros abuelos  y mayores  durante la situaci‚àö‚â•n actual que estamos viviendo en Espa‚àö¬±a.     Se necesita m‚àö¬∞s material sanitario:    -Vespiradores  -Guantes  -Batas  -Mascarillas  -Calzas  -Gafas de protecci‚àö‚â•n  -Alimentos para aquellos que viven solos  -Asistencia    Y todo lo necesario para la atenci‚àö‚â•n y asistencia de pacientes y trabajadores.   Necesitamos ser muy r‚àö¬∞pidos  ¬¨¬∞Muchas Gracias!  *****************  Amlul + Gala Gonzalez need your help!¬¨‚Ä†    We all have parents, grandparents and elderly ones and they NEED US .  They have been the most affected by #covid19  Everyday It‚Äö√Ñ√¥s becoming increasingly more difficult to be able to assist everyone without sanitary equipment making care givers fall ill with the virus.   As the Youth, we all have the responsibility to act .  Your donations will make a huge different to help those who made possible for us to be here today through a small act of generosity.     All funds raised by @GalaGonz‚àö¬∞lez and #Amlul will be donated directly to the Asociaci‚àö‚â•n Geri‚àö¬∞trica Ib‚àö¬©rica  ( a non profit organisation of volunteers with more than 20 years of experience helping the elderly ).   ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Abrazos Solidarios‚Äö√Ñ√π is a project to help finance  all the current needs our grandparents and old ones are facing daily during this difficult times in Spain.    We need your help to raise money for more sanitary equipment like:   - ventilation devices  - gloves  - EPI suits - masks - protection googles  -Delivery and good for those who love alone    And all the needed tools in order to assist patients and care givers .  Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s act fast! Thank You !

campaigns.title: Help Coyne & Luc with lost wages:COVID-19 Furlough
campaigns.description: Hi everyone,  My name is Luc (they/them), and I am fundraising on behalf of my partner Coyne (they/them). We are two nonbinary people that live in the DC area.¬¨‚Ä†  This afternoon, after a weeklong period of reduced hours, Coyne was informed that they have, along with their coworkers, been furloughed from their position at Dog Tag Bakery due to the coronavirus outbreak. The period of this furlough is indefinite, but is apparently expected to be at least six weeks, very likely more.  Given this situation, we are raising funds to meet the  equivalent of 6-8 weeks of lost wages (including tips), as that is currently the shortest period of time we expect them to experience lost income. T he application for unemployment ¬¨‚Ä†benefits process is currently murky (because they have not been officially fired, but instead have, in the ‚Äö√Ñ√∫furlough,‚Äö√Ñ√π been assigned 0 hours to their schedule indefinitely). We are in the process of soliciting legal advice and guidance on applying for unemployment benefits, but are taking this time to reach out for help during this uncertain time.¬¨‚Ä†  Coyne is also interviewing for other positions that are community-minded in the DC area, preferably with an LGBTQ+ activism and engagement component to them. :) For the moment, during the DC Department of Health advisories of self-isolation, most places are not hiring, but Coyne has one interview set up already and we are looking for more. If you have any leads please feel free to reach out to us!¬¨‚Ä†  We love you all, and thank you for your support  , if you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re not in a position to donate, for your well wishes   spreading the word. Please be kind to each other, and keep others in mind + consider supporting others who have also been affected if you have the means.¬¨‚Ä†  Love to all,¬¨‚Ä† Luc and Coyne

campaigns.title: Financial Hardship due to Covid-19 in NYC

Nightclubs, movie theaters, small theater houses, and concert venues must all close. The order will go into effect Tuesday, March 17 at 9:00 AM‚Äö√Ñ√π (nyc.gov, 2020).  I have been a full-time student at LIM College in Manhattan for over a year now, and bartending to make ends meet for the past year. This announcement brings a great deal of financial fear. It is very difficult for me to put together this page, as I have always worked hard to pay bills. In New York, bartenders are being left with no options. The amount I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m asking for covers 2 months worth of expenses - rent, bills, and food.  I know we are all facing difficult times and economic uncertainty, so I understand if you are unable to give; however, I would be so very appreciative of whatever you can give and can assure you that I am taking all the necessary strides to insure I will be taken care of during this time.  Thank you for all your prayers and support ‚Äö√π¬ß√î‚àè√®

campaigns.description: You can help several Ireland's Four Provinces employees   their families immediately. ¬¨‚Ä†Many are impacted by the loss of income due to COVID-19 mandated closures.   Because so many friends and patrons have shown concern for what the much-loved 4P's employees are experiencing, I'm happy to organize this fundraising effort in support of our kitchen/dining/bar staff. Many of our employees depend entirely on tips earned from service; with that income gone, even the current gov't relief measures won't address some of their most immediate needs. I am very familiar‚Äö√Ñ√¨ having held a wait staff position for many years at 4P's before becoming a manager. Many of the 4P's staff are worried, so I'm hoping this effort can provide a little relief.  The 4P‚Äö√Ñ√¥s has always been a generous and proud supporter of so many schools, businesses, and organizations in the community! Owners Colm and Ciara are passionate about their ties to Falls Church friends, and especially to their close-knit family of employees. They are doing everything they can to reach out, lend help, and retain their staff during this shut-down. They've even generously pledged to match donations up to $10,000! Please contribute if you can: no amount is too small, and every considerate gift will be directly helping vulnerable staff through this difficult time. Please note that this is a staff-only benefit: donations will be equitably distributed directly to kitchen/dining/bar staff in need.   These workers have¬¨‚Ä†  provided great  ¬¨‚Ä†service and contributed to so many happy times over the years... Please consider helping them through this difficult time. We all look forward to seeing them back soon!  Thank you for your interest   support! -Tammy (4P's manager)
