campaigns.title: Kula Yoga Shala COVID19 #SmallBusinessRelief
campaigns.description: Kula has been the yogic heart of our community for 10 years! ¬¨‚Ä†  Please consider offering a donation to help our beloved studio with the loss of business due to this pandemic. If a donation isn't possible, please share this fundraiser if it is in your heart to do so.    In deep gratitude for the Kula Tribe.    https://www.kulayogashala.com  ¬¨‚Ä†  A note from our brewmaster, Scott Feinberg...¬¨‚Ä†  ""After much consideration of many different angles and giving deep thought about what constitutes most authentically embodying the teachings we collectively cherish, I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve made the decision that the most responsible way for us to support the health of our community is to temporarily close our shala, for the time being, beginning this Tuesday. In the spirit of ahimsa (the foundational yogic principle of non-violence), it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s important that we do not contribute to the unintended spreading of the coronavirus within our community. While in many ways this is a difficult decision, I believe it is the right one.  Yoga comes in many forms. So does community. This is an unprecedented time in our lives and calls upon our capacity to recognize that the most powerful way to support our community is by staying home over the coming days and curbing the spread of the virus. It is simply too much risk to even have willing students and teachers share a practice space when non-symptomatic carriers may spread the virus and in turn impact the lives of others in our community, especially our highly vulnerable elders.  I do not have an exact date that we will re-open our doors as we will continue to monitor the situation and make the wisest decision based upon the fluid nature of this crisis. If we can all stick together through this and do our part, we will hopefully be back practicing together sooner rather than later.  We are looking into online options for Kula classes and as we progress in our research we will, of course, keep you informed. Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s be creative in how we can keep sewing the threads of conscious, heart-centered community in new ways. Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s continue to support one another even as we may have different views in regard to what constitutes appropriate action. Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s help one another through this time as we will need that more and more and in varied forms in the coming weeks and months. And most of all let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s continue to stand with integrity and in loving kindness as we make our way through this together.""   With Community At Heart,  ¬¨‚Ä†  Scott

campaigns.title: COVID-19 relief
campaigns.description: Hello,  My friend, who shall remain anonymous, is an undocumented immigrant.¬¨‚Ä†He is a husband, a father, and one of the hardest-working people I have ever been lucky enough to work alongside. Currently he holds down two full-time jobs washing dishes to support his family. Although the conditions are often unideal, I have never seen him upset or act put-upon. He is always friendly, always helpful, always willing to do what is necessary.¬¨‚Ä† Due the Covid-19 epidemic restaurants are currently open, but only permitted to serve food in carry-out containers. Because of this, restaurant staffing is minimal and my friend has been laid off from both of his jobs. ¬¨‚Ä†Because he is not documented, my friend is not eligible to receive unemployment assistance. When I saw him today, he told me had already been to seven different restaurants, inquiring if the needed a help washing dishes, and they had all turned him away.¬¨‚Ä† I understand everyone is financially stretched right now. There is no telling how long things will last, or what shape they might take in the future. But now is the time to band together, to help those in need. My friend is worried about not making his rent payment. He has limited options for employment due to both documentation and language-barrier issues. He has a family to look after. I would really like to alleviate some of the financial pressure and make sure their rent is payed this month. Please give whatever you can; a little goes a long ways.

campaigns.title: Surviving During The Corona Virus
campaigns.description: Hi my name is Lana. I am a student in Barelona, Spain. I am raising money for my tuition in here that  I need to pay in 5 months starting from April . I am looking for help because it is not only the tuition fees that I need to pay but also the rent and some amenities to support my live in Barcelona.  The economic situation in Spain actually been worst since the last week of february, the tourist stop coming, many event cancelled and it is true that most companies are afraid of hiring new emloyees. So it was already difficult for me to find the part time and temporary job. Then with the situation in Spain now, all the  job vancancies are closed , they  stopped the part time job , and even the  demand of freelancing  on the internet  are going down (even cancelled!).   I cannot go back either because it will put risk on my family, the airlines cancelling the flight (if there is any it would be super expensive because it will put risk for all the poeple on the airplane), and the goverment start to close the border. I cannot ask my family the money, because the economic situation is not affected only in Spain but global, so the currency also change.¬¨‚Ä†  If you could help me to solve my situation I will be appreciated a lot. The  minimun you can donate is 5‚Äö√á¬®.  If by the end I will end up with more than my target and  manage to pay for my tution and rent  I will use the rest of the money to help people fight¬¨‚Ä† the corona in Spain. Because I noticed that we are also running out of mask, gloves, and medic due to the number that keep increasing in Spain, 1000 people are affected per day! I need to take care of myself however, I don't want to be selfish to think of only me while others are also fighting their lives.

campaigns.title: Queer Tango Festivalito | COVID-19
campaigns.description: Due to COVID-19 and the March 10th statement from the Alameda Public Health Department, we are cancelling our 2020 Festivalito with Gaston and the rest of our March events.   http://www.acphd.org/2019-ncov.aspx    This yearly festival is one of two queer tango festivals in the USA, we spend 8 months planning it, and it's quite stunning to cancel. However, we feel our first responsibility as a dance community is to keep each other safe. When this all passes, we will dance it up again!¬¨‚Ä†  BIG ASK:  Please help us mitigate the loss of income for both Gaston and Abrazo. We will split the profits 70/30 with Gaston, after taxes and fees.¬¨‚Ä†  70% will go to Gaston to cover the cost of his flight (he came here from Buenos Aires on his own dime) and part of his lost income.   30% of your donation will go to Abrazo to fund our 2021 festival‚Äö√Ñ√Æas the income from each festival funds the next as well as our weekly classes. We will also pay Finnish Hall,¬¨‚Ä† a non-profit organization,¬¨‚Ä† our regular (non festival) rental fees for March, to help them cover rental losses.¬¨‚Ä†  Thank you very much for supporting Bay Area Queer Tango.¬¨‚Ä†  As always, wishing you all the joy your heart can hold.¬¨‚Ä†  Abrazo Queer Tango  For Go Fund Me, Added at your request to our story:¬¨‚Ä† Who you are and where you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re from: I'm Karen, I'm from Pittsburgh, PA. I live in the SF Bay Area Your relationship or contact to the parties you're raising funds for: I'm one of the organizers of Abrazo Queer Tango, the volunteer organization that puts on a year tango festival and this year is hosting a teacher, Gaston. We are raising funds for Gaston and Abrazo.¬¨‚Ä† How the funds will be spent (be specific as possible): We are using the funds to pay Gaston, to pay for our next festival in 2021 and our March rental space at Finnish Hall.¬¨‚Ä† Your withdrawal plan: I will see Gaston next week, and we will divide the profits as described above. I pay Finnish Hall via a check. Let me know if you have any more questions. Thanks.

campaigns.title: Supporting us through Covid-19
campaigns.description: Following the Covid-19 outbreak, we are raising money in aid of Pontypool and Blaenavon Railway in order to compensate for lost revenue during this extended period of closure.¬¨‚Ä†  Wholly run by volunteers the railway relies on visitors as its main source of income. While there are no trains the overheads remains the same.  As well as our energy tariffs, due to the size and complexity of our operation and infrastructure we have a large Insurance overhead (circa ¬¨¬£1000 per month), this is not optional and must be in place regardless of the running of trains. Also there is the ongoing maintenance activities, these are cyclic and our volunteers will be required to continue to undertake these activities. While their time is cost free, the materials and facilities to carry out these tasks is not.¬¨‚Ä†  The cost of an adult ticket is ¬¨¬£10, but even if you can afford a fraction of that we would be very grateful indeed.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Feeding Virginia‚Äö√Ñ√¥s Children During COVID19 closure
campaigns.description: Virginia Governor Northam announced closure of our public schools today for at least 2 weeks. This campaign is being organized to assist communities across the state in feeding those schoolchildren who are otherwise unable to eat without attending school.¬¨‚Ä†   I, along with a network of registered nurses across Virginia, will be coordinating with school districts to identify such families and provide practical reachout to them by way of delivering healthy meals for the children in the households.¬¨‚Ä†While a few larger districts are establishing meal pick up times during this 2+ week closure, many throughout the state have yet to do so and may not be able to sustain that effort.   Any and all leftover funds will be used to pay off delinquent school lunch accounts for families in need of such assistance once school resumes in late March or April. Thank you in advance for your support for our children!

campaigns.title: Art Model Support During COVID-19
campaigns.description: There are 83 models in the Bay Area Models' Guild whose incomes have been lost due to COVID-19. Art schools and classes have closed, drawing group sessions are canceled, sculpting studios have shut their doors. Art models in the Guild need your help!  ""Many of us will go hungry and unfortunately lose our housing. ¬¨‚Ä†Some of us take care of older parents, some are single mothers with kids who won‚Äö√Ñ√¥t go to school until Summer, some of us are Lone Wolves with No Family support. ¬¨‚Ä† These are very uncertain times,"" wrote Guild member and longtime art model Prudence.  This fundraiser is for these art models in the Guild. Money will be given to each model in the Guild based on their stated needs and their list of booked clients who have canceled without paying them.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† The Bay Area Models‚Äö√Ñ√¥ Guild (BAMG) is a member-run professional organization for artists‚Äö√Ñ√¥ models in the San Francisco Bay Area. Technically a California non- profit mutual benefit corporation, the Guild has written by-laws, a board of directors, and officers. It was created in 1946 by Florence Wysinger Allen (pictured). ¬¨‚Ä†For more information on the Guild and to see each of the models who are members, please visit  http://www.bayareamodelsguild.org   ""There's an art to this business. There's a hell of a lot more to it than skin and bones. It's very difficult work. You find muscles you didn't know you had. Just when you think you're relaxed, the sweat starts running ‚Äö√Ñ√¨ and then you itch. The strain is tremendous.""  ‚Äö√Ñ√Æ‚Äö√Ñ√¢Flo Allen   What is an art model?¬¨‚Ä†  We are your muses - the subjects in your paintings, drawings, sculptures, animated stories and video games. And we're people too, so please help us if you can!  Signed,  Guild members Erin Basso (@violetsparadise) and Titania Kumeh (@titaniaartmodel) for BAMG  ---  Instagram @bayareamodelsguild¬¨‚Ä†   (Titania Kumeh posing for Mario Chiodo)

campaigns.title: Help me support a friend and a victim of COVID19
campaigns.description: I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve knowing Desiree, for a few years now. I knew I would be friends with her from day one. I love this family. They are our family now too. My son Dre is best friends with her youngest daughter Eva.  When she texted me that she tested positive for COVID19, it broke my heart to hear someone so close to me go was experiencing this. We always think, it won‚Äö√Ñ√¥t be us, it won‚Äö√Ñ√¥t be me. Yet it could.  I ask that you reach in your heart and help me raise money for them. Desiree, has lost her job. She has three kids to support. Her two oldest are in college and they were quarantined so they couldn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t work either. Her daughter Eva is in third grade and I can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t imagine what they went through without their mom.  Desiree is a single mom. This has never stopped her though. She has always been a strong and Independent woman in my eyes. The last time I saw her was two months ago, when she was selling Girl Scout cookies with Eva.  She has been quarantined for weeks at the hospital. This hit their family so hard. Emotionally and financially. She made it though and I thank God for that. She is alive, that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s what‚Äö√Ñ√¥s most important! I know that we can all do our part and show our sister in Christ how good we can be to each other. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Caltagirone: Rafforziamo il Centro Covid-19!

Considerate le innumerevoli e fruttuose iniziative di solidariet‚àö‚Ä† condotte in tutta Italia per il rafforzamento dei reparti dedicati ai pazienti affetti da coronavirus, ed alla luce della qualificazione del nostro ospedale quale CENTRO DI RIFERIMENTO REGIONALE Covid-19, lanciamo una raccolta fondi da destinare in favore del P.O. Una piccola donazione, se fatta da tanti, FA TANTO. *******- Chi siamo? Siamo un team di 4 giovani calatini che hanno deciso di intraprendere questa iniziativa benefica. Per qualsiasi richiesta o per eventuali chiarimenti non esitate a contattarci agli indirizzi sotto indicati.L'obiettivo comune? Fornire un sostegno economico al fine di potenziare il centro Covid-19 presso il P.O. di Caltagirone per l'attuale emergenza. Cosa faremo con l'intero ricavato? Il team manager, dott. Ilario Barresi, si occuper‚àö‚Ä† personalmente della gestione dei fondi raccolti con la massima trasparenza. Il ricavato verr‚àö‚Ä† subito devoluto all'ospedale di Caltagirone per il potenziamento del centro Covid-19. Ma con un piccolo aiuto Caltagirone e l'intero comprensorio potranno guadagnare davvero TANTO!Il nostro motto? #restaacasamanonstarefermo Per info: Dott. campaigns.title: COVID-19 Emergency Fund for Cambridge MA
campaigns.description: Christie and I have been thinking through ways to support the greater Cambridge community through this time of uncertainty and heightened anxiety.¬¨‚Ä†  We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve decided that we want to raise money for the  Cambridge COVID-19 Emergency Fund  , set up by the  Cambridge Community Foundation ¬¨‚Ä† in partnership with the  City of Cambridge ¬¨‚Ä†.   How does it work?  The emergency fund will deploy grants (up to $1,000) to Cambridge residents   workers experiencing financial hardship related to COVID-19. In addition, grants of up to $10,000 will be awarded to nonprofits that directly work with low-income populations and that have the capacity to make money transfers to the constituents they serve.¬¨‚Ä†    http://cambridgecf.org/COVID-19-emergency-fund  ¬¨‚Ä†   http://cambridgecf.org/two-new-funds-launched-in-response-to-covid-19/  ¬¨‚Ä†   https://www.cambridgema.gov/news/2020/03/mayorscovid19fund  ¬¨‚Ä†   How much will we raise?  We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re aiming to raise $2,000 between now and the end of the month. Christie and I are planning to match donations, up to $500, and our friends, Ezer Lee and Eric   Kelly Dearing have also graciously offered to match another $500 each. That‚Äö√Ñ√¥s $1,500 in matching donations!   Pilates Mat Class on Instagram Live  As a part of our fundraising efforts,  Christie will be hosting a charity Pilates Mat class on Instagram Live  this Thursday (3/26) at 7:30 AM (which will then be live for 24 hrs)   https://www.instagram.com/fitwithchristie/  ¬¨‚Ä†  //   Would you consider making a contribution of $10 or $25 to support those who have been hit the hardest by the COVID-19 pandemic?   If you've been blessed with financial security, and you're looking for ways to be generous, would you consider making a contribution of $50 or $100, or even becoming a matching donor?  If you can't make a contribution at this time, please help share this effort with those you know, especially those who live, work, or play in Cambridge!  //   FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS    Why is this a personal fundraiser?  Setting up a GoFundMe fundraiser to go to CCF directly would mean that the funds wouldn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t actually get to them until April 30th, because of GoFundMe's payout timelines. We believe that getting the funds raised as quickly as possible is worth the associated trade-offs.   How will you get the money to CCF?  When the fundraiser closes on March 31st, we will donate all the proceeds  directly to the CCF on their website  , and share the donation details publicly. The online donation goes through  Network For Good, which will send the funds to CCF on April 15th ¬¨‚Ä†.   What if I don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t want to give through GoFundMe?  You can venmo Emmanuel-Runes or Christie-Wang-3, and we will donate to the GoFundMe on your behalf.   Is my donation tax-deductible?  Unfortunately, one of the trade-offs of speed is that these donations are not tax-deductible. If that's important to you, we recommend  donating directly !  https://cambridgecf.networkforgood.com/projects/95764-cambridge-covid-19-emergency-fund    Are there fees?  Unfortunately, another one of the trade-offs of speed is that these donations incur a 2.9% fee + $0.30 USD.¬¨‚Ä†  //   CHARITY PILATES MAT CLASS ON INSTAGRAM LIVE    What will the Pilates Mat class be like?  This will be a 45 minute bodyweight full body Pilates mat class. Pilates, originally invented by a man named Joseph Pilates during the 1920s, is a low impact form of conditioning - working the full body, especially the core.   What do I need for the Pilates Mat Class?  ¬¨‚Ä†- Yoga Mat or Towel to pad your knees/tailbone ¬¨‚Ä†- Phone or device to access Instagram¬¨‚Ä†   Any tips for taking the Pilates Mat Class?  ¬¨‚Ä†- Place the device at the front of your mat for the best angle. ¬¨‚Ä†- Use the largest device you have (iPad) or consider mirroring your screen to a TV¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- Make sure to listen closely to cues and instruction, as visuals can sometimes lag - Although the class airs at 7:30 AM, it will be available for 24 hours after. If you do decide to take the class after it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s live, we hope you still consider donating!¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- Have fun!¬¨‚Ä†  //   CAMBRIDGE COVID-19 EMERGENCY FUND    Where can I find more information about the Cambridge COVID-19 Emergency Fund?    http://cambridgecf.org/COVID-19-emergency-fund  ¬¨‚Ä†   http://cambridgecf.org/two-new-funds-launched-in-response-to-covid-19/  ¬¨‚Ä†   Who can apply for grants?  Individuals/households who live or work in Cambridge can apply to the fund and receive a grant of up to $1,000.¬¨‚Ä†   What organizations can apply for grants?  A limited number of special grants of up to $10,000 will be considered to nonprofit organizations, based on the following criteria:¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- Track record of working with low‚Äö√Ñ√¨income families¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- The ability to make cash transfers to individuals and families for a range of needs such as rent shortage, food, utilities, medicines/medical supplies ¬¨‚Ä†- Evidence of 501c3 status   When will funds be available?  The CCF is looking to deploy this money immediately to offer relief to those in desperate need. Grants will be provided on a rolling basis, with the first allocations expected to be made as soon as possible.¬¨‚Ä†   What‚Äö√Ñ√¥s the selection process?  The CCF has a grant review process whereby community reviewers are invited to help Foundation staff review the applications and make recommendations. Each application will be reviewed by one external reviewer and one Foundation staff person. As the fiduciary agent responsible for the use of these funds, the CCF will have the final decision on all grants.   How is the CCF Fund different from the Mayor‚Äö√Ñ√¥s Disaster Relief Fund?  The City of Cambridge and the Cambridge Community Foundation have a long-standing tradition of working together.¬¨‚Ä† These funds are complementary, allowing the CCF to deepen their reach and enabling many more people to be part of collective giving with the aim of supporting as many people as they can who need help. The CCF can support people who make their livelihood Cambridge who may not necessarily live here. The CCF can also support nonprofits and faith-based organizations that have deep reach into the community.    https://www.cambridgema.gov/news/2020/03/mayorscovid19fund

campaigns.title: SF Flower Mart Vendor Payroll Assistance COVID-19
campaigns.description: The San Francisco Flower Market is a historical institution that was first established in 1912 in the Financial District in SF. In 1924 it relocated to 5th   Howard, and proceeded to move to 6th   Brannan in 1956. ¬¨‚Ä†It is one of 5 total flower markets in the United States, and the second largest next to the Los Angeles Flower Market. Vendors supply flowers, plants, containers, and more as far north as Oregon, as far east as Nevada, and as far south as the central coast of California. ¬¨‚Ä†The customer base consists of event planners, retail florists, interior decorators, caterers, plant shops, and flower wholesalers.  This shutdown affects an employment base of over 300 employees, with many vendors being small, local, family-owned businesses. There are just under 50 vendors within the flower market that are facing a monumental loss due to the fact that the primary product that is for sale is highly perishable. Preserving any product is nearly impossible. The flower market is a unique institution that brings together an incredibly diverse group of people, and contains many first generation micro businesses ¬¨‚Ä†   The money collected will be evenly distributed to each vendor based on their number of employees to aid in payroll expenses.¬¨‚Ä†     About the San Francisco Flower Market:  A need for a centrally located market bringing together the three ethnically diverse groups of flower growers was fulfilled with the opening of a market located at 5th and Howard Streets in 1924. As flower growers expanded production areas outside of the Bay Area and as product from other parts of United States came in, the need for a larger more modern permanent facility led to the design and construction of our current market at Sixth and Brannan Streets in the South of Market area of San Francisco.  The grand opening of the San Francisco Flower Terminal in September 1956 marked the establishment of an industry icon. Today, officially known as the San Francisco Flower Mart, we now have just under 50 vendors, purveyors of cut flowers, potted plants, blooming plants and floral supplies.   Founded by Japanese immigrant flower growers at the turn of the century, the story of the California Flower Market, Inc. spans nearly the entire history of Japanese in America.¬¨‚Ä† Through depressions, earthquakes, racial hostility, restrictive legislation and internment during World War II, the members of the California Flower Market have overcome adversity to serve the growers who built a thriving industry from the ground up.  One of the oldest and most successful Japanese-American-owned corporations in the United States, the California Flower Market has been the center of the wholesale flower industry in the San Francisco Bay Area for nearly a century.¬¨‚Ä† It is one of the few wholesale markets in the United States owned and run for and by flower growers.        *Photos credit to the SF Flower market instagram @sfflowermart  www.sanfranciscoflowermart.com

campaigns.title: Bayview COVID-19 Relief for Mother Brown's
campaigns.description: Under normal circumstances, the Bayview-Hunters Point neighborhood gets ignored and under-resourced, following a longstanding pattern of cities underserving black and brown communities. Now that the COVID-19 crisis has hit and food has become even more scarce for poor and homeless San Franciscans, Bayview-Hunters Point is more in need than ever. There has been very little help from the City government for the Bayview, even though District 10 which includes it has over 1,500 unsheltered homeless people.     Mother Brown's Dining Room (operated by United Council of Human Services) is a 24/7 drop-in center that has provided meals, showers, and a warm place to sit to the community for decades. Mother Brown's is one of the few homeless service providers in the neighborhood, and they have done everything they can to keep up with the COVID-19 crisis, but they need your help to staff up, provide more meals, and ensure hygiene facilities can be used safely.  More information about United Council of Human Services: The Organizations Mission Is To Alleviate Poverty-Related Problems Suffered By Homeless And Low-Income Individuals By Providng The Necessary Support Services Which Include Emergency Food, Clean Clothing, Showers, Counseling, And Referral Services.

Il reparto di malattie infettive, che era stato precedentemente chiuso, fatica a rinascere e oggi, come non mai, si avverte la necessit‚àö‚Ä† che l'ospedale si risollevi.¬¨‚Ä†  Noi, pi‚àöœÄ di tutti, siamo in pericolo. campaigns.title: A student effort for Coronavirus Medical Supplies
campaigns.description: With the rapid spread of the Coronavirus in China, the students in Walt Whitman's National Science Competition Club are on a mission to raise money for medical supplies in order to relieve the pressures in Chinese hospitals. NSC is not only committed to scientific research and projects, but also humanitarian efforts for those who are affected by medical epidemics. Both co-presidents of the club are children of Chinese immigrants, so their relatives are the people directly affected by the disease. Please help us in our efforts to donate medical supplies to the people of China.  The money will be donated to Direct Relief, a top 10 charity in the US. They will provide surgical masks, gloves, gowns, and other emergency medical items.¬¨‚Ä†  Summary of our member‚Äö√Ñ√¥s research:  COVID-19, an enveloped RNA virus, is spread primarily through respiratory droplets produced by coughing and sneezing. It is a beta coronavirus, like MERS and SARS. It replicates through attachment to the host cell by binding to receptors and endocytosis. Then, it uses its RNA strand to make copies of itself. Preventative measures need to be taken; this includes the usage of masks, gloves, and protective gowns to inhibit further spreading.

campaigns.title: CoronaTrust - Daily Wage Workers
campaigns.description: Dear People,  While the world around us is awakening to fully comprehend the impact of Covid-19, there is another pandemic brewing as its aftermath. While we can lock-down and self-quarantine to reduce health risk exposure, we can't protect our 'daily wage' workers from loss of income. They are the hardest hit community in this crisis and the economic uncertainty they¬¨‚Ä† face is so real and disturbing. We are overwhelmed with emails like  ""I was laid off and have zero income and I don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t even know how to survive anymore."" , which are truly heart breaking.  ¬¨‚Ä†  CoronoTrust ¬¨‚Ä† ( www.coronatrust.org ) was formed to jump start and help as many people as we can. The more we do, we realize, the more we need. Now it is up to the world to help our fellow citizens with whatever they can.  Understanding that the public agencies are focused on the healthcare, without a doubt that is a priority; we want to attract your attention and generosity to avert another knock-on disaster in terms of joblessness and unemployment, leading to social disorder and unrest.  Our group is well coordinated and we are building small local team to maximize help. If you can fund us that would be great, if you can't, just look after the closest person you know who has lost a job.   We truly want to help you all out there but our resources are limited. So long world's generosity lasts, we will continue to support you.   Thank you and let's help thy neighbor.  Corona Trust Team  If you know someone in need, please direct them to us and we will do our best, resources permitting.

campaigns.title: Funds to Support Performers Affected by Covid-19
campaigns.description: As the Covid-19 health crisis sweeps across the nation, it has exposed many weaknesses in our crisis-management infrastructure. One of the biggest challenges that has emerged with the gig economy, and in this case specifically, concerns freelance performers. Musicians, dancers, and actors have all lost money-making opportunities that were a guaranteed source of income and without which, many will not be able to pay rent, provide for healthcare, and take care of many essential needs. With no provision in place through an umbrella organization and compounded by an increasing number of concert/performance cancellations, our community needs support.¬¨‚Ä†  This fundraiser aims to provide funds for performers who will not be able to make ends meet without these opportunities. We (the creators of this fund) will use the following parameters:¬¨‚Ä†  1. Funds will provided to those affected in the Philadelphia/New York City/New Jersey regions.¬¨‚Ä†  2. The fundraiser will last from March 12th until April 15th and encompass any and all concerts cancelled from March through May.¬¨‚Ä†  3. Funds will be distributed in proportion to the income loss as proven by paperwork described in the following section with a $5,000 cap. If enough funds are raised then all performers will be compensated fully.  4. All distribution records will be kept with transparency in mind.  5. Any extra fund beyond an artist's need will be refunded to donors.    To receive funds:¬¨‚Ä†    1. Be a performer in the Philadelphia/NYC/New Jersey area that relies on freelance work as a major source of income.¬¨‚Ä†  2. Be able to provide documentation of a show cancelled due to Covid-19 along with expected income and related cancellation fees, if applicable.   NOTE: This fundraiser will not benefit the organizers of this fundraiser in any way whatsoever. All proceeds will go to the performers.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: The Silent Victimis of Covid19
campaigns.description: I am asking for donations to help the elephants in Thailand from starving to death. ¬¨‚Ä†1000s of Elephants in Thailand are starving due to the lack of tourist because of COVID19. Unfortunately elephant camps have no money to buy food to feed their elephants. Sadly, many elephant owners are being forced to leave their elephants chained as they struggle to find ways to survive themselves.¬¨‚Ä†   The funds raised will be sent to Elephant Nature Park. A true sanctuary that is 100% cruelty free. Dedicated to rescue elephants and many other animals from cruel terrible lives.¬¨‚Ä† Founder Saengduean Lek Chailert¬¨‚Ä† will distribute the money to those who are in need. The money is needed immediately as the elephants' heath deteriorates with each passing day.¬¨‚Ä† The funds will be spent on buying food and rehiring¬¨‚Ä† mahouts ( elephant caretakers) so the elephants get the care they need. Please donate! all amounts count. Each penny will go a long way to help these beautiful ones. All of these elephants have already suffered tremendously they don't deserve this slow terrible death. I can't imagine dying this horrible way.   Thank You for your beautiful hearts. May the universe reward you tenfold.

campaigns.title: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) fund
campaigns.description: As the Roanoke valley prepares itself for the Corona-virus we recognize a need to set up a fund for those who will be affected. Many parents and students will require time off for this and could cost our region.  Several parents have already voiced their concerns over child care during the period of time when the schools are shut down. This raises the issue of the hundreds of students in our area that have free school lunch and breakfast as their main or only source of food for the day.  School systems prepare coronavirus contingency plans ¬¨‚Ä†  Many colleges around Roanoke have cancelled classes already in response to several suspected cases. This has resulted in many student leaving behind their belongings and unable to return to dorms or on site locations. By the time students return most of the food in their building will have expired and or rotted leaving students strapped for cash to provide themselves a proper meal. Roanoke College student tested for coronavirus, college moving to online classes ¬¨‚Ä†  We only ask that you lend a hand to this community in its time of need and help those affected around our area.  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ,Thank you¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Coronavirus Defends for Saving Suffering Lives
campaigns.description: Flight with us! Pray with us! I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m such an ordinary person quiet on social, I never thought I would be so desperate and devastated to draft a letter for help with face covering in tears! This January with the  outbreak of Coronavirus  at Wuhan my hometown‚Äö√π¬ß, I realized and is experiencing such a life-threatening moment for my family who are infected with the virus and hundreds of thousands of people are suffering this novel virus with pneumonia and hard to breath problem (China‚Äö√Ñ√¥s number is less than what‚Äö√Ñ√¥s real). They are on the fringe of fighting the virus through their own Immune Systems and Antivirus/antibacterial medicines with the city under quarantine, but the  sad thing is they lack medical supplies of masks, goggles, protection suits  to prevent the virus  from transmission to more people at the hospitals and communities at Wuhan  (even they also lack medicines, since those are prescription drugs there is no way we can purchase). Even though lots of people are trying to help in this matter including myself and my husband, there still lots of things we need to do and lots of supplies we need to send to China. As you may know Alibaba, Taobao those big online stores in China is sold out of masks, goggles, we are purchasing  supplies here at US to send back to China . Since its two of us on our part, we realized its wiser and better if we can collect help from the humanitarian society to help accelerate the process. If you are there and willing to help this effort, any dollar or connection with those supplies is welcomed! I attached all those first-hand information and the real moments of my friends circle on Wechat (a Chinese chat tool) to show you what‚Äö√Ñ√¥s really going on. And with all the dollars raised I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll  buy those supplies  and reply this crowdfunding with the  purchasing sheets and shipping information  to show how your money goes. Please also  send prayers  for Wuhan, I believe God can hear us! It‚Äö√Ñ√¥s near the time to re-examine ourselves and the world around us. 1.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† Who I am: Xinyu born at Wuhan, have been living at US since 2012 Fall came here for Graduate degree  2.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† Where I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m from: Wuchang District, Wuhan City, China  3.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† Relationship with parties raising funds: Family friends community hospitals in Wuhan. My father is hospitalized at Wuhan University Renmin Hospital, my grandpa is at Wuhan Tianyou Hospital. My mom and grandma currently don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t have any spots available at the Hospital.  4.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† The Fund spent: will all be used for purchasing supplies like masks, goggles, protection suit and ship back to Wuhan.

campaigns.title: Project Corona Short Film
campaigns.description: ¬¨¬£300 Budget to be raised for location services ¬¨‚Ä†    The year is 2025, COVID-19 has ravaged the uk and left the country in a state of despair.¬¨‚Ä†  22 year old Fern has learned to survive by travelling from settlement to settlement offering her services completing odd jobs in exchange for food, medicine and shelter.¬¨‚Ä†  As She travels the country on her deceased fathers beloved bike, she runs out of fuel and must make her way to the nearest military outpost in the hopes of finding her much needed fuel.¬¨‚Ä†  As she arrives at the checkpoint she discovers the place has been overrun with infected and she must deal with them before she has access to the fuel.¬¨‚Ä†   A Jamie Neagle Film.¬¨‚Ä†  Directed by Ruby Hamilton¬¨‚Ä† Executive Producer Screen   Film School ‚Äö√Ñ√≤ Creative producer Jamie Neagle¬¨‚Ä† 1st Ad Christian Garnes¬¨‚Ä† Cinematography by George Baker   Danny Barker¬¨‚Ä† Art by Paula Pindado Grajal¬¨‚Ä† Sound by Ieuan Lowther   Lara Bertin¬¨‚Ä†    Once the funds have been raised they will be used to secure the location for the days filming.¬¨‚Ä†  Our whole crew will benefit from this project as it makes up 60% of our final first year grade. The project is ambitious but is the perfect opportunity to showcase our skills learned in the first year.¬¨‚Ä†  Funds to be secured by April 6th 2020

campaigns.title: Helft dem THEATER DER KL‚àö√ëNGE in Corona-Zeiten
campaigns.description: Die Covid19-Pandemie hat auch uns vom  THEATER DER KL‚àö√ëNGE ¬¨‚Ä† getroffen. Mitten in der Probenphase f‚àö¬∫r unsere neue Produktion m‚àö¬∫ssen wir unseren Betrieb einstellen, weil das Risiko f‚àö¬∫r unser Ensemble, sich gegenseitig zu infizieren, einfach zu gro‚àö√º ist. Trotzdem haben all unsere T‚àö¬ßnzer, Video- und Tonk‚àö¬∫nstler aber auch unser Regisseur und unsere Choreographin Vertr‚àö¬ßge, die ihnen Lohn versprechen. Und das zurecht! Unsere K‚àö¬∫nstler sind n‚àö¬ßmlich oft freie Mitarbeiter, die nur von Engagement zu Engagement bezahlt werden und jetzt besonders stark getroffen werden. Daher rei‚àö√ºt uns unser Probenausfall momentan ein Loch von ca. 5.000 ‚Äö√á¬® in unsere Kalkulation.  Als freies Theater sind wir sehr von ‚àö‚àÇffentlicher F‚àö‚àÇrderung abh‚àö¬ßngig. In ‚àö¬∫ber 32 Jahren, die wir jetzt bestehen, sind wir von verschiedenen Institutionen regelm‚àö¬ß‚àö√ºig gro‚àö√ºz‚àö¬∫gig f‚àö¬∫r unsere einzigartige k‚àö¬∫nstlerische Arbeit gef‚àö‚àÇrdert worden. Doch die aktuelle Lage konnte niemand vorhersehen und auch nicht einkalkulieren.   Doch wir geben nicht auf!   Wir k‚àö‚àÇnnten jetzt einfach warten und versuchen, uns etwas von den staatlichen Notfallfonds zu sichern, die in Aussicht gestellt wurden, doch wir wollen aus dieser Situation lieber etwas gutes machen: Wir haben uns dazu entschlossen, solange der Lockdown weiter anh‚àö¬ßlt, w‚àö‚àÇchentlich einen unser Vorstellungsmittschnitte unser bislang 27 Produktionen online f‚àö¬∫r ein Wochenende zu ver‚àö‚àÇffentlichen.  Jeden Donnerstag Abend um 19:00 Uhr ver‚àö‚àÇffentlichen wir auf unserer Homepage eines unserer St‚àö¬∫cke in chronologischer Reihenfolge. Diese St‚àö¬∫cke sind zum Teil seit Jahrzehnten nicht mehr gespielt worden und die dazugeh‚àö‚àÇrigen professionell gemachten Filme lagern seitdem in unserem Archiv.¬¨‚Ä†       Sie wollen Kultur und k‚àö‚àÇnnen diese momentan nicht erreichen?  Wir verstehen die aktuelle Lage gut und sehen mit Bedauern, dass Kultur das Erste war, was man gestrichen hat. Aber wenn Sie bislang gerne in Theater- oder Tanzvorstellungen gegangen sind, dann werden wir Sie begeistern!  Auf unserer Website  haben wir ausf‚àö¬∫hrliche Informationen zu all unseren bisherigen Produktionen ver‚àö‚àÇffentlicht, damit Sie sich einen Eindruck machen k‚àö‚àÇnnen, was wir bislang geschaffen haben. Die St‚àö¬∫cke im einzelnen sind:  1.  Die mechanische Bauhausb‚àö¬∫hne ¬¨‚Ä† (1987) 2.  Die barocke Maskenb‚àö¬∫hne ¬¨‚Ä† (1988/89) 3.  Die K‚àö¬∫che ¬¨‚Ä† nach Arnold Wesker (1990) 4.  November 1918 * 1989 ¬¨‚Ä† (1991) 5.  Figur uns Klang im Raum ¬¨‚Ä† (1993) 6.  Reden ist Silber... ¬¨‚Ä† (1994) 7.  Ludus Danielis ¬¨‚Ä† (1994)¬¨‚Ä† 8.  Die V‚àö‚àÇgel ¬¨‚Ä† nach Aristophanes (1996) 9.  Jubil‚àö¬ßum ¬¨‚Ä† (1997) 10.  Die Neuberin  (1999)  11.  Das Opfer  nach Igor Strawinsky (1999) 12.  Megalopolis ¬¨‚Ä†(2001) 13.  Modul|a|t|o|r ¬¨‚Ä†(2002) 14.  Gregorius auf dem Stein  nach Hartmann von Aue und Thomas Mann (2004) 15.  HOEReographien  (2005) 16.  Teufels Kreise  (2006) 17.  Ich ‚Äö√Ñ√¨ ist ein anderer ¬¨‚Ä† (2007) 18.  Johnnys Jihad ¬¨‚Ä† von Marc Pommerening (2009) 19.  Suite Intermediale ¬¨‚Ä† (2011) 20.  Vanitas ¬¨‚Ä† (2012)  21.  Coda ¬¨‚Ä† ‚Äö√Ñ√¨ Bachs Cellosuite in c-moll (2014) 22.  TRIAS ‚Äö√Ñ√¨ das triadische Ballett ¬¨‚Ä† nach Oskar Schlemmer (2015) 23.  Kontraste ¬¨‚Ä†(2016) 24.  Die Kunst der Tanz-Fuge ¬¨‚Ä†(2017) 25.  Bauhaus Ballette ¬¨‚Ä† (2017) 26.  Der Silberprinz : Neun Blicke auf Walter Gropius (2018) 27.  Das Lackballett  nach Oskar Schlemmer (2019)       Warum Spenden?  Zugegeben, wenn wir die Filme doch eh jede Woche hochladen, wo liegt da f‚àö¬∫r Sie der Anreiz zu spenden? Nun, der liegt in zwei Aspekten. Zum Einen helfen Sie uns wirklich weiter, denn wir k‚àö‚àÇnnen die Spenden im Moment gut gebrauchen! Als eingetragener Verein k‚àö‚àÇnnen wir Ihnen auch gerne eine Spendenquittung ausstellen. Zum Anderen haben wir uns noch ein kleines Dankesch‚àö‚àÇn ‚àö¬∫berlegt: f‚àö¬∫r jede Spende  ‚àö¬∫ber 50 ‚Äö√á¬®  geben wir Ihnen vorab den Vimeo-Link zu einem in dieser Woche nicht ver‚àö‚àÇffentlichten Mitschnitt. Sie k‚àö‚àÇnnen sich dann gerne so oft Sie wollen eine unserer 27 Produktionen ansehen und zwar vollkommen losgel‚àö‚àÇst von unserem Online-Premieren-Zeitplan.  Sie k‚àö‚àÇnnen also auch w‚àö¬ßhrend des Lockdowns virtuelles Theater von zuhause genie‚àö√ºen!   Organisatorisches  Als freies Theater leben wir von Zuschauern, die unsere Vorstellungen sehen kommen. Daher behalten wir uns vor, die Aktion mit den kostenfreien Filmen zu beenden, wenn sich die Lage entspannt und ein normaler Kulturbetrieb wieder m‚àö‚àÇglich ist. Auch im Falle, dass die Aktion auf kein Interesse st‚àö‚àÇ‚àö√ºt, behalten wir uns vor, sie fr‚àö¬∫hzeitig zu beenden. Im Fall von Problemen mit der ‚àö√∫bermittlung von eMail-Adressen zum Erhalt von Vimeo-Links, nehmen Sie bitte ‚àö¬∫ber das Kontaktformular Kontakt mit uns auf. Wir werden uns dann versuchen, so schnell wie m‚àö‚àÇglich darum zu k‚àö¬∫mmern. Auch bei weiteren Fragen stehen wir gerne ‚àö¬∫ber das Kontaktformular zur Verf‚àö¬∫gung.

campaigns.title: Sikh donation for Italy covid-19 emergency
campaigns.description: Fundrasing for COVID-19 emergency in Italy    Waheguru Ji ka Khalsa Waheguru Ji ki Fateh,        My name is Jaspinder and I grew up and lived in Italy ¬¨‚Ä†  and my ¬¨‚Ä†heart breaks down when I see ¬¨‚Ä†Italy going through this pandemic.    Like me I think many other second generation Sikhs would like to do something for the country that they love, I organised this campaign.  Since the outbreak, 6,077 people have died and the number of infections is rising day by day. My call is all the Sikhs brothers and sisters living in Italy or abroad to come together and donate now to ¬¨‚Ä†help the Italian Health Care System.  People are dying alone and away from their dears, please let's contribute to grant better care for everyone. ¬¨‚Ä†If you can't donate please share this campaign. campaigns.title: Michelle Toro Chardon Funeral
campaigns.description: Michelle Toro Chardon passed away Saturday, April 22nd, in West Jordan, Utah. ¬¨‚Ä†Her only sibling, my dear friend, Madeline Corona, brought Michelle to Utah last year from Puerto Rico to receive more aggressive medical treatment for her battle against advanced stage breast cancer. ¬¨‚Ä†Michelle was diagnosed at age 34 and received basic treatment in Puerto Rico. ¬¨‚Ä†A more aggressive treatment was required and The Huntsman Cancer Center was a blessing to her, but all their efforts could not save her life. ¬¨‚Ä†Her cancer spread to her bones and lungs causing her severe pain. ¬¨‚Ä†Although fragile, she fought every day with determination to live for her 3 young children and taught everyone how to be couregous. ¬¨‚Ä†She was so loving, happy, and had a great heart and was an example of great faith. ¬¨‚Ä† She always gave others good advice and encouragement and taught everyone to accept Heavenly Father's will. ¬¨‚Ä†Michelle was ¬¨‚Ä†37 years old when she left this earth life, and leaves behind her husband and 3 children. ¬¨‚Ä†Her immediate family was recently able to join her in Utah along with her parents and be with her through the last stages of her valiant fight against cancer. ¬¨‚Ä†Michelle's wish was to return to Puerto Rico for her interment. ¬¨‚Ä†Madeline, and her family of 5, are doing all they can to assist Michelle's young family with funeral and travel expenses and will need to travel to Puerto Rico themselves. ¬¨‚Ä† Funds raised here will be used for travel and funeral expenses.

Ideato e coordinato da Francesco Corapi¬¨‚Ä† (Chitarrista, Compositore ,Speaker Radiofonico, Collaboratore Metal.It¬¨‚Ä† )e Guglielmo Malusardi (Giornalista Musicale, Esperto di Chitarrismo ) con la collaborazione di Mauro Matteucci ( Elevate Records, ¬¨‚Ä†produzione, ¬¨‚Ä†mix ¬¨‚Ä†. master) Pino Magliani( discografico Elevate, Speaker Radiofonico ) Gianluca Grazioli ( giornalista metal.it) ¬¨‚Ä† Highway Solos nasce con l‚Äö√Ñ√¥idea di conseguire un obiettivo meritorio e benefico ¬¨‚Ä†attraverso un coordinato lavoro di squadra . Dieci chitarristi , un tastierista , un bassista , un batterista,  che attraverso la propria arte¬¨‚Ä† hanno dato dato corpo¬¨‚Ä† all‚Äö√Ñ√¥ideazione di questo lungo brano, nel quale si alternano in maniera¬¨‚Ä† funambolica¬¨‚Ä†e godibile al tempo stesso. Il tutto in forma totalmente gratuita, di slancio e con squisita disponibilit‚àö‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† Il lavoro d‚Äö√Ñ√¥insieme ‚àö¬Æ stato realizzato in tempi ultra rapidi, proprio per poter contribuire il pi‚àöœÄ velocemente possibile attraverso la raccolta fondi dedicata , ad aiutare l‚Äö√Ñ√¥Ospedale Luigi Sacco di Milano, nella propria battaglia contro la pandemica situazione attuale. ¬¨‚Ä† Auspichiamo a fronte di un impegno massivo, corale , e altruista di ricevere una altretattanto , meritoria e generosa risposta da parte degli ascoltatori , ancorch‚àö¬Æ ¬¨‚Ä†non classificabili come appassionati del genere¬¨‚Ä†musicale chitarristicamente orientato. ¬¨‚Ä† MUSICISTI : Chitarristi, in ordine di solo STEFANO ‚Äö√Ñ√∫SEBO‚Äö√Ñ√π XOTTA NICOLA DENTI SIMONE GIANLORENZI LUCA COLOMBO MATTEO BRIGO FRABRIZIO ‚Äö√Ñ√∫BICIO‚Äö√Ñ√π LEO MARCO SFOGLI DANIELE GOTTARDO FRANCESCO CORAPI ANDREA MARTONGELLI MISTHERIA ( keytar solo e tastiere ) ROBERTO FASCIANI (basso ) VALERIO LUCANTONI (batteria)

campaigns.title: Compromised during Corona.
campaigns.description: My name is Tasha. I'm a 28 y/o female that lives in Oregon.  I'm a cancer survivor, with a very weak immune system. I went through chemo, radiation and months of medication which inevitably ruined how well I can hold back viral attacks on my body.  I started developing symptoms and went to get tested. I came back negative for the flu so I'm waiting on a call to get get tested for COVID-19 or Corona-virus. I cannot work at the moment with¬¨‚Ä† this problem, my work won't even allow anyone with any sort of flu like or allergy like symptoms.  I've called all my local rental assistance resources with no avail.  Right now I have no savings, no sick hours and no way to pay my rent. I'm only asking for the cost of one month.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†  I know there are other sick people out there, people going through hard times, but this is my last resort. I just want to try and make it through this month.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†  Anything helps, thank you very much for reading my story.  3

campaigns.title: Help Horizon Health & fitness survive Corona Virus
campaigns.description: Hi Everyone  So I have set this Go fund campaign up to support David and his Team at the Horizon, please give what you can and please share the link, it's the little things that can help and support local businesses and I Know this Gym needs all our help, love and support where possible, Iam asking and begging please help every penny really does help!¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† The Gym has been running for so long, Dave and the team have made some amazing changes there and give an awesome, personal support service to each and every member.  NOT only does Dave run the Gym but with the love from members, friends and family they support those in need where possible giving throughout the year and Christmas too ‚Äö√π¬ß  At Horizon, Health and Fitness Gym, they aren't just a Gym they give a friendly and warm welcome to everyone that comes through their door with the promise to help everyone reach their goal.¬¨‚Ä†  The problem is CORONAVIRUS and it threatens the closure of not just us but many other business, we are not a rich Profit Gym, we value all our members and thrive on our business to help others reach their personal goals weather it be for health reasons or general fitness.¬¨‚Ä† The Government has promised money to survive the 12 weeks but this alone just isn't enough for basic needs to stay open, which if we don't find this we may not be able to re-open  With weekly outgoings, of Rent, Rates, Electric, Gas, Wages, Finance Repayments, Tax Implications, just to name a few costs, we would not be able to meet them.¬¨‚Ä†  We really would like to keep hold of the staff and be able to reopen when this is all over and get back to normal as quick as possible and that is where we are asking you to help !  Please give what you can we try really hard to give you that personal service that we provide at Horizon and be unique from other gyms.¬¨‚Ä†  Big love from the Horizon Health and fitness team, stay safe ! x   http://www.horizonhealthandfitness.co.uk/

Il ricavato verr‚àö‚Ä† devoluto all‚Äö√Ñ√¥Azienda Ospedaliera di Udine e sar‚àö‚Ä† utilizzato per l‚Äö√Ñ√¥acquisto di materiale medico/sanitario¬¨‚Ä†e quant‚Äö√Ñ√¥altro sar‚àö‚Ä† ritenuto necessario dall'ospedale per la gestione dell'emergenza.  La situazione ‚àö¬Æ urgente e necessita la nostra attenzione, ogni donazione ‚àö¬Æ la benvenuta, anche la pi‚àöœÄ piccola ‚àö¬Æ un passo importante che aiuta la lotta al virus e ci riavvicina alla normalit‚àö‚Ä†.   Non lasciamo soli i medici gli infermieri e tutti gli operatori sanitari, i veri eroi di questa emergenza!   Grazie!

campaigns.title: COVID-19 open data to help National Health Service
campaigns.description: PLEASE JOIN ME AND MY TEAM creating an APP designed to help people to track their symptom and the National Health Service to prevent emergencies.  The APP in its first phase will have 2 main purposes:   People : Help people tracking their symptom, with reminder and medical advice.   National Health Service  (NHS): understand how many people might be in need of help in a short period and better organize their resource. the NHS hasn't a clear idea of how many people are out there sick and doesn't have enough resource to test everyone. We will give for free to all country national health service, the people data (anonymized, no name/surname) and with an approximative location. For example, Hospitals could transfer patients or reserve/organize bed, hire personnel, and others.¬¨‚Ä†   Why we are requesting you to donate : We are 4 developers and 1 data science, everyone with their fulltime job and we will do this work for free. however, to offer this service Europe/Word wide there will be a huge infrastructure cost (virtual server).¬¨‚Ä† The app won't generate any money for us, and this hopefully will be used only for a few months.¬¨‚Ä†   TARGET : We aim to release the services on the 6th of April   What else we need  If you can't donate, you can still help us,  PLEASE SHARE  we are also looking for people : -with machine learning experience -marketing expert to help us to make this campaign a success -graphic designer for the app, and for the camping Please write to us on covid19.pfc@gmail.com for more info

campaigns.title: Jerome tegen Corona
campaigns.description: **ENGLISH BELOW**  Beste klanten/ thuisblijvers/ bak-enthousiasten,  Het zijn moeilijke tijden voor ons allemaal. Elke dag verandert de situatie om het uur en het is soms moeilijk te volgen wat wel en niet meer mag. Onze dagelijkse routines zijn verstoord en het voelt surrealistisch. Helaas zijn er mensen die deze periode alleen doorbrengen, of mensen die niet weten wat morgen hen zal brengen. Veel plaatsen hebben steun en hulp nodig door de vele gesloten zaken en diensten. De verpleegkundigen en artsen werken de klok rond om deze bittere situatie beter te maken. Kinderopvang centra en creches zijn de juiste oplossingen aan het zoeken om de gesloten scholen en activiteiten goed te maken voor onze kleinsten en door de sluiting van alle cafes en vrijetijds plaatsen, lijken de straten volledig leeg.  Hoewel Jerome open mag blijven, mbt de maatregelen die sinds 18/03 gelden, willen wij nog een groter bijdrage leveren aan het ‚Äö√Ñ√∫terug gezond maken‚Äö√Ñ√π van onze maatschappij!   Daarmee komen wij met de volgende voorstel:  Wij hebben een GoFundMe ogestart om SOS Kinderdorpen Belgie en de gezondheidszorgsector te steunen in deze tijden. Doordat er geen school, stages of kampen doorgaan heeft SOS Kinderdorpen nood aan nieuwe meters en peters zodat de kinderen de komende weken in betere omstandigheden hun dagen doorbrengen. Verder is het geen geheim dat er een tekort aan materiaal is om onze geneeskundigen te beschermen in de ziekenhuizen.   Bij iedere gift dat jullie schenken wordt een authentiek recept priv‚àö¬© naar jullie gestuurd van onze heerlijke pannenkoeken. Op deze manier kunnen jullie een stukje Jerome in huis brengen. Bak met jullie kinderen, roep uw broer of zus erbij, maak er vooral een familie-moment van. Al het geld dat ingezameld wordt zal 50 : 50 verdeeld worden tussen SOS Kinderdorpen en een ziekenhuis in Vlaanderen . Dus kruip achter het fornuis, zamel in en help ons de virus tegen te gaan!  Nu, meer dan ooit, moeten wij doorbijten en samenspannen om zo snel mogelijk een vorm van controle te cre‚àö¬¥ren.  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† +++ BELANGRIJK +++  Stuur ons een screenshot van jullie gift via prive bericht op Instagram of Facebook, en wij sturen jullie ons recepture door.   ********************************************************************* Dear customers/ stay-at-home-ers/ baking-enthusiast,  These are strange times for everyone. Everyday there is a change in the situation, with updates appearing by the hour, and it can be quite difficult to follow what we can and cannot do anymore. Our daily routines have been interrupted and it feels surreal. Unfortunately there are people who go through this all alone, or people who don't know what tomorrow will bring. A lot of places need support and aid now that a lot of services have been shut down. The nurses and doctors work around the clock to better this bitter situation. Daycare centres are searching for the right solutions to keep our little ones busy now that schools and after-school-activities have been shut down. And because of the closed bars and cafes, the cities and streets seem completely empty.¬¨‚Ä†  Although we, at Cremerie Jerome, are fortunate to stay open and offer take-away (following the rules given on 18/3), we are still looking for ways to do more to make the community healthy and prosperous again.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†  That is why we are proposing the following:  With this GoFundMe we are looking to support SOS Kinderdorpen Belgium and the health sector in these trying times. Due to the schools, internships and camps shutting down, SOS Kinderdorpen is in need of ""godparents"" to financially aid the kids the coming weeks. Furthermore, it is no secret that the shortage of medical masks and -materials, in general, prove to be an issue in the protection of our medicinal staff.  When a donation is given, we will send our authentic pancake recipe to you in private. That way, you can bring a part of Jerome into your homes. Bake with your children, invite your brother and/or sister to join you, above all make it a family gathering!   All of the collected money will be divided 50:50 between SOS Kinderdorpen and a hospital in Flanders. So, what are you waiting for? Place yourself behind your stove, donate and help us fight the virus!  Now, more than ever, is the time for us to work together and bite through!!  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† +++ IMPORTANT +++   Send us a screenshot of your donation in private chat (on Instagram or Facebook) and we will send you our recipe.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Outrunning COVID-19
campaigns.description: In 2018 I ran the Pittsburgh Marathon and achieved my dream of qualifying for the Boston Marathon.  I missed the cut-off by 90 seconds that year.  In 2019 I ran the Pittsburgh marathon to re-qualify for the Boston Marathon and made the cut to run Boston in 2020.     Due to COVID-19, Boston 2020 won‚Äö√Ñ√¥t be held on April 20, 2020.     As someone who studies immunology and infectious diseases, I have come to realize that there‚Äö√Ñ√¥s more to COVID-19 than just the symptoms and mortality rate. COVID-19 has incited fear and uncertainty for people across the globe, not just for the demographics that are most affected medically. The economic repercussions will impact those who are paid hourly and those without the benefit of sick leave.     So, I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve decided to make my own ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Not-Boston Marathon‚Äö√Ñ√π and run 26.2 miles on April 20, 2020. I want this to mean something more than just a race.      I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m running to raise money for the Jean B. Purvis Community Health Clinic which is a free medical clinic that provides services for people who fall below the poverty line/are uninsured or underinsured in my hometown. This clinic is almost fully operated on a volunteer basis along with community donations. With many people unable to work due to COVID-19, individuals who rely on this clinic may feel the strain more than most.     I can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t change the course of a global pandemic, but I can control my reaction to it. In times like this, the silver lining is important.     If you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re still reading this, thank you. Any donations or words of encouragement are appreciated.  More information about Community Health Clinic of Butler County Inc: Our mission is to provide primary healthcare to our uninsured and income-eligible neighbors, ages 19-64, in Butler County

campaigns.title: Help during the CoronaVirus outbreak.
campaigns.description: As most of you know I recently moved to Vietnam to start a new chapter of my life. ¬¨‚Ä†Once my father passed away I knew even more-so that this change was needed in my life.  It‚Äö√Ñ√¥s something I was so desperate to do not only to change my life for the better, ¬¨‚Ä†but to make myself and my family proud. Each day I wake up thankful tobe here, thankful that I went through with this dream and continue to make my dad proud.¬¨‚Ä†  Since the CoronaVirus decided to appear, not only has the world come to a stop still but also my mind and mental health as abruptly come crashing down. So much so I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve contemplating giving up this dream completely, so much so that Im sleep depriving myself, so much so that anxiety and panic attacks have become second nature. Then I think about leaving again, something I know will make me feel like an even bigger failure. During this outbreak it has left me uncertain of how I might continue to not only have a roof over my head, ¬¨‚Ä†but cover basic needs such as food and water. The virus has stopped all schools from opening, which in turn means us teachers are left with nothing. As it stands the schools are not due to open any time soon which does mean basic living necessities will be something I no longer have access to. Food and water will no longer be a viable option, let alone having somewhere to live.¬¨‚Ä†   All I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m asking for is help, in any way shape or form. Every penny counts, and I will use whatever funds are raised to cover living expenses as well as manage to feed and water myself. Any further funds that I manage to raise will goto a charity that helps individuals in crisis situations. I don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t expect anyone to donate however if you choose to, just know that i am beyond grateful. I will forever be truly thankful ‚Äö√¥‚Ä¢√î‚àè√®

campaigns.title: Rapid Response to COVID-19 in NC
campaigns.description: This fund is being established as a partnership with Day One Disaster Relief and supported by community leaders: Mayor Steve Schewel;¬¨‚Ä† City Council Members: Vernetta Alston, Javiera Caballero, DeDreana Freeman, Jillian Johnson, Mark-Anthony Middleton, and Charlie Reece; and members of The Durham County Board of Commissioners.  Additional local and state partnerships are currently being developed.¬¨‚Ä†  As with other campaigns that I have organized for our community in Durham, I ask that you trust that the funds will be distributed to the most critical need, in the most equitable way possible. I've shown this commitment through previous campaigns including helping to pay down Durham's Lunch Debt, assisting Durham community member's impacted by the explosion last April through Bull City Rebuilds, as a member of the Durham One Fund task force, and most recently in support of residents at McDougald Terrace.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  As an example, the funds will be used to:¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- support individuals whose livelihood was impacted by the outbreak ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- purchase medical supplies ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- purchase cleaning supplies ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†- provide community support for those who are most vulnerable¬¨‚Ä†  **Aid will be distributed to communities who currently have confirmed COVID-19 diagnoses.**¬¨‚Ä†  Any funds raised beyond what is needed help impacted communities will be reserved for future community disaster relief in Durham and North Carolina.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä† About DAY ONE: Through strong community relationships, Day One Disaster Relief serves disaster-impacted populations. Since each disaster is unique, a disaster relief solution that is predictable, repeatable and systematic in nature has been identified as what's needed to make an improved impact.  Day One Disaster Relief was founded during Hurricane Florence to rapidly source and deliver supplies (via air and road) to those affected by the hurricane. We formed as a result of our efforts spearheading the rapid response at the TAC AIR terminal at RDU in September 2018.   We brought together volunteer pilots and NGO‚Äö√Ñ√¥s who have been on the ground in eastern NC, some for 45+ years. We raised the supply chain and engaged the community which resulted in 1500 volunteers throughout the week at RDU. We have continued our work serving the survivors of Hurricanes Michael and Dorian as well as supporting residents evacuated from McDougald Terrace public housing neighborhood in Durham, NC.  Through our experience at RDU, we identified the need to create a decentralized collaborative based disaster relief organization to facilitate volunteer, NGO, donor, and government coordination during a rapid disaster response specifically focusing on communities that are often forgotten during large disasters. (i.e. farmworkers and migrant laborers, poor, frontline, people of color, and under-resourced communities)   Our structure allows us to effectively and efficiently work with smaller NGOs who often become distribution hubs and community support organizations in the wake of a disaster. We have a network of trusted relationships across our state which is ever-expanding. These NGOS are the people who have deep relationships with their communities and people who start disasters at net zero. Day One Disaster Relief partners with these organizations to provide rapid response aid and long term relief.

campaigns.title: JACOB STRONG
campaigns.description: Updated July 2019* He relapsed and we continued this original go fund me from 2018.We weren't able to reset amount but half the amount shown was raised the 1st time he fought and beat it. he is currently fighting a relapse.see halfway down for more info on relapse.Hi everyone, I am one of the room parents in Jacobs class and with the permission of his mother I am creating this account on her behalf.¬¨‚Ä† Jacob is a 6 year old boy and kindergarten student at St. Maria Goretti School in Schiller Park, Illinois. Just days before his birthday on January 18, 2018 he became gravely ill and was absent from school. Shortly after his birthday, his physician sent Jacob to Lurie Children's Hospital in Chicago for further testing and it was discovered that he had cancer in his blood. The diagnosis was Childhood Leukemia. This was devastating to hear for Ms. Corona, Jacob's mom, as she is a single parent. Originally from Mexico, Ms. Corona came to this country to seek a better life. She has a wonderful son who she considers a blessing. She is naturally distraught at the prospect of having to take a leave of absence from work to provide round the clock care for Jacob. Her employer issued insurance will run out when the sick leave ends as the treatment for Jacob will take three (3) years. Ms. Corona is fearful that not having any income at the moment she will not be able to pay her rent and bills. Any donations you are able to contribute will be greatly appreciated. These donations will help her manage the expense of driving into downtown Chicago for his weekly treatments, purchase the medical supplies and prescription medicines that he needs, and make it possible for Ms. Corona to purchase groceries to keep up with the dietary needs of her son. Thank you for your prayers and donations. The road to recovery is long and the aggressive chemotherapy and blood transfusions are going to take their toll on little Jacob. But with your prayers and support, we hope to make it a little easier for the Corona Family to deal with the financial hardship they are beginning to endure. *******************JULY 16 2019 JACOB HAS RELAPSED AND WE ARE STARTING HIS FUNDRAISING EFFORTS ALL OVER. UNFORTUNATELY THERE IS NO WAY TO RESET THE AMOUNT TO ZERO SO IT IS STILL SHOWING THE $5,400 WE THANKFULLY RAISED FOR THE FAMILY WITH HIS FIRST BATTLE BUT AS WE KNOW THE LIVING EXPENSES, PARKING EXPENSES, ETC. ENDURED THE 1ST TIME AROUND USED UP THE ENTIRE AMOUNT RAISED. WE DO APPRECIATE ANY AND ALL DONATIONS WE CAN RAISE FOR THIS SECOND BATTLE THE CORONA FAMILY IS ABOUT TO ENDURE. JACOB'S mom had to once again quit her Job after just returning a few months ago when he went into remission, however a few months back when Mrs.Corona was told he was in remission and his treatments would be less frequent and she got the OK to put him in Daycare she did and quickly returned to work! She is a very hardworking mom but unfortunately now that he has relapsed and is having weekly chemotherapy and weekly bloodwork and this is just the beginning of another much more aggressive treatment her priority is being at Jacob's side, so she had to resign from her job. The Unity In Community is supporting a fundraiser hosted by The American Legion for Jacob on 8/30/2019, you can find more information on his FB page and you can check for future event or other future fundraisers, it's Jacob Strong - Jacob Corona. We are extremely grateful to everyone for past and future donations! He is scheduled for his 3rd Chemotherapy treatment for the relapse on 8/19/2019.Update March 2020Jacob has continued with Chemotherapy, since the relapse he's done 3 different chemotherapies each bonemarrow biopsy shows they've helped but bot enough to where he qualifies for a bonemarrow transplant. The best and only option at this time is getting Stem cells from his original donor in Hope's to bring the cancer percentage down enough to qualify him for a transplant or wipe it out completely. Jacob is currently scheduled to start a 6 days chemotherapy treatment on March 11th to prepare him to receive the cells that his very amazing donor has agreed to give him. He is due to get the cells on March 17th. This is will be tough on Jacob but he is a resilient child and very strong we have faith that he will be ok.

campaigns.title: West LA SRA COVID-19 Mutual Aid Project
campaigns.description: Los Angeles has nearly 60,000 unhoused citizens. These are the people that Mayor Garcetti didn't mention until minute 23 of his 25 minute press conference regarding emergency measures being taken by the city. It's clear where the mayor's priorities lie and it is up to us as a community to help our neighbors. With no way to self-isolate and/or heal from this virus, our unhoused sisters and brothers are some of our city's most at-risk. Access to basic sanitation products can help combat the spread of bacteria within this vulnerable community.¬¨‚Ä†  With $350 dollars, our chapter can gather supplies to produce approximately 140 personal hand sanitizers. The WHO and the CDC have both approved a formula similar to Purell‚Äö√Ñ√Æ this is the recipe we'll be using. Should this garner attention and donations beyond our intial goal, we plan to create more personal sanitizers and hopefully expand to full hygiene kits.  We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Remember, an injury to one is an injury to all.¬¨‚Ä†
