campaigns.title: Garment District for Gowns: Covid-19 Support Fund
campaigns.description: GARMENT DISTRICT FOR GOWNS - COVID-19 SUPPORT FUND   COVID-19 has now afflicted more people in the United States than in any other country in the world. Each day, more people become infected and our hospitals face new challenges handling mounting patient inflows. New York has become the epicenter of the pandemic, with Governor Cuomo predicting the apex of hospitalizations to occur in 2-3 weeks‚Äö√Ñ√¥ time.  Healthcare workers worldwide are taking enormous risks on behalf of us all. In Italy, this segment represents more than 10% of Coronavirus cases, given its proximity to sick patients. And it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s become a well-known fact that Italy‚Äö√Ñ√¥s healthcare system has more hospital beds per 1,000 people than the United States, putting pressure on an already strained healthcare system.  New York City hospitals are already in dire need of more Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to protect their staff and mitigate further spread of the disease. They‚Äö√Ñ√¥re especially hurting for masks and gowns.  Fortunately, we can help - but we must act now.   To accelerate this effort, we have launched the COVID-19 Support Fund to help finance and scale the manufacturing of medical gowns, beginning with healthcare workers in New York City.   WE HAVE THE CAPACITY TO MAKE THESE ITEMS IN NEED    Who are we?   We are a group of independent professionals in the fashion industry, with training and experience working for brands such as Ralph Lauren, Dior, Marchesa, The Row, Vera Wang, Ralph Rucci, and Oscar de la Renta. We are designers, product developers, pattern makers, and sewers, and we‚Äö√Ñ√¥re strengthened by our relationships with factories in New York City‚Äö√Ñ√¥s Garment District.¬¨‚Ä†  We have assembled our skills and resources to help supply healthcare workers with an essential piece of protection needed on the front lines. We have already self-financed our first batch of 300 gowns and have alerted Governor Cuomo‚Äö√Ñ√¥s office and Tri-State area hospitals to coordinate on distribution.  We need your help to continue making more gowns and scale fast.    First milestone:  The first batch of gowns will be delivered to Mount Sinai   Jersey City Hospital by April 2nd.   WHY GOWNS?¬¨‚Ä†   Our team is already able to source the appropriate fabrics needed to make medical gowns that meet the rigorous standards of the healthcare community. Unlike face masks, which require FDA-approved filters that are harder to come by in this moment of crisis, medical gowns are made of high performance fabrics, which we are versed in handling and feel confident we can produce in batch quantities. However, sufficient funding is needed to maintain our output.    Pictured above:  Nurses at Mount Sinai West wear trash bags when left with no better alternative for protective gear, according to the  NY Post ¬¨‚Ä†.¬¨‚Ä†   WHY NOW?   On March 27th, Gov. Cuomo laid out the state‚Äö√Ñ√¥s current medical supply stockpile, against anticipated quantities needed ahead of the virus‚Äö√Ñ√¥ peak (see Figure 1). NY state currently has 15,000 gowns on hand, with another 145,000 expected from the federal government.  The state needs a total of 20 million gowns in three weeks to adequately protect healthcare workers from the virus.      Figure 1:  Slide depiction of Gov. Cuomo‚Äö√Ñ√¥s statewide equipment needs, reported by  Syracuse.com ¬¨‚Ä†.   ABOUT OUR GOWNS    The main fabric  is an extra strength DWR coated (Durable Water Repellent) ripstop nylon, with a breathable polyurethane coating.¬¨‚Ä† It was originally manufactured for military use in the Afghan War.   The cuffs  are made of organic cotton jersey knit (eco friendly OEKO-TEX), and ensure a secure and sealed fit at the wrist.   The pattern  is worn with an opening in the back, like standard medical gowns. Medical workers put them on arms-first, then tie around the waist and back of the neck. Waist ties are long enough to tie in the back or front, aiding in quick application and removal. (See early-stage prototype in Figure 2)   The sewers  are volunteers from our own professional networks, as well as other incredible individuals who saw the announcements we put out and stepped up. Each one of our sewers receives their cutwork in a premade kit, which includes :¬¨‚Ä†   Cutwork for x-amount of gowns   Thread   Latex gloves to use while sewing the gowns, and instructions to wear a mask as they sew   Instructions to clean their station with bleach before and after they sew   An extra bag to return their finished gowns in   The logistics :   Rolls of our fabric are transferred from supplier to driver, both wearing masks and gloves.   Cutting room is sterilized and all pattern work is performed with masks and gloves   Cutwork and sewing/ safety supplies are sprayed with disinfectant before being bagged, while wearing masks and gloves.   A member of our team delivers the bag to the sewer without physical contact   Sewer disinfects workspaces with bleach prior to sewing, and wears a mask and gloves while working.¬¨‚Ä†   Should sewer step away from the project midway, they are instructed to place the garment in its respective bag until returning. Sewing area will then be re-sterilized.   Once the gown is complete, sewer puts finished product in a new bag that a member of our team will pick up, maintaining six feet of separation from one another.   The cost:  It currently costs us an average of $5.50 per gown. This includes materials, trucking for fabric delivery, cutting room costs, and latex gloves we supply in our sewing kits for volunteer sewers.     Figure 2 : See above pictures of an early-stage prototype of our gown in a sub-fabric.   WHO WE ARE    Rachel Rothenberg-Saenz  is a graduate of Parsons School of Design who most recently works as Head of Product Design   Development for Oscar de la Renta. Previously, she has worked in both design and development capacities at Ralph Lauren, The Row, and Ralph Rucci.¬¨‚Ä†   Alex Baylis  is a graduate of Central Saint Martins University in London, who most recently works as Senior Knitwear Designer for Oscar de la Renta. Previously, she has worked at Dior, Carolina Herrera, Vera Wang, and Burberry.   Amy Tiefermann  is a graduate of Kent State University in Ohio, who most recently works as a Patternmaker for Oscar de la Renta. Previously, she has worked at Marchesa and Werkstatt.   OUR COMMITMENT   We will be posting stories   photos of our donations, hospitals and healthcare workers you are helping on our Instagram @ garmentdistrictforgowns ¬¨‚Ä†   OUR ACHIEVEMENTS IN A NUTSHELL¬¨‚Ä†     Secured fabric   Secured factories in the Garment District ready to help   Secured a team of 30+ volunteer sewers   Built contacts with hospitals and state representatives to securely guide donations   Began production of 300 gowns to be donated by April 2nd   OUR FUNDING    100% of the funds  will go directly to financing the production of our gowns and other urgent PPE for frontline healthcare workers at New York City‚Äö√Ñ√¥s largest hospitals. No one on the team will benefit financially in any way from this campaign.¬¨‚Ä† We are committed to ensuring that our suppliers provide us with the most competitive rates available for medical-grade gowns, so that the value of each dollar we raise is maximized. Should we raise excess funds and supplies, we hope to expand our donations to other hospitals in need.    FAQs    Are donations tax deductible?¬¨‚Ä†   Currently, donations are not tax-deductible. We are in a process of filing a 501(c)(3) charity and will update our status as soon as possible.    Aside from donations, how can you help?¬¨‚Ä†   We are seeking:   Garment District volunteer factories   Experienced volunteer sewers   Thread donations (sewing supply stores are currently closed as they are ‚Äö√Ñ√∫non-essential,‚Äö√Ñ√π and thread online orders do not arrive quickly enough).   What‚Äö√Ñ√¥s next?   NY has been hit the hardest and first within the United States, however statistics show that COVID-19 will soon affect the rest of the country in a similar fashion. While we are taking care of our own state first (as the need is most dire right here, right now), we plan to expand our efforts nationwide as funding and supplies allow.   Contact:    Instagram: ¬¨‚Ä† @ GarmentDistrictForGowns ¬¨‚Ä†  Facebook :  Facebook Page ¬¨‚Ä†  Email : garmentdistrictforgowns@gmail.com

campaigns.title: EMERGENZA COVID19 - SOSTENIAMO L'ITALIA & LA CRI
campaigns.description: ¬¨‚Ä†  -English Below    -Descend pour la traduction fran‚àö√üaise   ITALIANO  Da Giovani Italiani residenti all'estero, ‚àö¬Æ davvero straziante vedere che il Paese in cui siamo nati e cresciuti ‚àö¬Æ ridotto ad una grande zona rossa. Essere lontani da casa e non poter stare vicino ai nostri cari ci fa sentire impotenti difronte a questa tragedia che l'Italia intera sta affrontando.¬¨‚Ä†  E' ancora pi‚àöœÄ doloroso osservare la situazione critica del sistema sanitario nazionale. In alcune zone, i medici parlano apertamente di ‚Äö√Ñ√∫scenario di guerra‚Äö√Ñ√π in cui bisogna scegliere chi far vivere e chi lasciare morire.  Per questo vogliamo fare qualcosa, dall'estero.¬¨‚Ä†  Nonostante non viviamo pi‚àöœÄ in Italia, noi membri della Rete dei Giovani Italiani in Belgio (REGIB) vogliamo unirci e dare il nostro aiuto alle zone pi‚àöœÄ colpite dal Coronavirus. Per questo, abbiamo deciso di iniziare una raccolta fondi per supportare le strutture sanitarie delle zone pi‚àöœÄ colpite.¬¨‚Ä†  Tutti i fondi raccolti saranno versati alla CROCE ROSSA ITALIANA (CRI).  La CRI¬¨‚Ä† ‚àö¬Æ stata attiva su tutto il territorio nazionale fin dall'inizio dell‚Äö√Ñ√¥allerta Covid-19 con molteplici ruoli.¬¨‚Ä† Il personale e i volontari stanno svolgendo molte altre attivit‚àö‚Ä† cruciali nella battaglia contro questa epidemia tra cui le operazioni di soccorso sanitario, supporto logistico e informativo alla popolazione, controllo e¬¨‚Ä† screening dei malati e organizzazione dei¬¨‚Ä† servizi di assistenza alla popolazione, fra cui la spesa a casa.  Per questo chiediamo a tutti di aiutarci in questo impegno. Le donazione andranno a supportare gli operatori della CRI in prima linea e ad evitare il collasso del sistema sanitario italiano.  Ogni centesimo pu‚àö‚â§ fare realmente la differenza, per riuscire ad aiutare i medici e i malati.   Unisciti a noi facendo una donazione: tutti insieme possiamo vincere questa difficile battaglia!!¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  * La Rete Giovani Italiani in Belgio  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† (REGIB) ‚àö¬Æ un'associazione nata per supportare i giovani italiani all'arrivo e durante il loro soggiorno in Belgio, attraverso la creazione di una rete sociale e professionale.  L'associazione si pone come obiettivi di diventare un punto di riferimento per i giovani italiani in Belgio, all‚Äö√Ñ√¥arrivo, durante il loro soggiorno ed per il rientro in Italia.  Ci impegniamo inoltre per creare un forum per i giovani per fare sistema paese, interagendo con vari attori italiani ed Europei in Belgio, e promuovendo la cultura italiana fra i giovani in Belgio.   ____________________________________________________________________________________  ENGLISH:  As Young Italians living abroad, it strikes our very own cords to see our beloved country suffer for the outbreak of the notorious disease COVID-19.¬¨‚Ä† Being far from our home, and not being able to stay close to the people we love most, makes us feel powerless in front of the tragedy that our country faces.  Furthermore, it is even more hurtful seeing our national healthcare system not being able to cope with such an emergency. In some areas of the peninsula, doctors talk about 'a war scenery', having to arbitrarily decide who lives and who dies due to the lack of space in hospitals.¬¨‚Ä†  Hence, our will to do something, even if little, to try to help our country.¬¨‚Ä†  Despite the fact that we no longer live in Italy,¬¨‚Ä† us, members of REGIB - Rete dei Giovani Italiani in Belgio (Network of Young Italians in Belgium), would like to unite and support the areas most affected by the COVID-19.¬¨‚Ä†  All funds collected will be donated to the ITALIAN RED CROSS - CROCE ROSSA ITALIANA (CRI).¬¨‚Ä†  The Italian Red Cross is the Italian national branch of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. CRI has been truly helpful and active on the full national territory since the first outbreak of the disease. The personnel and the volunteers are tirelessly supporting crucial activities in the fight against this pandemic, from first aid care to screening, from logistics to service aid.  For this reason, we ask to all our friends to help us fund-raise and spread the word about this important initiative.¬¨‚Ä†  Every cent can truly make a difference, and help the healthcare personnel as well as the affected ones.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  Help us by giving what you can: united we stand strong and we can win this fight!!  * The Young Italians Network in Belgium ¬¨‚Ä†is an association which aims to support both incoming young Italians and young Italians already living in Belgium, through the creation of a social and professional network.  The association aims to become a landmark for young Italians arriving and living in Belgium, but also for those going back to Italy. We are committed to creating a forum for young Italians, as well as strengthening national ties, through interactions with the most important Italian and European players in Belgium and in Europe, with the aim to promote Italian culture amongst youth in Belgium.   ________________________________________________  FRANCAIS :  Pour des Jeunes Italiens r‚àö¬©sidents ‚àö‚Ä† l‚Äö√Ñ√¥‚àö¬©tranger, c‚Äö√Ñ√¥est vraiment d‚àö¬©chirant de voir le pays dans lequel nous sommes n‚àö¬©s et avons grandi r‚àö¬©duit ‚àö‚Ä† une grande zone rouge. ‚àö√§tre loin de la maison et ne pas pouvoir ‚àö‚Ñ¢tre pr‚àö¬Æs des n‚àö¬•tres nous fait sentir impuissants face ‚àö‚Ä† cette trag‚àö¬©die que l‚Äö√Ñ√¥Italie tout enti‚àö¬Ære est en train d‚Äö√Ñ√¥affronter.  C‚Äö√Ñ√¥est encore plus douloureux d‚Äö√Ñ√¥observer la situation critique du syst‚àö¬Æme sanitaire national. Dans certaines zones, les m‚àö¬©decins parlent ouvertement de ¬¨¬¥¬¨‚Ä†sc‚àö¬©nario de guerre¬¨‚Ä†¬¨¬™ dans lequel il faut choisir qui faire vivre et qui laisser mourir.  Face ‚àö‚Ä† cela, nous voulons faire quelque chose, depuis l‚Äö√Ñ√¥‚àö¬©tranger.  Bien que nous ne vivions plus en Italie, nous, membres de la Rete dei Giovani Italiani in Belgio (R‚àö¬©seau des Jeunes Italiens en Belgique), nous voulons nous unir et apporter notre aide aux zones les plus touch‚àö¬©es par le Coronavirus. Pour cela, nous avons d‚àö¬©cid‚àö¬© de lancer une collecte de fonds pour soutenir les structures sanitaires de ces zones.  L‚Äö√Ñ√¥enti‚àö¬Æret‚àö¬© des fonds collect‚àö¬©s sera revers‚àö¬©e ‚àö‚Ä† la CROIX ROUGE ITALIENNE (CRI).  La CRI a ‚àö¬©t‚àö¬© active sur tout le territoire national depuis le d‚àö¬©but de l‚Äö√Ñ√¥alerte Covid-19 et a jou‚àö¬© de nombreux r‚àö¬•les. Le personnel et les volontaires s‚Äö√Ñ√¥occupent de nombreuses autres activit‚àö¬©s cruciales dans la bataille contre cette ‚àö¬©pid‚àö¬©mie, entre autres les op‚àö¬©rations de secours sanitaire, le support logistique et informatif ‚àö‚Ä† la population, le contr‚àö¬•le et le d‚àö¬©pistage des malades et l‚Äö√Ñ√¥organisation des services d‚Äö√Ñ√¥assistance ‚àö‚Ä† la population, comme la livraison des courses ‚àö‚Ä† domicile.  Pour toutes ces raisons, nous demandons ‚àö‚Ä† tous de nous aider dans cet engagement. Les donations aideront ‚àö‚Ä† soutenir les op‚àö¬©rateurs de la CRI en premi‚àö¬Ære ligne et ‚àö‚Ä† ‚àö¬©viter l‚Äö√Ñ√¥effondrement du syst‚àö¬Æme sanitaire italien. Chaque centime peut vraiment faire la diff‚àö¬©rence, pour r‚àö¬©ussir ‚àö‚Ä† aider les m‚àö¬©decins et les malades.  Rejoignez-nous en faisant une donation : tous ensemble nous pouvons vaincre cette dure bataille !!  * La Rete Giovani Italiani in Belgio ¬¨‚Ä† (R‚àö¬©seau des Jeunes Italiens en Belgique) est une association n‚àö¬©e pour soutenir les jeunes italiens ‚àö‚Ä† leur arriv‚àö¬©e et durant leur s‚àö¬©jour en Belgique, ‚àö‚Ä† travers la cr‚àö¬©ation d‚Äö√Ñ√¥un r‚àö¬©seau social et professionnel.  L‚Äö√Ñ√¥association a pour objectif de devenir un point de rep‚àö¬Ære pour les jeunes italiens en Belgique, ‚àö‚Ä† leur arriv‚àö¬©e, durant leur s‚àö¬©jour et lors de leur retour en Italie.  Nous nous engageons entre autres ‚àö‚Ä† cr‚àö¬©er un forum pour les jeunes afin d‚Äö√Ñ√¥‚âà√¨uvrer entre compatriotes, en interagissant avec divers acteurs italiens et europ‚àö¬©ens en Belgique, et en faisant la promotion la culture italienne chez les jeunes en Belgique.

campaigns.title: Funding Support For Those Affected by Covid-19
campaigns.description: With the outbreak of Coronavirus progressing each day, the probability of a lockdown or self-isolation increases. This will have the health benefits of containing and reducing the spread of the virus. In reality for people, there are still bills to be paid.  For some, employers will be providing Statutory Sick Pay (SSP) from day 1.  For others , no such pay will be available.  There are parents that would need to take time off if their child's school closes. Those that are self employed will also not have the benefit of an employer paying SSP.  Yes there are options of benefits that can be claimed, however this is not always a quick and straightforward task.  This fundraiser is a to be a relief to those that really need it should the situation arise.  I have set up a dedicated email address; which will be updated on here if the funding is successful.¬¨‚Ä†  As with all support, there will need to be a request for help and appropriate vetting to prevent abuse.  Thank you for taking the time, and hopefully we can help those that will be in need.

campaigns.title: Support Milan in COVID-19 for my 30th birthday
campaigns.description: Hello,  you know, the time is not easy in Italy right now, especially in Milan my hometown.  I struggle to have fun on my 30th birthday when my family is locked at home, scared to get sick if they go out to buy some food, or when my friends are caged alone in their apartments with no social life. Please use your birthday wishes to support our hospitals in fighting COVID-19, they need help to buy equipments and to save lives in these days.  Let's win the fight soon together!  Donations will go to  ASST Fatebenefratelli Sacco    https://www.asst-fbf-sacco.it  ¬¨‚Ä†  ------  Ciao, Non ‚àö¬Æ facile festeggiare i tuoi 30anni in questi giorni lontano dalla famiglia e dagli amici, che ti raccontano come si vive intrappolati a casa. Sei lontano da casa, vuoi tornarci ma non puoi e non devi farlo.¬¨‚Ä†  I tuoi auguri di compleanno saranno pi‚àöœÄ unici se di supporto agli ospedali di Milano che combattono ogni giorno per salvare i nostri nonni e i nostri genitori da COVID-19.  Vinciamo presto insieme!  Il tuo aiuto andr‚àö‚Ä† all'associazione  Fatebenefratelli Sacco , e contribuirai all'acquisto di attrezzature, beni e servizi per il miglioramento delle attivit‚àö‚Ä† di cura e di assistenza.   https://www.asst-fbf-sacco.it

campaigns.title: Well-Paid Maids COVID-19 Employee Relief Fund
campaigns.description: Well-Paid Maids is the Washington, DC area's only living-wage home cleaning company. Our business has closed temporarily¬¨‚Ä†in order to keep staff and customers safe during the COVID-19/Novel Coronavirus outbreak.  As a company that cares about the well-being of our employees, we are doing everything we can to cushion the blow that we know this temporary closing will have. Our staff will be able to draw down on their paid time off immediately if they choose to do so. Beyond that, each staff member will receive a furlough bonus of $500 to help cover expenses before unemployment insurance begins to be paid out.¬¨‚Ä† In addition, the company will continue to provide health, dental, vision, and short-term disability insurance while staff are on furlough and we will pay for 100% of the premium costs.  Unfortunately, we know that this is not going to be enough to avoid major disruptions to their lives and it does not appear that we can count on the federal government for assistance right now.¬¨‚Ä† Furthermore, as the length of our shutdown increases, our ability to continue to assist staff will be impaired due to a lack of revenue and depletion of business savings.¬¨‚Ä†  As a result, we are trying to raise $50,000.¬¨‚Ä† It's enough to cover a bit more than $3,000 per employee, which will help them make do until the country returns to normal. These funds will be split evenly and paid out directly to our furloughed workers.¬¨‚Ä†  We know that you and your family are likely struggling during this difficult time as well.¬¨‚Ä† Thank you for whatever support you can provide.

campaigns.title: Project Resilient
campaigns.description: Project Resilient is a countywide partnership to organize fundraising, meal delivery, and other support to those in need throughout the county following the outbreak of COVID-19. Funds raised here will be used to purchase meals from local businesses and not-for-profit organizations, helping to keep dollars circulating in our food economy while we ensure that everyone is fed, as well as for other support.  We are aiming to raise $5 million dollars. That may sound like a lot, but it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s roughly the cost of a week‚Äö√Ñ√¥s groceries for everyone in the county. Please step up and contribute to help your neighbors - any amount, small or large, will be a huge help. For more information on Project Resilient visit:  https://ulstercountyny.gov/coronavirus

campaigns.title: Old Vinings Inn Team Covid-19 Emergency Fund
campaigns.description: In light of recommendations by the CDC and Trump administration, we suspended dining room service during all shifts as of Tuesday, March 17th.¬¨‚Ä† This is a hard, but necessary, decision.¬¨‚Ä† The Old Vinings Inn family must do our part in ""flattening the curve"" and helping prevent further illnesses and deaths.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  The impact to our staff is dramatic - the restaurant is their livelihood!¬¨‚Ä† We hope we have brought warm memories and comfort to your family over the last 25 years and today we are asking for your help to do the same for our team!¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†Please donate today to ensure our staff can pay rents, put food on their families tables, and stay safe during this unprecedented crisis.

campaigns.title: Corona Care Packages
campaigns.description: Hello!¬¨‚Ä† We are raising money to create care packages for the homeless to prevent the spread of COVID-19. In these dubious times, it is important to remember that taking care of our community members is our greatest asset. By making sure those around you are healthy, you are also protecting the health of you and your loved ones.¬¨‚Ä†  We plan to distribute these care packages on March 21st to local community resources (homeless shelters, food pantries, soup kitchen, and free clinics)¬¨‚Ä† in New York City, Northern California, and Southern California.¬¨‚Ä†  The care packages will include the following items:¬¨‚Ä† 1. Hand sanitizer 2. Alcohol wipes 3. Tissues 4. Non-perishable food¬¨‚Ä† 5. An infographic that contains up to date and accurate information regarding the COVID-19 symptoms, to dos and not to dos, information regarding where to get tested, when to get tested, and a list of resources they can peruse during this time.¬¨‚Ä†  If you can donate anything at all, it would mean a great deal and would be a huge step in community based pro-social action.¬¨‚Ä†  We will also be posting a digital copy of the infographic for free and will try to accommodate as many languages as possible.

campaigns.title: Fifth Street Commons Pandemic Fund
campaigns.description: Please donate to support Fifth Street Commoners who are facing a significant loss of income due to the coronavirus pandemic.  One of our stated values is income diversity:   Mixed Income:  We welcome those who wish to be a part of this community from a wide economic spectrum. There may be residents who can afford to live anywhere, but choose to live here because of where and who we are. And there may be residents who struggle with making ends meet. A thriving community requires opportunity and engagement across this broad range.¬¨‚Ä†    If you are able , please contribute* in support of those who were struggling to make ends meet BEFORE this pandemic hit.   If you are affected , you can contact Petra to request money collected through this GoFundMe.  * Note that GoFundMe's take is 2.9% of your donation plus $.30. A ""tip"" is unnecessary and does not go toward covering GoFundMe's take.

campaigns.title: Helping Starving Artists  through COVID19 crisis!
campaigns.description: Hello to All !  This is the time for us to be vulnerable. We never thought phrase ‚Äö√Ñ√∫ Starving Artists‚Äö√Ñ√π will come true in our lives but it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s here and we must accept it. Trust us , we would never want to show our puffy eyes all over internet if we didn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t need help, it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s not easy but it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s necessary at this moment in our lives. We are faced to ask our community for help. We believe in the power of communities especially in the global crisis like this. We All are One! Many of you know we are artists living in Atlanta , GA and our favorite/main way to share our art is through local/national arts/crafts festivals, music, yoga events , local farmers markets etc so we can interact with our customers in person exchanging smiles, sharing our gifts and positive vibe through all the communities. Like you All know due to Corona Virus global crisis All the events/festivals/gatherings/shops/restaurants have been canceled , closed, postponed at least for next two months (who knows what will happen after that) which is so understandable because Health is the most important thing and we are aware it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s important to follow the guidance in order not to spread the virus. Social distancing as much as possible is a must at this moment. Our hearts goes out to our fellow artists and All the people impacted by this global crisis. We created Go Fund Me in hopes of people who are ABLE to contribute and help us through this unexpected crisis so we can stay strong, healthy and creative. We will be grateful for any generosity you can share, every penny counts. These funds will help us with ¬¨‚Ä†paying rent, utilities, car payments, credit card bills, ¬¨‚Ä†phone, internet bills , medical bills, food for us and our furry friends, art supplies so we are still be able to continue making our product for future events/festivals/stores ,you know, all the necessary things to survive through this crisis. ( We understand some of the companies might work with us through this but it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s unknown/uncertain ¬¨‚Ä†so far since ¬¨‚Ä†everyone is impacted by this)¬¨‚Ä†  If you would like to support us through our product we offer free shipping on our online shop   https://vallets.com  ¬¨‚Ä†or our Etsy Shop ¬¨‚Ä†  https://www.etsy.com/shop/IngaAndEvija  ¬¨‚Ä† add coupon code FREESHIPPING at the check out and you all are set:) PS. Also since we will have more time on our hands for some time , we are willing to donate our time if anyone needs any help, please let us know.  Please share !  With Love Inga And Puffy Eyes

campaigns.title: Fund for the Arts during the Corona Pandemic
campaigns.description: If you caught my video where I play piano for a bunch of awesome  celebrities and thought:   ""Gee that guy's cool, I wonder what I can do to help him out!""¬¨‚Ä†  Well... here's how, you total legend!    We need creative people, right? And we need their work. I count myself lucky to work with talented, open-minded, generous people who give the world music, books, theatre, poetry, fashion, design, arts and crafts, stories for television, stories on instagram, stories on stage and stories in your living room.¬¨‚Ä†  These people mean everything to me, and I know they mean a lot to you too. Since the huge changes occurring across the globe, the arts sector has taken a huge knock, and many funds have been set up to help those who are suffering the most.¬¨‚Ä†  The following funds enable the people who write your favorite Netflix series, or the people who produced your favorite album on Spotify to keep working and creating during this time of crisis. We need this more than ever now, so anything you're willing to give - I'm going to share amongst some of the best organisations out there. Some examples are:    https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2020/mar/16/uk-theatre-coronavirus-cancellations   - GIGAID - Set up by Bryony Kimmings, this fund is matching artists with funding during this unprecedented time.    https://www.artsminds.co.uk/   - ARTSMINDS - an organisation that do¬¨‚Ä† incredible work proving mental health support in the arts.¬¨‚Ä†    https://alpmusicals.com/donate   - AMPLIFY - a fund that works closely with artists in theatre on new work, providing nurturing experiences  and facilitating opportunities for creators of all ages.¬¨‚Ä†  My website is  www.jordanclarkemusic.co.uk   I live and work in London, and can guarantee you something awesome and creative will come from your donation. I've worked in live creative¬¨‚Ä† events for my whole career, and have called upon the help of the charities above, or worked closely with them on projects of my own. I know first-hand what a difference a bit of support can make.  Can't wait to hear from you all!  Spread love at this crazy time.  Jordan

campaigns.title: Covid-sostegno agli OSPEDALI DI SASSUOLO e MODENA
campaigns.description: In questo momento di grande crisi dal punto di vista sociale e sanitario, possiamo¬¨‚Ä†fare del nostro meglio per dare il nostro contributo.   Medici, scienziati e tutto il personale medico lavorano strenuamente per affrontare la grave epidemia che ci ha colpiti.    Oltre a fare la nostra parte restando il pi‚àöœÄ possibile a casa per limitare la diffusione del virus , possiamo anche dare il nostro contributo ¬¨‚Ä†per sostenere direttamente gli ospedali della nostra zona.  Sono in contatto con  Sonia Venturelli  della  direzione generale dell' Ospedale di Sassuolo  che mi ha informato che in questo momento i dispositivi di protezione sono quelli di cui pi‚àöœÄ necessitano. Hanno bisogno nello specifico di:¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†   Mascherine chirurgiche   Mascherine FFP2 FFP3   Calzari fino al ginocchio   Occhiali protettivi con bande laterali   Mi sono¬¨‚Ä† messa in contatto anche con l‚Äö√Ñ√¥ausl di Modena chiedendo il nominativo di un referente per le donazioni e illustrando l‚Äö√Ñ√¥iniziativa, chiedendo anche a loro di conoscere cosa serve maggiormente in questo momento.¬¨‚Ä†     OGNI donazione anche la pi‚àöœÄ piccola ‚àö¬Æ importante, perch‚àö¬© la comunit‚àö‚Ä† e la collettivit‚àö‚Ä† possono davvero fare la differenza.   I fondi raccolti saranno direttamente devoluti agli  Ospedali di Sassuolo e Modena  per far fronte alla crisi in atto.  Partiamo da un obiettivo di 20.000‚Äö√á¬® ma so che Sassuolo e ¬¨‚Ä†la provincia di MODENA risponderanno fiere e supereranno le aspettative!

campaigns.title: Families in Florence, Italy - Corona Virus
campaigns.description: Corona Virus Florence, Italy  ¬¨‚Ä†  Hey!¬¨‚Ä† This is Carmina Aguirre coming to you from Florence, Italy.  ¬¨‚Ä†  As of today, 12 March 2020, we are in a total lockdown to combat a worsening¬¨‚Ä† Corona Virus crisis.  ¬¨‚Ä†  Late last night, the Italian Government announced that only the grocery stores / food shops¬¨‚Ä†   pharmacies would remain open.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† This is in an attempt to avoid panic buying that took place earlier this week.  ¬¨‚Ä†  The message here is:¬¨‚Ä† STAY AT HOME  ¬¨‚Ä†  If you must go out it is for essential reason only and we must practice a safe distance of one meter from the next person.  ¬¨‚Ä†  Food and medicine are guaranteed.¬¨‚Ä† All supermarkets and grocery stores selling food will remain open.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† Food production and food suppliers will continue to work as normal.    Pharmacies will be open with reduced hours. You can still go to the doctor, however¬¨‚Ä† you cannot enter waiting rooms of hospital emergency areas, senior citizens homes or hospice unless there are serious reasons.  ¬¨‚Ä†  People are only allowed to leave home to buy food or medicine, and only one member of the family can do so.  ¬¨‚Ä†  ANYONE who leaves home MUST carry an self-declaration document even if you are going to the store or pharmacy.  Gatherings of any kind are prohibited.¬¨‚Ä† You are not allowed to visit family or friends unless for serious reasons.¬¨‚Ä† Organizing dinners and parties inside your home is prohibited.  All Bars, restaurants, pubs, and bakeries are closed.¬¨‚Ä† All spas   salons are closed.  All church services are cancelled, to include baptisms, weddings, and funerals.  You can go for a run or park as long as you keep the safe distance.  Dogs can be walked only in the immediate vicinity of your residence.  No travel to holiday homes or vacation spots.  ¬¨‚Ä†  There is an eerie feeling in the streets as I walk my dog in our immediate vicinity‚Äö√Ñ¬∂¬¨‚Ä† the streets are empty with the exception of a few individuals on their way to the grocery store with there rolling shopping bags.  ¬¨‚Ä†  It is silent.¬¨‚Ä† In a way that is uncomfortable.¬¨‚Ä† Think of New York City being the city that never sleeps, and no one is outside.¬¨‚Ä† All work is shut down.¬¨‚Ä† And there is no noise, not even the sound of construction or car horns. ¬¨‚Ä†  Here in Italy, we are on the edge of a major economical crisis.¬¨‚Ä† Average salaries in Italy range from 1000-1400 Euros per month.¬¨‚Ä† That is similar to 1100 -1600 U.S.D.¬¨‚Ä†   ¬¨‚Ä†  Most people live paycheck to paycheck.  ¬¨‚Ä†  Many in Florence work in Tourism, which took the first hit.¬¨‚Ä† Followed by restaurants,¬¨‚Ä† and even down to hair salons and local bakeries.  ¬¨‚Ä†  There are many individuals I know that don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t have enough money for groceries to even sustain them for the week, as they have already been out of work for 3-4¬¨‚Ä† weeks now.¬¨‚Ä† I have personally assisted individuals that I know by buying groceries and gifting them money to get their essentials.  ¬¨‚Ä†  Help me help those in need here in Italy!!!¬¨‚Ä†   ¬¨‚Ä†  Here‚Äö√Ñ√¥s what I am doing   Here is how YOU can Help me Help the Residents of Florence.  ¬¨‚Ä†  My mission and business,¬¨‚Ä† La Luce, (meaning ‚Äö√Ñ√∫the light‚Äö√Ñ√π in Italian) provides guidance, healing, and inspiration and helps individuals find the light among the darkness.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† As a Soul Revival Consultant, Life Coach, and Intuitive Healer, I will be donating a 50% of proceeds from La Luce from now until 15 April to those in need.¬¨‚Ä† Appointments can be booked directly at www.laluce.com.  ¬¨‚Ä†  In addition, I will be accepting donations through La Luce to go directly to local residents. The donations will be dispersed to purchase groceries, medicine,  ¬¨‚Ä† essentials.¬¨‚Ä† Additional funds may go to purchase board games and entertain for children and families.  ¬¨‚Ä†  If you would like to make a donation you can send it via PayPal to info@laluce.com or directly on my website at www.laluce.com

campaigns.title: Obtain Strength & COVID-19 Closing
campaigns.description: Obtain Strength is a local gym in Tulsa, Oklahoma which has been the home to premier strength training since 2016.¬¨‚Ä† We are unable to operate due to COVID-19 and will not be opening our doors until it is safe for the public and we are all cleared per the City of Tulsa.¬¨‚Ä† Obtain Strength fully supports the Mayor's decision and will follow all guidelines and mandates accordingly.  We have started this GoFundMe at the request of members who wish to support the gym with bills and utilities during the time in which we are unable to operate with zero income.¬¨‚Ä† We will not be charging cards during our time away and ending all billing schedules, but are still required to pay the lease and overhead.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†The money will be spent to help us keep our doors open as we are closed for the foreseeable future with no opening date set.¬¨‚Ä† This is a way for members to support the gym while we are unable to operate.     This is not something that we ever planned on doing and this is all uncharted territory for us all, but if you've enjoyed what we've provided we'd appreciate you considering something back in our time of need.¬¨‚Ä† The money will 100% be spent on the hardships that are coming our way as a small business such as paying for the lease, utilities, and more.¬¨‚Ä† The amount we are asking for should be able to cover us for about a month which hopefully by then we can re-open.  Thank you all very much for the support and please be safe out there.

campaigns.title: Family in sudden crisis; help a loving mother
campaigns.description: I write to you all today on behalf of my mother, Sandra. My hero, an extraordinary mother, wife, friend, and employee. I am starting a ""GoFundMe"" page to help her during this time of need. My mother was admitted to the hospital on Tuesday, April 30th, 2019 after enduring bouts of severe abdominal pain and fever. Upon admission, they gathered lab work, she underwent a pelvic ultrasound, a CT scan, and further examinations. The physicians at Banner Hospital were able to identify a ruptured cyst on her left ovary, a tubo-ovarian abscess of her left fallopian tube and further infection that had spread to her organs. They tried multiple strong antibiotics and a drain to help the infection, this failed to improve her condition. On Wednesday, May 1st, momma underwent surgery and had her left fallopian tube, left ovary and appendix removed. As I write this on the 5th of May, my mother remains in critical condition. The doctors suspect the infection is widespread and she will most likely need additional surgery. I plead that you all help us in our time of need. My mother and father, the breadwinners, are currently not working due to the nature of my mother's situation. Me, their eldest daughter, I am currently recovering from a recent Rottweiler attack to the face and my youngest sister is currently recovering from right hip surgery. We have had quite a tough few weeks. We just need the support of our friends, family and our community to get through this. My mother does have medical insurance, unfortunately, she has quite a large deductible. If we can raise this money, we would be able to cover her medical expenses and their lost wages for this week. We hope she will recover soon and I will update the page to keep you all posted. Thank you in advance for all of your help. All donations matter and are greatly appreciated.    We are a strong family unit and we just want to get past this and be able to return to our lives as normal.¬¨‚Ä†  -Brenda Corona

campaigns.title: We will beat Coronavirus! Fight for Wuhan
campaigns.description: We are SPARK Republic, an organization of the Chinese American community. Our mission is to use Chinese culture as a carrier to promote social progress and build a spiritual home for Chinese Americans. Our three focuses are based on love, inherit culture, and focusing. The first focus is love, which means we‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll be organizing social events-such as fundraising, donation, teaching children living in hills--in order to spread the love to the community. The second is based on culture inheriting. As Chinese Americans, we also have projects and activities to promote Chinese culture and art. Thirdly, we will focus our spirit and mission, creating a welcoming and helpful environment/community for Chinese American students. In the future, we will be reaching out to different states and China to help plan trips, college applications, and internships.   On behalf of our Spark organization, our goal is to help Wuhan, China and we have the responsibility to help those who have been affected by this deadly virus, which is circulating all around the world. According to the New York Times, in Wuhan, there are already more than 14,000 people affected, and more than 300 have died from this severe virus. Not only in China, but the United States so far has shown 8 cases with one of which hits in the bay area. With the severity of this disease, we want to help by holding a Go-Fund-Me fundraiser to provide supplies for the affected people in Wuhan and their scarcity in medical supplies.   We will beat Coronavirus! campaigns.title: Help our local businesses survive COVID-19
campaigns.description: I know that these are difficult times for small businesses and I wanted to do something to help.  While we can't go out and about as we usually would, why not donate the money you'd be spending on your lunch if you weren't working from home, or the brunch you'd have on a Sunday with friends?  I know some people aren't earning at the moment but thought it would be a great help if those who can afford to could help those affected.  I am going to write a list of Glasgow businesses that I know are struggling with but please do message me (Instagram @donnamh92) if you have any suggestions of who the money should be shared between.

campaigns.title: Brandos Servers COVID 19 Lay Offs
campaigns.description: Due to the COVD19 emergency, all NJ restaurant service staff found themselves out of work on March 16.   Brando‚Äö√Ñ√¥s 14 servers, bartenders and ¬¨‚Ä†bussers are not part time or seasonal workers. They do not work here to supplement income from a day job. ¬¨‚Ä†They are CAREER SERVERS with families to support and gratuities are their ONLY source of income.¬¨‚Ä†    Gone overnight, and without warning. Unemployment benefits fall far short of this, and may take some time to be distributed.¬¨‚Ä†    We realize that many other occupations are affected by this crisis, but if you are ¬¨‚Ä†lucky enough to be financially comfortable, whether you have enjoyed Brando‚Äö√Ñ√¥s service as part of your weekly routine or if your family has made memories with us for special celebrations... please make a gift to these hardworking people ASAP. If you are local and have any job opportunities for them that would also be greatly appreciated.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Aleks & Team, Misfit Bar Berlin, Corona
campaigns.description: Hallo Ihr Lieben !  Wir sind seit guten 20 Jahren eine kleine feine Bar mit einem idyllischen Biergarten mitten im Herzen von Berlin, ein Treffpunkt f‚àö¬∫r Berliner und internationale G‚àö¬ßste.¬¨‚Ä† Auch f‚àö¬∫r uns kam die pl‚àö‚àÇtzliche Regierungs-Ansage zur Schliessung von einem auf den anderen Tag bis Ende April und vielleicht l‚àö¬ßnger ‚àö¬∫berraschend, und so hatten wir keine Zeit uns vorzubereiten, nun ist das Lager voll und die Kassen leer. Ich m‚àö‚àÇchte meine tollen Mitarbeiter sehr gerne behalten, die Kosten f‚àö¬∫r L‚àö‚àÇhne,Krankenkassen und Miete laufen weiter, solange, bis eventuelle Hilfen vom Staat greifen. Viele Menschen k‚àö‚àÇnnen mit kleinen Dingen Grosses bewirken, und wir bedanken uns ganz herzlich, wenn du uns mit einem kleinen Beitrag unterst‚àö¬∫tzt, und diesen Link weiterleitest. F‚àö¬∫r uns alle ist diese seltsame Zeit neu, haltet zusammen, bleibt gelassen, und vor allem gesund. Beste Gr‚àö¬∫sse, Eure Aleks Team

campaigns.title: Patriotic American seeks help evading Coronavirus
campaigns.description: I refused to study on Sunday for 2 years in college; then I refused to get on the dole all throughout the Obama economic Depression, even though I was unemployed then only 1 year.¬¨‚Ä† I predicted the economic collapse of 2008 5 years in advance.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† I was a very idealistic but bumbling person in college.¬¨‚Ä† I was all alone and refused to study on Sunday for at least the last two years of my time in college.¬¨‚Ä† I was not lazy and did not have a substance abuse problem, a girl problem, or any hobbies that took up much time.¬¨‚Ä† I've never used drugs, including opioids.¬¨‚Ä† I studied engineering and then chemistry, subjects in which I was not talented.¬¨‚Ä† I refused to study on Sunday because I was converting to Catholicism and was under the mistaken impression that that was a sound thing to do, though I came to realize I had been wrong when it was already too late.¬¨‚Ä† I'm not a lazy person; I believe in hard work.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†I have been unemployed for the last eight years, and for the last 5 years, I have had debilitating health problems.¬¨‚Ä† My health before then was also very bad.¬¨‚Ä† After developing chronic insomnia in 2012, I went to the famous Dr. Don Colbert of Florida, an excellent holistic doctor who made the mistake of letting me take too much active folate, a B-vitamin to improve my concentration.¬¨‚Ä† It gave me ""walking disease"", which forced me to walk vigorously up to 5 hours a day.¬¨‚Ä† This could be considered a case of Akathisia, which is usually found in completely different circumtances.¬¨‚Ä† I continued like this for two years; it destroyed my adrenal glands.¬¨‚Ä† In November 2016, I stopped taking the active folate.¬¨‚Ä† After two months, my body came off my ""active folate high"", revealing that my adrenal glands were destroyed.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†Since January 2017, I have had debilitating and chronic fatigue.¬¨‚Ä† I cannot just take iron pills or energy drinks to recover.¬¨‚Ä† My fatigue is so bad that after typing about fifteen to thirty minutes, my wrists will become very painful from fatigue.¬¨‚Ä† I cannot do office work.¬¨‚Ä† I am even too tired to read most books that I find enjoyable.¬¨‚Ä† This is not laziness or a lack of will power, but a major physical disability.¬¨‚Ä† Sustainable and meaningful recover requires a long process of supplements and treatments arranged by the famous specialist in adrenal fatigue, Dr. Carrie Lam of Orange County, California. ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†My health is so bad that in the very likely case that I catch the coronavirus, I am almost certain to die from it even though I am 36 years old.¬¨‚Ä† This is because it affects mainly old people and those with pre-existing conditions - exactly like mine.¬¨‚Ä† Therefore, I am desperate to find a way to recover from the coronavirus, as well as to help my parents pay my medical bills for Dr. Lam.¬¨‚Ä† I could not accept money from strangers unless I had some pretty precise and well-thought out plans, which I am rapidly working to devise.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†My current plan is to go out into a very sparsely populated rural area and either rent a small cabin/apartment for three months or to live in a tent if necessary in a state park.¬¨‚Ä† I will consult multiple doctors to see if this is a sound idea.¬¨‚Ä† I believe I could do this for as little as $2000-$3000.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† I would be as grateful as any man can be for somebody saving my life from certain death, which is basically what they would be doing as far as I am concerned.¬¨‚Ä† Right now, I depend on my parents for all my needs, but my parents, even though I love and respect them, are not competent or prudent.¬¨‚Ä† They will probably die from the virus too, but they are not taking it seriously.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† I would try very hard to pay my donors back and if necessary, I could get on the dole so my private donors wouldn't have to pay for my food.¬¨‚Ä† I have never had an aptitude for planning, but I have a lot of talent and I am still idealistic enough that I am willing to undergo a lot of hardship.¬¨‚Ä† I have a strong belief in personal responsibility, but I was too idealistic, unrealistic, and lonely in college to have the sense to study on Sundays.¬¨‚Ä† I have some Presbyterian, Scotch-Irish blood in me and as a result, I am stubborn and self-reliant to a fault.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†Now, though, I desperately need help to save my life.¬¨‚Ä† I am ashamed to ask for help, but I did refuse to get on the dole or on Social Security disability for 11 years.¬¨‚Ä† I could have been on the latter for five years with perfect justification, but I hate asking others for money.¬¨‚Ä† I will try very hard to repay you.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†I am still very idealistic, but for twelve years I have been fully aware that I must match my idealism with a very strong work ethic and that I was mistaken in college about studying on Sunday.¬¨‚Ä† In certain, real ways, I have never had much of a chance in life.¬¨‚Ä† My idealism was based on the idea that America was in desperately bad shape and needed timeless wisdom to recover.¬¨‚Ä† I still think America could benefit from the world's best source of not-so common common sense, Aristotle, if that makes sense.¬¨‚Ä† Aristotle has been called ""the common sense philosopher"".¬¨‚Ä† Reading him, and other old classic western books, is key to being conservative.¬¨‚Ä† This important idea is promoted at Hillsdale College, which I deeply respect.¬¨‚Ä† Democracy is collapsing, but that is something the founding Fathers themselves realized would happen after 1789.¬¨‚Ä† I strongly believe that based on the thought of Plato; Aristotle; the first Duke of Wellington (the British soldier who defeated Napoleon); and Hans Hermann Hoppe.¬¨‚Ä† While I am a patriotic American, supporting the 2nd Amendment and other bedrock American institutions, I believe America has always been decadent and doomed to collapse relatively quickly.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† I want to make the world a much more beautiful and happier place.¬¨‚Ä† I have a lot of talent and a lot of the kind of deep, classical, western-based learning that our universities should be trying to promote instead of rampant political correctness, socialism, and other non-western ideas.¬¨‚Ä† I even used to have great physical charisma, the remnants of which I still hope to use to get married and transmit to my children some day.¬¨‚Ä† I would be willing to marry a woman from a poor country, if necessary.¬¨‚Ä† Maybe my [future] children [since I have never slept with anybody or otherwise had children] can use their charisma to become famous leaders and spread a love of morality, personal responsibility, and liberty to future generations.¬¨‚Ä† I'm not pretentious or arrogant, but very humble and embarrassed.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† Unfortunately, I would love to have enough money to head to the hills as soon as possible.¬¨‚Ä† I would have been planning this a month ago, but my health is bad enough that I could not plan as quickly as I wanted.¬¨‚Ä† Yes, I am goofy and very awkward, but as goofy as I am, I can do enormous good with my life.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†PLEASE HELP ME SAVE MY OWN LIFE.

campaigns.title: Help hospitals in italy for Coronavirus
campaigns.description: !!!!!PLEASE HELP!!!!!!   As we all know, Italy has been the country most hit by the outbreak outside of China and in the world. Even if they have one of the best medical services in Europe they simply cannot deal with it as there are not enough spaces in hospitals and the staff is under incredible pressure. I, personally have been affected by having friends and family living there but this fund raising campaign is for every single one of the people affected by the virus even if not directly.¬¨‚Ä†  So I would like to raise some funds and donate them to hospitals around Lombardy and other regions around the country to help them improve the intensive and sub-intensive care. Some of the things are need to be done:   - More beds   - Medical Systems to help breathing.   - Help the staff who currently are working non-stop.   - No more deciding who to save and who not.¬¨‚Ä†    It is in this unimaginable situation that the help of each and everyone of use is vital. Even 1¬¨¬£ each will make the difference.¬¨‚Ä† I thank you in advance for your help!   ///////////////////////////////////////    !!!!!AIUTATE PER FAVORE!!!!!   Come sappiamo tutti, l`Italia e' il paese che ha subito pi‚àöœÄ danni fuori dalla cina e nel mondo. Anche se il paese ha uno dei sistemi sanitari migliori in europa, non possono combattere al meglio questa situazione perch‚àö¬© non hanno abbastanza personale e posti letto per la cura intensiva. Io personalmente sono affetto da questa situazione avendo li famigliari e amici ma questa raccolta di fondi e' per tutti quelli coinvolti e affetti dal virus anche se indirettamente.  Quindi vorrei raccogliere pi‚àöœÄ soldi possibili e donarli tutti agli ospedali in lombardia e in tutto il paese per aiutarli a aumentare i posti per la cura intensiva e per i problemi respiratoti, per riuscire a gestire pi‚àöœÄ persone possibili e non lasciare nessuno indietro. queste sono alcune delle cose di cui hanno bisogno bisogno:   - Pi‚àöœÄ posti letto   - Sistemi per aiutare la respirazione assistita.   - Aiutare lo staff e i medici che stanno lavorando in prima linea e stanno facendo sforzi inimmaginabili .   - Evitare che loro stessi debbano decidere chi vive e chi muore.   E'¬¨‚Ä† proprio in queste situazioni che l'aiuto di ciascuno di noi e' vitale. Anche con donazioni da 1 Euro / Sterlina si puo fare la differenza. Vi ringrazio in Anticipo per il vostro aiuto!

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Mutual Aid Fundraiser, Ward 3
campaigns.description: Dear Ward 3 Neighbors,  As the COVID-19 crisis continues to grow, so do the needs of our community across the city. Loss of income means many families can't afford basic necessities right now, including low-income people right here in Ward 3. In its first week of operation, the Ward 3 Mutual Aid team answered dozens of calls for help with groceries and hygiene supplies. Thanks to the  incredible preparedness of local Black and Brown women organizers , our first deliveries were funded by a loan from the Wards 7 8 mutual aid group.  This is testament to the immense labor of love currently being undertaken by those who already carry so much.   The  DC Mutual Aid Network ¬¨‚Ä†now has fundraisers covering every ward.  But some wards have greater concentrations of wealth than others.  The median income of White families in Washington, DC is $132,640. The median income of Black families in the District is $42,478. Ward 3 is 81% White. Wards 7 8 are both 92% Black. (Source: dchealthmatters.org) Unequal access to medical facilities is  just as alarming  as the racial wealth gap, especially as Covid19 infections surge in DC.  East of the River, West of the Park: this is the tale of an apartheid city.   Now more than ever, we need Ward 3 to step up and help us fundraise: not just for our Ward 3 neighbors, but for EVERYONE in the city -- especially the most impacted communities in Wards 7 and 8.  The more that we can fundraise, the more that we can send to our fellow organizers East of the River.¬¨‚Ä†   Let's show all of DC how much #Ward3Cares.¬¨‚Ä†   The money you will donate will go to the following goods and services: - Fund grocery deliveries to people who have been impacted the most by the virus and/or cannot leave their homes. - Get medical and disinfecting supplies to care workers, volunteers, and ""essential workers."" - Get supplies to create hygiene care packages for needy community members. - Procure materials to produce masks for those who need them the most such as the homeless, hospital workers, nurses, doctors, grocery workers, and more. - Stock up on goods more abundantly available in Ward 3 and make bulk deliveries to other wards.¬¨‚Ä† - Provide any other mutual aid request put out by the DC community, especially those in marginalized communities.  Financial transparency: This is a grassroots effort, so we do not have an organizational bank account. Funds are transferred into an account opened by organizer Sara Swetzoff exclusively for this mutual aid effort. A small group group of admins have access to the linked PayPal account in order to reimburse service providers and grocery runners. We are meticulously tracking our spending: receipts and spreadsheets of all financial transactions can be made available to any donor upon request.  Thank you for your donation! To sign up as a Ward 3 volunteer and receive our daily email updates,  please fill out this form . To download a flyer with fundraiser   volunteer links,  please click here . Contact us any time at ward3.mutualaid@gmail.com.

campaigns.title: Havasupai Tribe COVID-19 Relief Fund
campaigns.description: The Havasupai Reservation is located in the bottom of the Grand Canyon and is the most remote reservation in the lower 48.¬¨‚Ä† The village of Supai, where 426 of the 769 Havasupai Tribal Members live, is accessible only by foot, horseback, or helicopter.¬¨‚Ä† An additional 25 Tribal Members live in the satellite community of Supai Camp, a historic and continuous settlement of the Havasupai People located within their aboriginal territory in what is now known as the Grand Canyon National Park.¬¨‚Ä† Roughly 75 percent of the jobs on the Havasupai Reservation are tied to the tourism economy, and this economy is fragile with roughly 15 percent unemployment.¬¨‚Ä† Roughly 15 percent of the community is elderly, and many are diabetic or asthmatic, and thus particularly vulnerable to Coronavirus.  ¬¨‚Ä†  Due to the rapid spread of Coronavirus and COVID-19 in the United States and Arizona, the Tribe has had to temporarily suspend tourism within the Reservation in order to protect Tribal Members from the spread of this pandemic.¬¨‚Ä† Thus, the tourism revenues the Tribe relies upon to run its government, and its Tribal Members depend upon to feed their families and their animals, has been disrupted.¬¨‚Ä† For example, a 30-day closure of the Reservation to tourism is expected to result in an estimated loss of 7 percent of the Tribe‚Äö√Ñ√¥s annual revenues.¬¨‚Ä† Additionally, non-essential travel into and out of the Canyon has been suspended, including for Tribal Members.¬¨‚Ä† However, there is only one small grocery mart in Supai.¬¨‚Ä† The Tribe is bringing in bulk food supplies to its people for themselves and their animals, but additional help is needed, especially as the pandemic is projected to remain in full force for a number of months.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†  Please consider making a donation to ensure that the Havasupai People and their animals have the food and the Personal Protection Equipment that they need to remain in their communities and be protected from exposure to the Coronavirus and COVID-19.¬¨‚Ä† Prevention is paramount because the Tribe does not have a permanent doctor or nurse on the Reservation, and they do not have a single ventilator or hospital bed.¬¨‚Ä† With such a small Tribe, the spread of this disease within the Canyon and Supai Camp could be devastating to the Tribal community and to the continued viability of the Havasupai People.¬¨‚Ä† Any contribution will help and will be greatly appreciated by the Tribe and the Havasupai People.

campaigns.title: Hilfe f‚àö¬∫r Musiker w‚àö¬ßhrend der Corona-Krise
campaigns.description: Wegen des Coronavirus wurden alle Veranstaltungen abgesagt und Bars und Pubs geschlossen. Selbstverst‚àö¬ßndlich geht die Gesundheit vor und wir m‚àö¬∫ssen als Gesellschaft zusammenhalten.¬¨‚Ä†  Gleichzeitig sind die Corona-Ma‚àö√ºnahmen f‚àö¬∫r mich als freiberuflicher Musiker existenzbedrohend. Ich bin darauf angewiesen vor Menschen Musik zu spielen und mit ihnen in Kontakt zu sein. Nun wurden meine Konzerte teilweise bis September abgesagt. Fr‚àö¬∫her konnte ich mich im Notfall mit Stra‚àö√ºenmusik ‚àö¬∫ber Wasser halten, aber auch das f‚àö¬ßllt jetzt weg.¬¨‚Ä†  Deshalb brauche ich dringend Unterst‚àö¬∫tzung, denn die Kosten gehen nat‚àö¬∫rlich weiter, nur wei‚àö√º ich beim besten Willen nicht, wie ich sie bezahlen soll.¬¨‚Ä†  Ich danke jedem Einzelnen, der mich als K‚àö¬∫nstler unterst‚àö¬∫tzen m‚àö‚àÇchte. Ich biete gerne Konzerte im Livestream an und bin f‚àö¬∫r alle weiteren Ideen offen :)  ----------------------------------------------------  Because of the Corona virus all events got canceled and bars and pubs are closed. Of course everybodys health is the most important thing at the moment and we have to stand together through this.   At the same time for me as a freelance musician this is existential. I'm relying on playing music for crowds and being¬¨‚Ä† in contact with people. Now my gigs are all canceled - a lot of them until September at least. Usually I could have went busking but we all got told not to go out for the next while.   That's why I need your help unfortunately cause the costs are still continuing and I honestly don't know how to pay for them.   I thank every single one of you who'd like to support me as an artist. I'd love to offer gigs in a live stream and I'm open for any new idea :)   www.alexwalkershm.com

campaigns.title: Coronavirus (Covid-19) Emergency Fund
campaigns.description: First off, thank you for¬¨‚Ä† taking the time to read this, means a lot.  It took a lot for me to make this, and I spent a large portion of my life doing my best to not ask for help, but alas, I am reaching out to you, whoever you may be, thank you for reading.  I am in a very tight position at the moment, due to investments in my tech repair business, and above all, recent serious dental issues. Recently I have transitioned into a new position with a new company, that doesn't look like they have any plans to provide employees with any paid sick leave for this virus, on top of that, I have recently serious tooth issues that require immediate attention (Need a root canal, and need two extractions, as I am currently dealing with chronic headaches, throbbing cheeks, sores, and pain constantly from an abscess, where I had a root canal done prior in my mid teens nearly 15 years ago, never got it capped, thus became infected, and is finally coming back to haunt me at the worst possible time).¬¨‚Ä† All my funds been allocated into getting this taken care of, as abscesses in the teeth, if ignored for long enough, can be fatal.¬¨‚Ä† I'll be honest, I'm pretty scared, considering I'm in this transition period in life, life is finally looking up, trying to make a life for myself with tech repair, and saving up all I can to fix my teeth (not insured).¬¨‚Ä† All of this is just horrible timing.¬¨‚Ä† I need whatever help I can get, no matter what amounts, to go into an emergency fund, as I'll have nothing left after I get my teeth fixed (Appointment is on Wednesday for my two extractions).¬¨‚Ä† Honestly I wasn't even sure if the amount I was asking for was appropriate, I just figured I would reach out, and ask you all.¬¨‚Ä† I apologize for being all over the place in this description, reaching out and simply asking for help is not in my nature, and makes me very uncomfortable.  Again, I really appreciate you taking the time to read my story.¬¨‚Ä† Even if all you can give are kind words of motivation, and positive energy, I'd really appreciate it.  Thank you, and please be safe during these times.

campaigns.title: Help Wuhan and Other Cities Defeat COVID-19
campaigns.description: Keep Helping China! Keep Saving Lives! Help Reconstruction!¬¨‚Ä†  The outbreak of the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) is sill under way in China, especially in Wuhan and other cities in Hubei province. Wuhan and at least 15 other cities (including Huanggang, Huangshi, Jingzhou, Yichang, ... ) have been quarantined as China attempts to halt the spread of the coronavirus. That's more than 50 million people on lockdown. Plenty of stress but shortage of everything else for these cities. There are not enough hospitals and not enough beds, not enough doctors and not enough nurses, not enough rubber gloves and not enough face masks. Millions of people are suffering from infections, panic attacks, and even death in these lockdown cities. Things are worst in many small cities.¬¨‚Ä†  Lots of families are faced with the difficult task of recovery and reconstruction after disaster. Many of them lost their family members during outbreak. Many of them have serious after-effects of a disaster, especially for children and young people.¬¨‚Ä† Many of them are devastated by the coronavirus . They need help. They need our support.¬¨‚Ä†  Let's help China defeat 2019-nCov.¬¨‚Ä† We will continue to help persons in affected areas of China (Wuhan and other seriously affected cities) to overcome this crisis and build back their life. We believe unity is strength; we beliveve faith will overcome panic attacks; and we believe we can win the battle against the virus.¬¨‚Ä†  The donations will be used to purchase medical supplies for medical staff and people who are fighting against the 2019-nCoV in Wuhan and other cities. The donations will also be used for helping hard-hit families during the outbreak and after disaster.¬¨‚Ä†  This donation campaign is launched by our Chinese community from Greater Memphis United Chinese Association, University of Memphis, University of Tenenssee, St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, Memphis Chinese Evangelical Church, the Confucius Insititute at the University of Memphis and other organizations at Memphis.  Contact:  Xinhua Yu¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† xyu2@memphis.edu  Zhaohui Wu¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† zwu6@uthsc.edu  Liang Hong¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† lhong2@uthsc.edu  Fei Zheng¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† fei.zheng@stjude.org  Dan Ye¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† dye1@memphis.edu  Liang Zhang¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† lzhang13@memphis.edu

campaigns.title: Fighting for Hiro and Brago
campaigns.description: Hello everyone, we started to love our kittens since the first day we saw them behind the glass wall of Petsmart. At the time they were only 5 months old, and even if we only wanted 1 kitten, we could not separate a brother from a sister, so we decided to take responsibility for the both of them. We named them  Hiro , the male and shy one, and  Brago , the female and playful one.¬¨‚Ä†  We started to notice that these kittens had chronic diarrhea and puke, although we went numerous times to different vets they always said that they were healthy and since they are kitten it was normal and it would go away with time. We tried different medications, all of them very expensive, and we couldn't get insurance because they were sick from day 1. We tried contacting the place where we got them from, but they didnt help us, instead they blamed it in the rescue company they got the kittens from. We also called them, but again they blame it on somebody else. Nobody helped us, financially and emotionally.  Finally, after a couple of months, we saved some money and decided to do a more serious and complete check up. That's when we discovered that they both had 3 different rate viruses: - tritrichomonas foetus/blagburni¬¨‚Ä†   -feline coronavirus   -C. Perfringens alpha toxin¬¨‚Ä†   The vet himself couldn't believe it, and told us he has never seen all these disease in one cat at the same time. The feline coronavirus is a  very serious desease,  to explain in human terms it can be compared to cancer. The other 2 illness are rare and treatments are expensive.¬¨‚Ä†  Unfortunately, we do not have the finances to support them, but we do love our kittens so much, they always sparkle our days. We want to give them justice, they haven't even been an year old yet, we want them to be healthy and to live a long happy life. They did not deserve the way they were treated from these institutions (which I will not name because we are tired of all the fights through phones and emails).¬¨‚Ä†  Any sort of help will make a difference. I will thank each and every one of you till my days for your contribution. Thank you for taking time out of your day to read this. Let's fight this together for Hiro and Brago, who cant defend and speak for themselves, and so we'll do it.

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Fundraiser
campaigns.description: COVID 19 has become an international disaster/pandemic. Healthcare providers are fighting to keep patients alive with minimal resources to protect themselves (PPE, or Personal protective equipment), and many are forced to live remotely to protect their families from the disease. New York State has been hit exceptionally hard by COVID-19 and the hospitals and ICUs are bursting at the seams. Not many can imagine what they are going through during this scary time. In addition to holding down the fort at our local hospitals, we need to remind our healthcare family in New York that we care and support them.¬¨‚Ä†   Please consider ¬¨‚Ä†donating to support our healthcare personnel in New York where providers are getting little to no rest, are being worked beyond capacity, and need all the help and love they can get . All donations will be sent to hospitals in the state of New York to be used for food/snacks, PPE, quarantine housing and other necessary medical equipment.¬¨‚Ä†      THANK YOU for your supporting our medical community.¬¨‚Ä†   Gilad M. Jaffe, MD Pulmonary ¬¨‚Ä†and Critical Care Fellow in Los Angeles.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Corona Kindness
campaigns.description: Corona Kindness    How we can help the elderly and vulnerable    We now have an opportunity to rally together as a community and help those in need. Protech Site Services are opening our office and using our skills to help those who are vulnerable and at risk.   Our resourcing team will be sourcing the necessary food and household essentials, whilst our recruiters will be engaging with volunteers and helping to distribute. ¬¨‚Ä†  How you can help    We have set up a Go Fund Me page to collect donations to help us reach more people.¬¨‚Ä†  If you can help in anyway please use the following link  Protech Site Services have already started purchasing items and have also contributed the first ¬¨¬£100 to get the page up and running. Deliveries can be sent to: Protech Site Services Ltd 12 Highbridge Street Waltham Abbey EN9 1DG ______________________________________________________________________________  If you have any suggestions on you can help  CONTACT US ON   020 8191 9100  info@protechltd.co.uk  We will continue to follow Government advice and keep the situation under review.   www.protechltd.co.uk

Daarom gaan we na deze ellende een groot feest houden ""THE GRAND OPENING CAF‚àö√¢ 'T PINTJE"" koop voor dit knalfeest alvast je waardebonnen  Op deze avond komen alle feesten samen op de Haringparty 2020, datum later te bepalen  Corona virus. Door de verplichte sluiting door het COVID-19 hebben wij jullie hulp hard nodig. graag willen wij jullie natuurlijk hartelijk bedanken voor elke donatie die jullie zouden kunnen doen! Jullie donatie word dan ook verzilverd in een cadeaubon.¬¨‚Ä†  Uiteraard zijn we ook zeer dankbaar als er anonieme giften en of donaties binnen komen zodat wij jullie weer in de zomer van 2020 met open armen kunnen ontvangen,¬¨‚Ä†   alvast bedankt voor jullie steun,  Petra en Eric.

We can all contribute to help these people who need your support more than ever  [Fran‚àö√üais]     Tous et toutes ensemble vaincront le COVID-19 en Colombie        Nous sommes deux Colombiennes vivant ‚àö‚Ä† l'‚àö¬©tranger, mais avec notre c‚âà√¨ur en Colombie. Plus de 200 personnes b‚àö¬©n‚àö¬©ficieront directement des ressources de cette campagne. L'argent r‚àö¬©colt‚àö¬© sera r‚àö¬©parti ‚àö¬©galement entre les quatre fondations:  1. campaigns.title: Feed LA County ER and ICU staff
campaigns.description: Los Angelinos and Californians‚Äö√Ñ¬∂¬¨‚Ä†  We need your help.  These dark times have affected us all.¬¨‚Ä†  But it is in these moments when we need to remain united; together.  The Covid-19 pandemic has taken countless lives...¬¨‚Ä†  And many more are stuck in hospital beds in critical condition.  Right now, priority is on restoring the situation and who better to support than the people courageously attacking our common enemy on the front lines?  We are fundraising to support the LA County Emergency Room and Staff.  Working long arduous hours, they cannot afford to leave the hospital to eat.¬¨‚Ä†  So we, as college students, are channeling 100% of all donations to order take-out at restaurants (who have also suffered tremendous losses) and deliver it to the LA County Hospital.¬¨‚Ä†  Once our goal of $5000 is reached, payments of $500 every week will go to feed 40-50 healthcare employees and patients. Pretty cool right?  And because laughter is the best medicine...our student organization is adding fun incentives for those who are on the fence about donating.  Each member of our student organization is doing a unique task to thank those who donate.  Just some of the expected bonuses entail:  Our organization doing one pushup for every dollar donated.¬¨‚Ä† A FREE 14-Day Quarantine Guide Bonus. And more...  #RepsforRona  #WorkFromHome  #SocialDistancing  #WashYourHands  To learn about what we do...  Website:¬¨‚Ä† usctsc.com¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  Instagram:   https://www.instagram.com/usctsc/  ¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  Facebook:   https://www.facebook.com/USCTransferStudentCommunity/  ¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†   Fight On!¬¨‚Ä†   ‚Äö√Ñ√¨ The Transfer Student Community at USC

campaigns.title: Supporting Vulnerable Students During COVID-19
campaigns.description: As you have heard, NYC public schools are closed until April 20th at the earliest. The primary purpose of school is to promote academic learning, but it is also the place where our students eat two meals a day, receive emotional support, socialize and develop friendships, find joy in art and music, and exercise at gym and recess. School provides students with structure and routine, but more importantly, it offers a community where children feel cared for by adults and peers. We are truly devastated that we can no longer provide this safe haven for our students.  Our home school of P.S. 75, located on 95th and West End Avenue, currently has 24 students living in shelters and temporary housing; these students who previously sought a respite from their circumstances at school will now be restricted to learning and living in their temporary homes. While the DOE is working to distribute iPads and provide free WiFi to students so they can participate in online learning, there is no timeline for when these learning tools will be attained by students. We are looking to provide these children with workbooks, activities, and games to entertain and engage them during this difficult time. All materials purchased will be shipped directly to our students at their current addresses. Although we understand this is a distressing time for all of us, we feel it is our responsibility as a community to support those who are most vulnerable, and urge you to please donate if you are able to.
