campaigns.title: Austin Asian American  COVID-19 Relief Fund
campaigns.description: Join Austin's Asian community in saving lives by supplying local medical professionals with N95 masks.  The doctors, nurses and healthcare staff who are treating COVID19 patients need these supplies the most.  With our strong personal networks, we're able to immediately secure masks from certified manufacturers that can be shipped in a week.  100% of donations go directly to the purchase and delivery of N95 masks for frontline healthcare workers in Austin.   In Italy, 1 in every 10 Coronavirus cases are healthcare workers. The head of Italy‚Äö√Ñ√¥s medical association gave his life when he continued to see patients, even when masks ran out. We must not let what happened in Italy happen here in Austin.  While we recognize masks are needed everywhere, we're working to ensure that local businesses aren't left out of the picture. The more funding we secure now, the more masks we can quickly get into healthcare workers' hands.¬¨‚Ä†  Along with practicing your own health safety measures, now is your chance to directly save lives on the front lines. Even a donation of $3, the average price of just one mask, can save so many people‚Äö√Ñ√Æwhat an incredible difference you can personally make. Please give generously today and share this campaign broadly with your networks.   FAQ    How will the funds be used?   100% of the funds go directly to facilitating the purchase and delivery of N95 masks.¬¨‚Ä† Our entire team volunteers their time and have foregone compensation for work. No one benefits financially in any way from this campaign. We're working to ensure that our suppliers give us the most competitive rates available for genuine medical-grade masks so that we can make sure that each dollar raised is maximized.¬¨‚Ä†   Why only Austin?   We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re a team of Austinites and so we have established relationships with healthcare professionals locally.   Aren‚Äö√Ñ√¥t the hospitals   government ordering these masks directly?   Yes, they're trying their best to procure masks. However, due to supply chain limitations and global competition, they are currently experiencing extreme shortages. We are fortunate to have close relationships with many of the factories producing masks and will leverage these partnerships.¬¨‚Ä†   I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve seen other charity efforts related to COVID-19. How is this one different?   Ours is directly related to the supply of masks in Austin.   How much are you paying for the masks?   We are getting manufacturer pricing on the masks, but the approximate price hovers around $3 per mask. As pricing depends on order quantity, shipping rate (in this case, the faster the better to protect our healthcare workers), and competing demand, the number may change. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re working to get the best possible price per unit while making sure that each manufacturer has the right certifications and approvals.   Are donations tax-deductible?   Currently, donations are not tax-deductible. We have realized that the need is so urgent that we must move forward and hope that you will donate.¬¨‚Ä†   I am a ER/ICU healthcare professional at an Austin facility currently treating COVID-19 patients. We are short on masks. How do we request masks?¬¨‚Ä†  Contact us here:   https://www.aaacrf.com/contact     Aside from donations, how can I help?   Please share this campaign as broadly as possible.¬¨‚Ä†  If you are a member of the press, or would like to connect with us one to one, use this form:   https://www.aaacrf.com/contact    If you are interested in endorsing this campaign, please complete this form:   https://www.aaacrf.com/endorsements    Participating partners include :    Organizations   Asian Family Support Services of Austin ¬¨‚Ä†  Asian Pacific Islander American Public Affairs ¬¨‚Ä†  Asian Real Estate Association of America ¬¨‚Ä†  Austin Asian Community Health Initiative ¬¨‚Ä†  Austin Asian Impact ¬¨‚Ä†  Austin Chapter of Taiwanese Chambers of Commerce ¬¨‚Ä†  Austin Chinese American Network Bangladesh Association of Greater Austin ¬¨‚Ä†  Cambodian Foundation, USA ¬¨‚Ä†  Caring for Cambodia   Greater Austin Asian Chamber of Commerce   Interfaith Action of Central Texas ¬¨‚Ä†  Korean American Association of Greater Austin ¬¨‚Ä†  Network of Asian Organizations ¬¨‚Ä†  Vietnamese American Community of Austin Texas ¬¨‚Ä†   Businesses   CAS Engineers ¬¨‚Ä†  Chinatown Center ¬¨‚Ä†  Encotech Engineering Consultants, Inc. ¬¨‚Ä†  Heritage Title ¬¨‚Ä†  Kupplin Worldwide ¬¨‚Ä†  LT Commercial ¬¨‚Ä†  MT Supermarket ¬¨‚Ä†  Pearlstone Partners LLC ¬¨‚Ä†  Real International ¬¨‚Ä†  SOAL Technologies ¬¨‚Ä†  Sperry LT Commercial Group ¬¨‚Ä†   Individuals  Marina Bhargava  Savy Buoy Robert and Emily Lee Lynn Yuan

campaigns.title: Masks for Nurses in Poland against COVID-19
campaigns.description: English below   Polski na dole  Esta mujer sin mascarilla es mi madre, Halina. Es enfermera en el Hospital Biziela en Bydgoszcz, Polonia. Tiene 62 a‚àö¬±os y apenas le queda un mes para jubilarse. Deber‚àö‚â†a estar en cuarentena como todos nosotros, pero no se quiere quedar en casa porque ayudar a los dem‚àö¬∞s es su vocaci‚àö‚â•n. Siempre lo ha hecho durante toda su vida y no solamente con los pacientes del hospital.¬¨‚Ä† Ahora es ella quien necesita tu ayuda. Y es que en Polonia no hay recursos en los hospitales, ni siquiera mascarillas para las enfermeras. Y mi madre, debido a su edad, se encuentra en el grupo de alto riesgo.  ¬¨√∏Nos ayudas con tu granito de arena para que ella pueda seguir ayudando? Todo el dinero se destinar‚àö¬∞ a la compra de mascarillas y material de protecci‚àö‚â•n para ella y sus compa‚àö¬±eras de batalla. Much‚àö‚â†simas gracias!¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† This woman without a mask is my mother, Halina. She is a nurse at Biziela¬¨¬•s Hospital in Bydgoszcz, Poland. She is 62 years old and has one month of work left to retire. She should do quarantine like all of us, but she doesn't want to stay home because helping others is her vocation. She has always done this throughout her whole life and not just with hospital patients. Now is her who needs your help. There are no resources in hospitals in Poland, not even masks for nurses. And my mother, due to her age, belongs to the at-risk groups. Will you contribute with your grain of salt so that she can continue helping others? All the money will go towards the purchase of masks and protection material for herself and her companions in this coronavirus fight.  Thank you so much!  Ta kobieta bez maski to moja mama, Halina. Jest piel∆í√¥gniark∆í√ñ w szpitalu im. J. Biziela w Bydgoszczy. Ma 62 lata i zosta‚âà√á jej miesi∆í√ñc pracy do przej‚âà√µcia na emerytur∆í√¥. Powinna jak ka‚âà¬∫dy z nas odbywa∆í√° kwarantann∆í√¥, ale nie chce zosta∆í√° w domu, poniewa‚âà¬∫ pomaganie innym jest jej powo‚âà√áaniem. Przez ca‚âà√áe ‚âà¬∫ycie pomaga‚âà√áa, nie tylko pacjentom szpitalnym. Teraz to ona potrzebuje Twojej pomocy. W szpitalach polskich nie ma ‚âà√µrodk‚àö‚â•w ochronnych, nawet masek dla piel∆í√¥gniarek. A moja mama ze wzgl∆í√¥du na sw‚àö‚â•j wiek nale‚âà¬∫y do grupy wysokiego ryzyka. Pomo‚âà¬∫esz nam, by mog‚âà√áa dalej pomaga∆í√° innym?  Wszystkie pieni∆í√ñdze zostan∆í√ñ przeznaczone na zakup masek i materia‚âà√á‚àö‚â•w ochronnych dla niej i jej towarzyszek w bitwie z wirusem. Z g‚àö‚â•ry bardzo dzi∆í√¥kujemy!

campaigns.title: Do It For Liam
campaigns.description: Liam‚Äö√Ñ√¥s journey started on September 9, 2019. The day my world got a lot brighter and joyful To be a parent. Liam is 7 months old. About two months ago he was diagnosed with Guillain-Barr‚àö¬© syndrome if you don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t know what that is, it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s is a serious health problem that occurs when the body's defense (immune) system mistakenly attacks part of the peripheral nervous system. This leads to nerve inflammation that causes muscle weakness or paralysis and other symptoms. That day I cried my eyes out and my whole world turned upside down. But when I looked at Liam he had the greatest joy and giggled when I said peek a boo, your my little sunshine. It breaks my heart knowing that one day my baby boy could die. But he is stronger than anything in the whole wide world and he has a heartOf gold. For the past two months I have been going to specialists and surgeons and doctors appoints to get some info on how it gets better and about twoDays ago Dr. Leung contacted me and said there is an experimental treatment but because he is so young it will cost a lot of money and me and my wife Lauren can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t handle the cost. The surgery is Spinal tap (lumbar puncture). A small amount of fluid is withdrawn from the spinal canal in your lower back. The fluid is tested for a type of change that commonly occurs in people who have Guillain-Barr‚àö¬© syndrome. That alone cost us $18,000. But that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s not the problem the treatment is Immunoglobulin therapy. Immunoglobulin containing healthy antibodies from blood donors is given through a vein (intravenously). High doses of immunoglobulin can block the damaging antibodies that may contribute to Guillain-Barr‚àö¬© syndrome. And cause it to dissipate to the point where he is clean and healthy and it cost us around $73,450. This treatment could allow me to be able to teach my son Liam how to play baseball ‚Äö√∂√¶√î‚àè√® and I would truly love that just as much as he would love to go to the park and enjoy life. PLEASE HELP US MAKE PUT BABY BOY BE ABLE TO CRAWL, WALK, And be free.

campaigns.title: Help LLP Expand the SHOP & Survive COVID-19
campaigns.description: Welcome!  For those of you who may not be aware, I quit my full-time job after quite a traumatic and emotionally abusive school year. I was completely shattered and disillusioned by the systems in place that often times push out educators such as myself. The educators who hold radical visions for our future and utilize art to reimagine our reality. Although it was a battle lost, I have decided to continue fighting to win the war. I will invest my gifts and my energy in sustaining a business that is accountable, grounded in truth, is constantly shifting towards best practices, and is invested in decolonization and the cyclical force of community.     Call to Action: ¬¨‚Ä† Please donate anything you can to support my business¬¨‚Ä† LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY (LLP) by  MAR 31TH. Just before National Poetry Month!        2020 Fundraising Goals:     The goal for LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY (LLP) is expansion and abundance. We are working to construct a stronger and sustainable foundation for the growth of LLP.    Become an LLC      LLP will construct a sustainable foundation for LLP by becoming an LLC. February 1, will mark LLP‚Äö√Ñ√¥s 3rd year in existence fulfilling its mission to expose the world to the medicinal elements of poetry and to fortify the accessibility of poetry workshops that urge individuals to be in constant dialogue with their life's purpose.¬¨‚Ä†     Expand the SHOP       We would like to expand the SHOP with new apparel exhibiting lines of poetry that further spread the mission of LLP.¬¨‚Ä† Our apparel has successfully blessed individuals that come in reach with the radiating sun logo with love and light throughout the U.S and internationally.      Strides in 2019:         ¬¨‚Ä†*¬¨‚Ä† The video above is a peak into the Open Mic portion of a workshop *    - In 2019, LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY (LLP) serviced approximately 80 individuals in 9 workshops. LLP has hired two young women of color to intern experiencing first hand the functions of a business and have access to social/emotional development through our poetry workshops.   - Our apparel has successfully expanding beyond the 50 states and have been worn in Ghana, the Dominican Republic, Barbados, and Indonesia.   - Furthermore, we have been blessed to have run LLP with the support of our intimate communities and partnerships with organizations such as the People‚Äö√Ñ√¥s Forum, May Day Space, The Audre Lorde Project, Children‚Äö√Ñ√¥s Art Carnival, Survival Arts and more.¬¨‚Ä†         Closing Message:     Every morning I arise and see the quote on my wall ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Everything seems impossible until it is done,‚Äö√Ñ√π by Nelson Mandela. campaigns.title: COVID-19 - SOSTENIAMO CHI STA CON I PIU DEBOLI
campaigns.description: EMERGENZA COVID -19 SALVAGUARDIAMO LE RESIDENZE PER ANZIANI E DISABILI   Siamo una  cooperativa sociale ONLUS  che gestisce oltre 100 servizi socio sanitari e assistenziali in 10 regioni italiane.   Ci occupiamo di anziani, disabili, malati terminali¬¨‚Ä† fornendo servizi assistenziali, sanitari (medici e infermieristici) sia residenziali, sia domiciliari. Le persone che assistiamo rientrano nelle fasce pi‚àöœÄ deboli della societ‚àö‚Ä† e¬¨‚Ä† sono quelle pi‚àöœÄ a rischio in caso di contagio COVID-19.¬¨‚Ä†  Stiamo cercando di evitare di far entrare il COVID nelle nostre strutture in cui, altrimenti, la mortalit‚àö‚Ä† sarebbe altissima. Purtroppo non ‚àö¬Æ sempre possibile.¬¨‚Ä†  Nella foto di presentazione ci sono alcuni nostri operatori mentre sono in attesa di essere tutti sottoposti a tampone in uno dei nostri servizi pi‚àöœÄ in difficolt‚àö‚Ä†‚Äö√Ñ¬∂  ""anche in questi giorni troviamo la forza di sorridere""¬¨‚Ä†  ci hanno detto inviandoci la foto ed ‚àö¬Æ ci‚àö‚â§ che ci chiedono i nostri ospiti a volte con lo sguardo quando non hanno altri mezzi di comunicazione.   CI‚àö√≠ CHE ‚àö√† URGENTE  I nostri operatori sono  allo stremo , alcuni sono stati fermati,  non abbiamo quasi pi‚àöœÄ mascherine e altri DPI  fondamentali in caso di positivit‚àö‚Ä†, non solo per questione di costi ma perch‚àö¬© introvabili. Stiamo facendo ordini ovunque ma non arrivano.  Necessitiamo di  40.000 mascherine  a settimana il cui costo medio ‚àö¬Æ di 0,8‚Äö√á¬® a fronte di costi medi che in tempi normali si aggiravano su 0,08‚Äö√á¬® per ogni mascherina.   Stiamo sostenendo costi altissimi:  ogni mascherina costa oltre 10 volte il costo normale, gli spostamenti di personale da una regione all'altra a sostegno dei colleghi sono onerosi.   Abbiamo bisogno di sostegno economico‚Äö√Ñ√£.    I COSTI  Ogni settimana di emergenza, il costo delle mascherine ‚àö¬Æ di 32.000,00‚Äö√á¬®. Tali costi aumentano progressivamente in quanto a seguito di casi di positivit‚àö‚Ä† non bastano pi‚àöœÄ le mascherine e i DPI standard. Per le prossime  4 settimane  stimiamo una spesa di  200.000,00‚Äö√á¬®  per far lavorare  in sicurezza  i nostri operatori e garantire la massima sicurezza degli ospiti e utenti dei nostri servizi.   ALTRE FORME DI SOSTEGNO  Potete sostenerci anche con una donazione sul nostro conto corrente bancario  (IBAN: IT18K0100510000000000220203 ) indicando ‚Äö√Ñ√∫emergenza coronavirus‚Äö√Ñ√π e i vostri dati ‚Äö√Ñ√∫nome_cognome email o cellulare‚Äö√Ñ√π (per ricevere la certificazione di detraibilit‚àö‚Ä† ‚àö¬Æ necessario inviare la distinta di bonifico con nome, cognome, indirizzo di residenza e Codice fiscale a  comunicazione@elleuno.it ¬¨‚Ä†) a oppure facendoci pervenire  mascherine chirurgiche, mascherine FFP2 e FFP3  presso le nostre sedi disponibili sul  sito elleuno .   ENTRO QUANDO   Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto subito , raccogliamo i fondi fino ad agosto 2020, ma ‚àö¬Æ oggi che ‚àö¬Æ urgente un sostegno economico,  ""dobbiamo garantire la sicurezza economica e dare tutti gli strumenti necessari per la loro incolumit‚àö‚Ä† a chi si sta prendendo cura dei nostri anziani, dei nostri disabili, dei malati terminali, non possiamo fermarci, non ora...""¬¨‚Ä†  ‚àö¬Æ l'appello della presidente della nostra cooperativa che inviamo a tutti voi.

campaigns.description: As we all know, many students and workers are struggling due to the situation with COVID-19. I wanted to do my small part to help. So here‚Äö√Ñ√¥s the deal: if I raise $2,000 by April 5th, I'm going to dye my hair. For every $10 you donate, you get one vote on the new hair color. So there‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll be a little more color in some of those Zoom meetings! Moreover, I will personally match $500 in donations.   My husband and I are each splitting the money that we raise between the communities where we work and other Americans in need.  He is contributing to tipped workers in D.C.  , and I will be giving half of the funds raised to  students in need here in Pittsburgh ¬¨‚Ä†. (For those of you who don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t know, I work for the University of Pittsburgh; Hail to Pitt!) The rest will go to the neediest Americans across the country, via an organization called  GiveDirectly .  Please contribute what you can; and don't forget to indicate in a comment‚Äö√Ñ√Æafter you donate‚Äö√Ñ√Æwhich hair color you are voting for!¬¨‚Ä† (For now, please limit your vote to ONE hair color; under the circumstances, this is going to be an at-home operation and I'm not sure I trust my husband to do ""rainbow""... campaigns.title: Combat COVID-19: Help Pittsburgh Community
campaigns.description: Dear Friends:  COVID-19 has now spread to our doorstep. This virus is very contagious, so we need to maintain social distancing in order to minimize and slow its spread. We, the Chinese Community in Pittsburgh, thanks to Pittsburgh for the support it provided when our sister city Wuhan was battling COVID-19. Now, we would like to raise money to purchase much-needed protective products for the local community, especially the ones who must continue going to work at this critical time. Let's work together to help our community. We are in this together!   Pittsburgh Chinese Culture Center

campaigns.title: Fight Against The Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Jaime and I have lived in Hong Kong for 15 years and the experiences this city provides, shapes us into the people we are today. Its given us the opportunity to build great personal and professional relationships.¬¨‚Ä† It is our home and the people of Hong Kong are our community.¬¨‚Ä†  The coronavirus has spread to HK and the exact course it will take is unknown. Currently, the focus of many HK citizens is prevention and the ability to take care of themselves and their family. There has been a run on basic supplies, lack of supplies and retailers who take advantage by price gauging. Some call this survival instincts, hysteria and others think it's fueled my rumors. Either way, the reality is people gain peace of mind when they have reserves of necessities and others simply do not have the means to procure them.  My family and I were able to leave HK before the virus spread and receive daily requests to send supplies from the US back. Many of the requests come from work colleagues, other factory owners and my own China workers/team.  The main requests are:  Face Masks - basic surgical and N95¬¨‚Ä† Hand Sanitizer Antibacterial Wipes - for hands and home Lysol Disinfectant Spray¬¨‚Ä† Toilet Paper¬¨‚Ä†  We purchased a lot of supplies ourselves but ask our friends and community to help in our ability to do more. We hope through fund raising we can purchase larger quantities and more frequently ship items back by Fedex (USPS suspended shipping to HK/China).  None of the items purchased through fund raising will be put to personal use. We will disseminate the products to the families of our factory workers , local cleaners, the elderly (drop off at local elderly homes and centers) and charities who help those with limited financial means.  We truly appreciate all the support, concern and love.

campaigns.title: Helping New York City During COVID-19
campaigns.description: As we all take the necessary precautions due to the moment we are in with COVID-19 (coronavirus) impacting people around the world, many of our neighbors are in difficult positions.¬¨‚Ä†   Over the past few years, I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve asked the public to help me raise funds for efforts such as combating breast cancer, supporting children in Chicago, and bringing children joy by taking them to see Captain Marvel and Black Panther for free. Together, we have raised over a $1 million dollars for our neighbors.¬¨‚Ä†   This time I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m asking you to join me in supporting those around us in a dire moment for so many.   With the economic impacts of COVID-19 hitting New York City, the Food Bank for NYC anticipates ‚Äö√Ñ√∫an extreme rise in demand for food in the coming weeks.‚Äö√Ñ√π ( https://www.instagram.com/p/B9pj7bFB0ZN/ )   Why? Cancellations of large events, fewer people at restaurants, and school closings means that wage workers who live on hourly pay + tips are going to be having a harder time than usual making ends meet. It also means that some adults and children who rely on meals from these places may struggle with hunger. We need to make sure that the non-profits who serve our communities have the resources both to keep their volunteers and staff healthy and to provide food to meet rising demand.¬¨‚Ä†   Every $1 donation to the Food Bank For NYC provides 5 meals to those at risk.   We may need to socially distance ourselves to flatten the curve of infection, but we also need to reach out and support our neighbors any way we can. Luckily the internet makes that pretty easy. Donate now. Support your own local food bank. Check on your friends and family.   We are family, and family looks out for one another.   Thank you,  Frederick Joseph (@FredTJoseph)

campaigns.title: Paunchy Cats needs your help - CORONA KRISE
campaigns.description: Hallo zusammen, die Corona Krise trifft uns und unsere Branche mit voller Wucht. Ohne Gnade.    Wir m‚àö¬∫ssen das Paunchy Cats nun erstmals in 16 Jahren komplett schlie‚àö√ºen, ohne zu wissen wann es weiter geht.  Das Einkommen des Clubs liegt jetzt bei Null, die monatlichen Belastungen sind enorm: Versicherungen (Brandschutz, Krankenversicherung f‚àö¬∫r Festangestellte, Einbruch, Hausrat, Rechtsschutz, Unfallversicherung...), KSK, Gema, monatliche Kredit-Tilgung f‚àö¬∫r Umbau und Kauf, Strom, Heizung, Wasser, Steuer.... fast all diese Kosten kommen nochmals auf uns privat zu.   Dazu kommen viele vorfinanzierte Konzerte mit Gagen und Fl‚àö¬∫gen, bei denen wir im Moment nicht wissen wann sie stattfinden werden.¬¨‚Ä†  Ohne Hilfe werden wir diese Kosten nicht lange alleine stemmen k‚àö‚àÇnnen. Das wir jemals, mit einem gut laufenden Laden vor solch einem Problem stehen w‚àö¬∫rden, h‚àö¬ßtten wir nicht gedacht. Wir wissen nat‚àö¬∫rlich, dass es vielen von euch nicht anders geht und ich bitte auch nur ungern um Unterst‚àö¬∫tzung. ‚àö√∫ber jeden einzelnen Euro sind wir euch dankbar. Wer nichts geben kann macht sich bitte keine Vorw‚àö¬∫rfe. (Gerne k‚àö‚àÇnnt ihr auch Tickets oder Merch kaufen)   Als Dankesch‚àö‚àÇn werden wir f‚àö¬∫r alle Unterst‚àö¬∫tzer, wenn es weiter geht, eine besondere Party organisieren. Wir ‚àö¬∫berlegen uns was.   PS: Wir hoffen jetzt stark, dass sich unsere Regierung etwas einfallen l‚àö¬ßsst und erkennt, dass sie der Gastronomie jetzt massiv helfen muss. Es sterben so schon genug Clubs ohne Corona.    #supporttheunderground  Wie Spenden verwendet werden: - Laufende Kosten des Clubs: Versicherungen (Brandschutz, Krankenversicherung f‚àö¬∫r Festangestellte, Einbruch, Hausrat, Rechtsschutz, Unfallversicherung...), KSK, Gema, monatliche Kredit Tilgung f‚àö¬∫r Umbau und Kauf, Strom, Heizung, Wasser....   Vielen Dank f‚àö¬∫r eure Unterst‚àö¬∫tzung.  3 Sebastian   Team

campaigns.title: Safer Public Area (Fight Against Coronavirus)
campaigns.description: Due to the current Coronavirus outbreak or pandemic, it is better to provide prevention of sick people exposing themselves to the general public.  A friend of mine had told me about a thermal imaging device that captures pictures of that person and gantry control with A.I. which was invented by a Chinese company during this crisis. They are working around the clock to provide to the Chinese government and companies.  It can detect heat signatures over 37 degrees and gives a warning. It can also be incorporated into gantry and autogate systems. Putting up these devices at the entrance of shopping malls, supermarkets, churches can help to detect those people with fever (common symptoms of Coronavirus, SARS, MERS, etc.). Then a security officer can advise the sick to go home and rest.  Places and areas like (trains, buses, restaurants, malls, cinemas, stadiums, etc.) are common spread of viruses to the mass public. So prevention is always better than cure.  Currently, these devices are only in the Chinese language and I have requested them to do an English version. They are too busy to just produce an English unit and send it as a sample. They will provide an update tool (APP) so that I can do changes myself if I make a purchase. The cost of one unit is AUD$4000. So I hoping that through gofundme, I can get these funds to do my first purchase then make the language update and then send out this sample to respective businesses and government agencies for them to test and get them to start helping the general public with better detection.

campaigns.title: b*more blooms Corona relief
campaigns.description: Hey y‚Äö√Ñ√¥all...If you don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t know me, I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m a floral designer   single mom. I have my own very small (it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s just me) business   because of all the necessary precautions due to the coronavirus, my business is on hold. So¬¨‚Ä† I'm humbly asking for your help. Please consider a donation of any size to my GoFundMe. If I raise $500, GoFundMe‚Äö√Ñ√¥s #SmallBusinessRelief Initiative   Fund (see below) will give me a matching $500 grant. The grants are first come, first served until the Fund is depleted, so I‚Äö√Ñ√¥m beyond grateful for whatever you can donate now. Your support means the world to me.   xo, deb    The Small Business Relief Initiative was started by GoFundMe to help small businesses that have been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic and empower their communities to rally behind them. GoFundMe has partnered with Yelp and Intuit QuickBooks to provide small business owners with the financial support and resources needed to continue running their businesses during and after the coronavirus crisis. The Small Business Relief Fund will be issuing $500 matching grants to qualifying businesses that raise at least $500 on GoFundMe. Grants will be disbursed only to the fundraisers of qualified businesses, on a first come basis. When the Fund is depleted, then grants will stop.

campaigns.title: Comedians Corona Emergency Response
campaigns.description: We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve put $1k into a fundraiser for comedians to use in helping mitigate the effects of the coronavirus disaster on comedians and their communities. We hope that our willingness to ""put our money where our mouth is"" will motivate some of you to pull together to protect the most vulnerable members of our communities (comedy and our neighborhoods) during the emergency we are dealing with.  Many comedians already live on shoestring budgets. As the crisis deepens, things are going to get worse. Comics are especially vulnerable because we are not considered legal employees, which means we aren‚Äö√Ñ√¥t eligible for the unemployment benefits and sick pay that the government is extending to deal with the pandemic.  We want to use this fund to incentivize comedians to serve the most vulnerable members of our communities, while also giving them some financial relief during the crisis. If we can build this into a large movement, we can grow our donor base to provide more assistance to struggling comedians as things get worse. And we can also build a platform to start making demands like UBI and universal food stamps to help the most vulnerable among us survive.  All of the disbursements will be decided case-by-case based on the criteria listed below. If you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re doing work that helps people survive who are most vulnerable to coronavirus, we‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll pay you. As we grow, we will be able to provide more to comedians. It‚Äö√Ñ√¥s essentially an honor system, but we do expect people to post on social media about how they‚Äö√Ñ√¥re helping the cause. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re dealing with an emergency and we need to act fast; we don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t have time for bureaucracy. You tell us how much to give you, and what for (based on criteria below), and we pay you from the fund via PayPal (or something else if necessary).  Look, the rule is what Jessica Jones said to Jesse Pinkman - DBAA: Don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t Be An Asshole.   Here‚Äö√Ñ√¥s an overview of what the fund will be used for (details further down):   - Paying comedians $25/week to do deliveries from stores that don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t offer delivery (dollar stores and convenience stores) for people who shop in those stores who are especially vulnerable to fatality from the virus: people who are sick, disabled, elderly (60+ y/o), immunocompromised, and have other health conditions. This includes online SNAP orders from WalMart.  - Paying comedians $25/week to do deliveries to those vulnerable groups from food pantries such as Philabundance and Food Not Bombs. Also doing grocery/supply runs for senior housing communities.  - Paying comedians to ‚Äö√Ñ√∫bulk‚Äö√Ñ√π shop from dollar/convenience stores for their roommates/friends/neighbors, in order to reduce the overall amount of people who are congregating in stores. $5/person you shop for, with a limit of $25 overall per week. One trip for multiple people, not individual trips for each person.  - Paying comedians to order their groceries/supplies online. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll pay the tip and delivery/ordering service fee, plus $2 per order. Be sure to read details below.  - If you need food/supplies, we will do our best to help you work something out via a food pantry and/or mutual aid network in your area.  - If you have other ideas, let us know.  If you are doing any of these things, it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s important that you share what you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re doing on social media (be safe if you're doing deliveries). That will enable us to get more people involved and build this into a national movement of comedians. Hopefully other people who work in entertainment will take up the cause with us.  Twitter -  https://twitter.com/ComsCoronaER  FB -  https://facebook.com/comedianscoronaresponse     *** Everyone Can Contribute ***   Even if you aren‚Äö√Ñ√¥t doing any of the things listed above, you can still help:  - Talk to people in your network and promote what we‚Äö√Ñ√¥re doing on social media to help make this a larger movement. Share the posts we make from our official social media accounts. People are sitting at home by themselves all day on the internet and feeling isolated. This can make them feel like they‚Äö√Ñ√¥re part of something again, and erase their feelings of helplessness about the situation.  - If you are financially secure, donate what you can. Use your platforms to urge wealthy comics to support our efforts.  - If you must have some kind of in-person financial interaction, pay ahead with a credit card if possible. The virus can survive on cash. Yes, we all understand about tips being paid in cash being better for the worker. But safety and survival are paramount right now.    *** The Future ***   Prepare yourselves to live like this for months or even a year. This will be the most significant event in American history since 9/11, and probably since World War II. Things will not be back to ‚Äö√Ñ√∫normal‚Äö√Ñ√π when it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s over; we will be living in a different world.  The mood will be more somber and serious, which will likely reduce demand for comedy. The overall economy will be in a severe recession.  After 9/11, people were terrorized and docile. The US government responded by expanding the police state with the Patriot Act, and globally starting 2 major imperial wars‚Äö√Ñ¬∂all with little resistance from Americans.  After the last recession in 2008 (and this may ring echoes in your ears): ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Banks got bailed out, we got sold out.‚Äö√Ñ√π History has given us no reason to believe events will play out any differently this time. The chant rang out three years too late last time, in 2011 at Occupy Wall Street. People were finally ready to fight evictions and foreclosures, but most of the damage was already done.  We can write a different story, but we have to organize now. Not just as comedians, but as workers. We need to get past the idea of competing with each other for money and fame, and think about the collective struggle for survival. Whether you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re a 10-year comedy veteran working 4 sets in clubs every weekend, or an open mic‚Äö√Ñ√¥er waiting tables at a small diner, you are both susceptible to the unforgiving nature of the market economy.  Banks and landlords don‚Äö√Ñ√¥t care how many headlining spots you‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve had if you can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t pay your mortgage or rent. They, with the help of the government, will try to do what they did in the wake of the 2008 recession: force the working class to eat the losses. And the government will certainly try to expand the police state.  This time we have to fight back. It starts with working class solidarity. Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s get to work.    *** Performing Deliveries ***   We know $25/week isn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t much for the deliveries, but it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s heroic work. If we do enough of it, we will save lives. The fewer people in the stores, the better. The reasons to not pay more are:  1) We want to spread the money around to as many people who need it as possible to make this a fast-growing movement and  2) We need to minimize the losses from people who will inevitably lie and take the money without needing it or contributing anything.  Everyone should act as though they are already infected, even if they are asymptomatic, and take whatever measures possible to not spread it. If you feel sick at all, stay home. We will try to provide masks, disinfectant spray/wipes, disposable gloves, and sanitizer for deliverers...but these items are hard to come by right now.  Deliveries should be left outside the door to avoid close interaction. Credit Card over the phone would be ideal, but you could also exchange money under the door.  - For dollar/convenience store delivering: You would talk to someone who works in the store (ideally it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s a place you go regularly so they already know you) and explain what you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re doing. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re going to write something up that can be posted on the entrance to stores as a message telling vulnerable people to stay home and order for delivery (you‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll put your phone number). It would say no fee and no tip expected. Some people will offer to tip anyway because that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s how they are. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll figure out the logistics as we go.  We should also inform people that they can use a service like Postmates for dollar/convenience store deliveries, and it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s best for as many people as possible to do that if they can afford to. It would be good to do research and find the most cost-effective service for your particular store.  - For food pantries and senior housing: Show up, tell someone in charge you want to help and make deliveries to vulnerable people who need to be staying home.  - Transportation cost: Ideally you‚Äö√Ñ√¥d do deliveries on foot or bike in your neighborhood, but if you have to drive or take public transportation, let us know the situation and we‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll discuss.    *** Ordering Groceries/Supplies for Delivery ***   We have some info below on Walmart and Instacart, but please contact us first before you place a delivery order you plan to be reimbursed for. We want to use the most cost-effective options whenever possible, and also learn about other apps/services so we can provide more information to people.  We want everyone to encourage the people they know to get their groceries delivered, and to pay for the added cost themselves if they can. If you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re someone who can afford to pay the added cost for yourself and others who find it cost-prohibitive, then go ahead and pay for them. If you can pay for yourself, but not others, then we will pay for their fees/tip, plus $2. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll take these on a case-by-case basis in terms of how many people (who aren‚Äö√Ñ√¥t comedians that we know) we‚Äö√Ñ√¥re willing to pay for.  If you do this with roommates/neighbors, try to order collectively and get enough to last everyone at least 2 weeks.  - You should first look to see if you can order everything you need from a store that offers free delivery (over $35) like Walmart. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll still give you $2.  - Instacart Express partners with the most stores. It offers no delivery fee for the first 14 days after signup, and a $1 or $2 service fee. You can have up to 6 addresses on the account at a time; we‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll see how that goes. When you sign up, make sure to leave the notification that emails you 3 days before the trial period ends (14 days) when you will get charged $99. When you get that notification, contact us, and we‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll figure out how to move forward.  Be aware that your order history will be visible to anyone with access to the account, so keep that in mind if you might not feel comfortable with certain people seeing what you‚Äö√Ñ√¥re ordering. Also, it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s probably best to not store your credit card number on a shared account. Even if there‚Äö√Ñ√¥s no malicious intent, someone could accidentally use the wrong one.  ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Standard‚Äö√Ñ√π tip on Instacart is 10%. We recommend 15-20%.  Minimum delivery amount for free delivery is $35, so please order at least that much at a time.  - We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll figure out other services like Postmates and DoorDash as we go.

campaigns.title: Face Shield Fund - Help Vidant Fight COVID-19
campaigns.description: Healthcare workers are on the front lines of the COVID-19 Pandemic, and they are facing a massive shortage of personal protective equipment (PPE).  Our small business,  Simple   Sentimental , typically creates personalized gifts, but we are stepping up and using our resources to create face shields for healthcare workers at  Vidant Medical Center  in Greenville, North Carolina. We are also sending donations to hospitals around the country, please continue reading to learn how you can send our face shields to your local hospital!  The primary hospital we are donating to, Vidant, serves 29 counties in Eastern North Carolina. They are asking for donations of face shields and other PPE to protect nurses, doctors, and other vital healthcare personnel working to take care of COVID-19 patients. Because Vidant serves so many counties, they are also a distributor to other hospitals and medical facilities. Any donations we take to Vidant are sent to the area with the most need.  We estimate our cost of creating a face shield is $8 per shield, so  for every $8 donation we receive, we are making and donating 1 face shield to  Vidant Medical Center.¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†  If you donate more than $100, we can ship the face shields produced by your donation to the hospital of your choosing (must be in the continental United States). ¬¨‚Ä† If you donate $100 or more, we will message you via GoFundMe to see which hospital you would like them to be sent to. Please have their shipping address ready :) All other donations will be sent to Vidant Medical Center in Greenville.  We are able to produce up to 400 face shields per day, and we would love to fulfill Vidant's and Eastern NC's growing need of PPE. Below is a photo of what our face shields look like! We make them in our office in Greenville out of plastic.     I hope you will consider donating to our GoFundMe so we can support the people who are putting their health and even their lives on the line to save others!   Please reach out if you have any questions! We can also be reached on social media:  Instagram ¬¨‚Ä†  Facebook

In the phase of a crsis the need to aid and assist others arises, within me at least, with that being said I am both extending a hand in solidarity and in need. campaigns.title: Moonlight Vulture Cafe Support during COVID-19

Moonlight Vulture ain't too proud to beg :) If you can help us we are SO appreciative of any gift.¬¨‚Ä†   This fund is being setup to assist with restaurant expenses like rent, utilities, etc. as our business declined over 90% the first week that the COVID-19 ¬¨‚Ä†shut down dine in business in Chicago and has not recovered.¬¨‚Ä† The money donated will only be used for direct business expenses.  We have taken this week to regroup, revise our menu, and we expect to be open again with a more limited menu on April 1st for delivery.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  More than anything, we want to continue to be here for the Avondale community and create great casual dining experiences for years to come.¬¨‚Ä†  We've decided not to incur more debt and are hoping we're able to get through the next couple months!¬¨‚Ä† We're lucky to be physically healthy and are so grateful for our community members and families during this awful time.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  Thanks for thinking of us!  Adam   Alan (the workers/owners of Moonlight Vulture)¬¨‚Ä†  #SmallBusinessRelief

campaigns.title: Covid-19 Help Volunteers help Health Care Workers!
campaigns.description: Testing 1000 Health Care Volunteers for antibodies against the virus ASAP.¬¨‚Ä†  Massachusetts needs these Volunteers to assist hospitals as the supply of PPE dwindles.¬¨‚Ä† Healthcare professionals are now becoming infected.¬¨‚Ä† They will need relief, especially as the numbers of coronavirus patients go up.  Previously infected people may be immune to catching the virus again.¬¨‚Ä† Hospitals and researchers are trying to prove this now, and commercial tests for immunity may be available within weeks.¬¨‚Ä† But we need it sooner.¬¨‚Ä† How many tests will be available, and who will be the first to get them?  McNeil Scientific Consulting is rapidly developing this test at their own expense.¬¨‚Ä† With some funding we can test some people.¬¨‚Ä† But if we reach our  gofundme  target, we can provide a large team of Volunteers in time to help our major hospitals before the ""spike"" of patients.¬¨‚Ä† And the system and equipment will be in place to do it again, in any state, at any time.¬¨‚Ä† And it can be duplicated.  Please be generous if you can! Thank you!¬¨‚Ä† - Smart Animal, Inc. (SAI)  This effort is being supported free of charge by individual volunteers, by Smart Animal, Inc., and by McNeil Scientific Consulting, LLC.  ***We expect to conclude this study within a month***   Would you like to Volunteer to make this happen? ¬¨‚Ä† Please review the COVID19 presentation on our website   http://smartanimal.net/  ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†or contact  gmcneil@smartanimal.net,  or call/text me at 774-249-1566.¬¨‚Ä†  We need you NOW!¬¨‚Ä†  Openings and updates are provided below.   Volunteer Positions Needed for Development of the Study (March 30 - April 12).¬¨‚Ä† Some positions can be done from home!   1. Reagents for the assay -  Filled (MSC)  2. Assay Development -  Filled (MSC)  2.5. Assay Qualification - Not required, but highly desired!¬¨‚Ä† We need a lab/hospital/company to support.¬¨‚Ä† Please contact us. 3. Equipment - Sourcing and acquisition, maintenance, testing and setup.¬¨‚Ä† 3 positions. 4. Site Prep - 6 positions staff to setup, 1 position site coordinator, 1 person to acquire the proper licenses and permits, etc.¬¨‚Ä† Marlboro, MA 5. Sample Kits - 1 position for sourcing and acquiring the components of the sample kits.¬¨‚Ä† 2 people to assemble kits using sanitary techniques. 6. Tracking - at least 2 highly talented volunteers who can create and manage spreadsheets and barcode readers.¬¨‚Ä† This is a very technical position. 7. Status ID - 2 people to design and maintain the Volunteer submission file.¬¨‚Ä† 2 people sourcing wristbands for easy identification, this is a challenge and may require multiple vendors. 8. OTHER - Please let us know of a gap that you can fill.¬¨‚Ä† We are moving quickly and your input is important.    Volunteer Positions Needed for Execution of the Study (current target April 13-16).¬¨‚Ä† Some training will be required in advance.   1. Parking lot : Traffic flow, information, cleaning, refreshments (8 positions).¬¨‚Ä† Police/security in addition but separate.¬¨‚Ä† 2. Registration : Data Entry, ID check (5 positions). IT support for Laptops with barcode scanner and WIFI¬¨‚Ä† (1 position) 3. Sampling Stations : Instruct and visually verify self-sample technique.¬¨‚Ä† Training required (8 positions).¬¨‚Ä† Runner to deliver samples (1 position). 4.Sample Inactivation :¬¨‚Ä† Monitor temperature controls, track and document inactivation time by barcode (2 positions).¬¨‚Ä† This is a critical task and will require a full-time supervisor (1 position). 5. Sample Testing : Receive inactivated samples and complete entire assay flow (4 positions).¬¨‚Ä† Includes a Runner and reagent supply tech (1 position). 6. Data Security : Observe collection of data to ensure it is complete and accurate. Probably the same individuals who designed the software (2 positions). 7. Exit Registration : Verification of results and status. Prep wristbands.¬¨‚Ä† Distribute to Volunteers.¬¨‚Ä† Takes place 2-3 days after screening begins. (4 positions) 8.¬¨‚Ä† Host/Hostess : These are heroic volunteers coming in to be tested! Treat them well! Ideas welcome.¬¨‚Ä† (4 positions) 9. OTHER - Please let us know of a gap that you can fill.¬¨‚Ä† We are moving quickly and your input is important.  NOTE - If a position that you are suited for is filled, please let us know.¬¨‚Ä† People assigned may require support, or complete replacement.¬¨‚Ä† The COVID 19 virus does not support this study.  This list will be updated, as this 3 day old endeavor unfolds.¬¨‚Ä† Thank you for reviewing this list, and if you are able to Volunteer, we love you. Even if you can't volunteer and you made it this far, we love you! - updated March 27, 2020

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Recovery Fund
campaigns.description: Never in a million years though I would have to reach out and do something like this. But I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve had a few great people reach out and ask how they could help. So here we are. If you know Jarrod and myself, you know how incredibly hardworking we are. On Monday of this week, we both lost our jobs. Unfortunately, as restaurant hourly/tipped workers, paid leave isn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t an option. We have both taken the steps to apply for unemployment/scholarships, however, that helps for the future. But not right now. Both of our shifts for the month were cut short. And it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s come to the point where we have to talk about what bills to pay to make it through. Crazy. If anyone can help us and has the means to get us through these tough times, anything can help. And a big thank you for everyone who has already reached out to us.  3

campaigns.title: Help Da Silvano de Corona-tijd door! Covid-19
campaigns.description: Da Silvano  is een  Italiaanse  delicatessenwinkel gerund door ZZP‚Äö√Ñ√πer Silvan Claassens te Middelburg.  Mijn motto en uitgangspunt is altijd geweest‚Äö√Ñ¬∂..  ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Proef het ware Itali‚àö¬¥‚Äö√Ñ√π  Altijd heb ik willen werken met kleine locale bedrijven in Itali‚àö¬¥, zodat het ware Itali‚àö¬¥ geproefd kan worden. Ik wil kost wat kost deze producten behouden en kunnen blijven afnemen, zodat de getroffen bedrijven daar, waar ik de mooiste producten van afneem‚Äö√Ñ¬∂.. ook kunnen blijven bestaan!   Ik heb alles op alles gezet om mijn concept aan te passen voor de online menu‚Äö√Ñ√¥s en verkoop, echter dit levert met de winkelverkoop samen nog maar 10% op van de normale verkoop. Kantoren die altijd hun lunch verzorgd wilden zien, hoor ik al sinds begin februari niet meer.  Alle catering is van de ene op de andere dag gestopt. Ik kreeg een regen van annuleringen terwijl wel de kosten al gemaakt waren! Dit alles na de uitbraak in Itali‚àö¬¥ van dit virus!   Mensen blijven thuis, heel begrijpelijk in deze onzekere tijd.. Deze crisis heeft hierdoor een grote impact op mijn bedrijf. Ik zou er graag nog willen zijn met mijn winkel als deze crisis achter de rug is. Maar‚Äö√Ñ¬∂. ook voor mij is het moeilijk, ik behoor helaas ook tot de risicogroep!  Mijn Italiaanse delicatessenwinkel ben ik met veel enthousiasme gestart, maar helaas eind 2018 ben ik geconfronteerd met zware hartproblemen (2 hartinfarcten en stilstanden). Dit heb ik overleefd en ben vol goede moed weer gestart! Alles is weer op de rit en nu overvalt ons allen deze vreselijke Corona-crisis!  Zolang het mogelijk is probeer ik de winkel draaiende te houden. Ik zie echter geen mogelijkheid meer dit vol te houden tot‚Äö√Ñ¬∂. wanneer‚Äö√Ñ¬∂.??? De Italiaanse leveranciers leveren al sinds begin februari geen of weinig producten, zodat ik al niet meer kan voldoen aan sommige vragen van de klanten. De huur en rekeningen lopen echter door en ik zou echt niet weten hoe ik dit verder kan oplossen met deze sterk verminderde omzet. Ik sta nu met mijn rug tegen de muur.  Ik zou het zeer waarderen als jullie mij willen helpen deze tijd te overbruggen. Ik leg al mijn schroom neer en vraag u om een vrijwillige donatie om straks als alles achter de rug is door te kunnen gaan zoals vanouds. Als blijk van waardering voor uw donatie krijgt u van mij als ik na de Lockdown weer gewoon kan doorgaan: bij een donatie van ‚Äö√á¬® 6 tot ‚Äö√á¬® 15 - Een heerlijke Italiaanse zoetigheid bij een donatie van ‚Äö√á¬® 15 tot ‚Äö√á¬® 50 - Een panini naar keuze bij een donatie van ‚Äö√á¬® 50 of hoger - Een traiteurmenu voor 2 personen  Bij voorbaat hartelijk dank!   U kunt altijd nog per mail¬¨‚Ä† of telefoon 06 20900900 bestellen bij mij. Indien voorradig wil ik het graag voor u klaar maken en kunt u het op afspraak afhalen / of ik bezorg het aan huis. Ik zal jullie op alle social media op de hoogte houden hoe alles verder zal lopen en zal gaan.   Een goede gezondheid is de grootste rijkdom, dit wens ik jullie allemaal.  Groetjes,  Silvan Claassens Geerepassage 1 4331 MK Middelburg  06 20900900

campaigns.title: Help Support The Roost Staff during Covid 19
campaigns.description: The Roost Cafe   Bar, like the rest of the world, has taken a pause from our business normality to do our part to help flatten the curve of the Covid19 pandemic. ¬¨‚Ä† Our dedicated team has made a conscious effort to participate in the recommended health precautions to keep themselves as well as our local community safe. ¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† With that our humble establishment is running on thin air with limited hours and staff while still trying to serve a hot cup of coffee and a smile to our fellow neighbors daily. ¬¨‚Ä†   Our wonderful staff have been so loyal in severing our local East Village and Hoboken communities over last 5+ years and are now in need of receiving a little support in return. ¬¨‚Ä† Our hourly paid bar and cafe staff live off the generosity and gratuity of The Roost customer base. ¬¨‚Ä†With the current business regulations in place and ""stay at home"" orders - our staff are completely out of work and will be out of money too soon.¬¨‚Ä†  Help us give back to our Roost staff members with a little gratitude. ¬¨‚Ä†Please donate a tip to our loving staff and lets help them fight through this time so they can continue to do what they do best. ¬¨‚Ä†  All donations will be equally split among the entire Roost Staff to help them pay their rent, buy groceries or needed supplies during this difficult time. ¬¨‚Ä†  Thank you for all your support. ¬¨‚Ä†   Sincerely  The Roost   www.theroostnyc.com ¬¨‚Ä†  Email:  Holler@theroostnyc.com   Follow: @theroostnyc ¬¨‚Ä† or ¬¨‚Ä† @theroostoutpost

campaigns.title: Community Support During COVID-19 Outbreak!

For these reasons, it is critical that we in the Farmington Valley community lend a hand (or many) to our friends and neighbors in need, but many of our volunteers cannot afford to give rides or distribute food from money out of their own pockets. With your kind donations, we will be able to fulfill the material needs of our community without putting major strain on our volunteers, most, if not all, of whom are high school and college students.¬¨‚Ä†  If you cannot donate, feel free to reach out and volunteer! You can contact our head organizer on Instagram @nellsrnth, on Twitter @spacegobstopper, or via email at  solidaritysuburbia@gmail.com   You can also fill out the following survey to request a service:   https://forms.gle/qjwNnbgDenap7tARA  ¬¨‚Ä†  Thank you so much for visiting, and we hope you can support us!

campaigns.title: Holliston Mask Drive For Covid19 Frontline Workers
campaigns.description: Hello neighbors! It all started when my sister-in-law from Wisconsin posted a picture of herself with a box on N95 masks on the family photo stream. She is an Amazon seller and have been running her successful business for many years now.¬¨‚Ä† I laughed and told her, ""You guys are crazy! Where did you get all those masks?!"" She said she found a supplier and planned on sending me some. I was not sure if I really needed them but I figured why not, right?! Better safe than sorry!   That same day a post from a nurse at Newton-Wellesley Hospital asked the Holliston community for help in donating masks. I thought about my sister-in-law and texted her. ""Can I buy some from the supplier?"" I asked. ""Nurses and doctors at the front line here are pleading the public to donate masks and I liked to order and donate."" She said no need. She will donate what she has and she immediately overnighted me 500 masks at a shipping costs of $120 - crazy! I told her I would pay the shipping and it arrived at my front door the next day.¬¨‚Ä† By the 3rd day, 500 N95 masks have been divided and donated to nurses and doctors in 9 area hospitals and the Holliston Fire Department.¬¨‚Ä† Thanks to neighbors who offer to come by and picked them up and drop them off!!  Many people have asks since how they can help. I tried to connect hospitals administrator to my sister-in-law but she said no one from the hospitals called but plenty of individual doctors, nurses and their family members wanting to buy masks to protect their love ones called.¬¨‚Ä† I asked the doctors and nurses that came by to pick up the masks why not just call and order and get the supplies ASAP? The answer was always the same - too much bureaucracy and red tape. Any new vendors must fill out paperwork, have them submitted and approved before any orders can be made - I was told. Meanwhile, nurses and doctors work without masks. One drove over an hour from Wincester to pick up 25 masks from me.¬¨‚Ä† I couldn't believe it.  So now I am starting a GoFundMe page to help our nurses, doctors, EMTs and anyone at the frontline trying to keep all of us safe. If you can donate, my sister-in-law will purchase the masks for us to donate to area hospitals. We are still working out the most affordable and efficient method as it is hard to buy just a few masks from suppliers/manufacturers. So I have set a modest $2100 goal to try and see if we can get1000 masks ($2 per masks) delivered by the end of the week.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  Please donate if you can. Thank you.

campaigns.title: Mask For America : Join the Fight Against COVID19
campaigns.description: It is time for all of us to unite together and join the fight against covid19.    MASK FOR AMERICA  Project Highlight:  -  Hospitals in the US are running out of medical supplies  such as face masks, cover gowns, and other personal protective equipment (PPE) due to a nationwide shortage caused by the Coronavirus outbreak.  -  Doctors and nurses who fight against Covid19 at the frontline are desperately need our help!   -  We are asking you to join the fight together  with our medical workers, help them get those PPE they need, to keep them safe, healthy and well-protected.  -  MASK FOR AMERICA is a donation-based program , all your donations are going directly to the sourcing and distribution of masks and other PPE for US hospitals and clinics. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re asking for your help in supporting this cause.  -  We hope to distribute throughout the US as more funds come in.  We are based in Chicago, IL and will start by providing PPE to Chicagoland hospitals and clinics.¬¨‚Ä†  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Our Goal   Commitment    With this project, we are looking to procure as many N95 and surgical masks as we can for donations. Our goal is to protect the health of as many healthcare workers across Illinois and the US as possible. If we are going to stop this virus in its tracks, we will need our brave healthcare professionals in good health.  If we hit our initial goal of $40,000, we will be able to purchase approximately ten thousand each N95 masks and surgical masks from the vetted suppliers and ship them to hospitals treating COVID19 patients.  We are committed to donating the equipment we acquire through this initiative to hospitals and doctors that need them most urgently. We plan to make our first donations to hospitals in Chicago starting with  University of Illinois Hospital. ¬¨‚Ä†  If you or someone you know works for a hospital/clinic that treats COVID19 related patients and is in need of PPE, please have them fill the form below so we can arrange our donations.    https://forms.gle/9KJ8TfQqTqWaiKsw9  ¬¨‚Ä†  Please keep check back in with us as we make progress towards our goal.   Why are we doing this?   When I first moved to the United States, people often asked me how I like it here. I always share my opinion about I love the strong sense of community that US people have. I always wanted to be part of it and show my gratitude to my community by being helpful.  When the coronavirus outbreak first started in China, there was a huge shortage of medical supplies in almost every hospital. As someone who paid close attention to the matter, I quickly contacted my friend Lizaa in China and helped finding medical resources. We spent several weeks trying to source available PPE from overseas to help in China‚Äö√Ñ√¥s fight against the coronavirus, after weeks of effort, Lizaa told me that finally the local supply started to catch up with demand.  Unfortunately, one month later, and now the virus has spread across the whole world.  Over the past few days, I‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve come in touch with several people in healthcare that indicated urgent need for personal protective equipment.  I first saw my neighbor who is an ICU nurse posting on NextDoor to urge people to please stay home. She emphasized that we desperately need to slow things down, because hospitals are already becoming overwhelmed.  Another friend of ours, a wife and mom, works as an ER nurse and her hospital is running very low on masks and they do not know what to do.  I knew I have to do something to help my community. I keep asking myself besides quarantining myself at home, what else can I do? How can we help? And then it occurred to me that we may be able to find PPE supply from China to bring back to the US. Sure enough, our friend who has helped Chinese hospitals acquire these items locally has introduced us to the suppliers. These masks are produced by FDA-approved suppliers and are willing to sell them at a reasonable price. (This is very important, because many of the available masks for public use are not properly vetted or certified and some of their price is just crazy.) Upon making this connection, we felt it was our responsibility to open this channel, but we can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t do it alone.  I view our situation like a war against coronavirus, and our healthcare providers are fighting at the frontline, day and night. The rest of us need to join them and fight together against the virus. We can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t treat patients, but there are still lots of things we can do to help and to contribute, to get ourselves involved, to tell doctors and nurses, ‚Äö√Ñ√∫you are not alone, we are in this together!‚Äö√Ñ√π¬¨‚Ä† That is why I am starting the project ‚Äö√Ñ√∫Mask For America‚Äö√Ñ√π.  These are tough times for everyone as business has slowed down and, in some cases, stopped altogether. For those of you who are able, we greatly appreciate any contributions you make to this effort.   How Can You Help?   As China ramped up its fight against COVID-19, national mask production also increased tremendously. At this moment, US mask production has not yet caught up with demand. ¬¨‚Ä†We have identified manufacturers in China with surplus of N95 and surgical masks as well as other PPE, but no way to distribute them where they are most needed currently (here in the US). For the cost of a cup of Starbucks coffee, we will be able to protect a medical care provider a whole day. Literally no donation is too small! Thank you all for your contribution!   FAQ    What is the current situation in IL?   Like much of the nation, testing is just ramping up here in Illinois. Already hospitals are expressing concern with shortages of proper PPE such as masks and gloves. As of March 22, there are 1,050 confirmed cases in Illinois including 298 new cases, over nearly 150 more new cases than reported on March 21. We should expect for confirmed cases to continue increasing as testing becomes more widely available. This means the supply of PPE is only going to become more stressed over the coming weeks.  "" Hospitals all over the state ¬¨‚Ä†are in jeopardy of potentially running out of critically needed protective medical supplies,"" IHHSA President A.J. Wilhelmi said. ""With continuing uncertainties about global and U.S. supplies of face masks, we urgently need to find alternative supplies, no matter where they are, so our hospitals can continue to provide life-saving care to current and future COVID-19 patients.""  ‚Äö√Ñ√∫We desperately need to slow things down. The medical system in our region is markedly stressed by seasonal viral infections in real time and area hospitals are already seeing multiple COVID19 cases‚Äö√Ñ√π ‚Äö√Ñ√¨ ICU nurse in Lincoln Square posted on Nextdoor, 17th March 2020   Where are all the masks?   As the healthcare system strains¬¨‚Ä†to accommodate the unprecedented challenge of the coronavirus outbreak, many medical professionals on the front lines do not have adequate protection. Some are reusing masks and gloves. Others have taken to social media with public pleas for help using the hashtag #GetMePPE, an acronym for personal protective equipment. Without proper covering, every new bedside visit might prove fatal, especially for older physicians and their families. And already, dozens of health care workers across the country have fallen ill. Hundreds more have been forced into quarantine.  ‚Äö√Ñ√∫The sky is falling,‚Äö√Ñ√π one doctor wrote in an opinion piece for  The New York Times. ¬¨‚Ä†  ¬¨‚Ä†‚Äö√Ñ√∫We‚Äö√Ñ√¥re heading into the abyss,‚Äö√Ñ√π wrote another.  The short supply of masks in particular is dire.

campaigns.title: Mask Supplies for WUHAN,CORONA VIRUS
campaigns.description: A new coronavirus outbreak ‚Äö√Ñ√Æ a disease similar to SARS ‚Äö√Ñ√Æ is spreading quickly in Wuhan, China and the subsequent need for face masks and other medical grade equipment is quickly rising. Wuhan has been quarantined as health officials and the World Health Organization fear a possible global epidemic.  As such, a scarcity of these medical supplies has struck the area, leading many exposed to this dangerous disease. Death tolls are rising and we must act fast.  I am sending M3 ¬¨‚Ä†N95 1860 and 1870 masks, respirators, Tyvex suits, and other relevant medical equipment to hospitals in Wuhan. We are contacting local hospitals and sending these items to hospitals that have put out public requests for supplies. If any hospital from Wuhan or the surrounding areas would like to receive these items from us, please contact us! All money raised from this campaign will go towards the purchase of these supplies, and we are getting ready to complete our first purchases and will update immediately!  We are also looking to partner with hospitals who may have supplies to donate. If you are connected with any hospital or organization and would like to partner with us, please contact us!¬¨‚Ä† campaigns.title: COVID 19 - PROTEGGIAMO CHI CI PROTEGGE
campaigns.description: ‚Äö√Ñ√∫EMERGENZA COVID 19 - Proteggiamo chi ci protegge; proteggiamo il nostro futuro‚Äö√Ñ√π -¬¨‚Ä†   Associazione Nicopeja Onlus    PRESENTAZIONE   La raccolta di fondi trae ispirazione dalla gestione dell'esperienza post - terremoto in Friuli -Venezia Giulia, quando la nostra Regione scelse di ricostruire prima le fabbriche, poi le case e infine gli edifici pubblici.   Fu una scelta vincente, diventata un modello in tutto il mondo, che consent‚àö¬® al Friuli - Venezia Giulia di ricostruire il tessuto sociale, che sembrava irrimediabilmente distrutto da un evento naturale imprevedibile e catastrofico, partendo dalle fabbriche, dal lavoro e guardando con forza e fiducia al futuro, tutti insieme.   UNITI ABBIAMO SCONFITTO L‚Äö√Ñ√¥ORCOLAT, UNITI SUPEREREMO ANCHE QUESTA SFIDA   Nell‚Äö√Ñ√¥emergenza COVID19 le nostre imprese di allora sono oggi gli ospedali e le strutture sanitarie, che necessitano del massimo sostegno di tutti per fermare la diffusione del COVID 19 e consentire a tutti noi e alle nostre Famiglie di riprendere in mano al pi‚àöœÄ presto le nostre vite, i nostri affetti e il nostro lavoro.   DIAMO PIU‚Äö√Ñ√¥ FORZA OGGI A CHI CI PROTEGGERA‚Äö√Ñ√¥ ANCHE IN FUTURO    OBIETTIVO DELLA RACCOLTA   La raccolta ‚àö¬Æ finalizzata principalmente ad incrementare gli strumenti diagnostici e di ricerca delle strutture sanitarie di alto livello del Friuli - Venezia Giulia.  In questo modo sar‚àö‚Ä† anche possibile definire pi‚àöœÄ rapidamente un profilo di rischio della popolazione che permetta di sviluppare approcci preventivi sia all‚Äö√Ñ√¥attuale coronavirus che ad altri virus emergenti della stessa famiglia, oltre ad aiutare lo sviluppo di terapie efficaci nel medio-lungo termine.  Le donazioni verranno quindi utilizzate:  -¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† per l'acquisto di macchinari e dispositivi (ad es. tamponi), da devolvere alle strutture sanitarie regionali preposte per aumentare la loro capacit‚àö‚Ä† di screening e di diagnosi   -¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† per consentire, in conformit‚àö‚Ä† alle linee-guida regionali, una estensione delle campagne di screening a partire dagli operatori sanitari, dalle residenze sanitarie, dai lavoratori oggi impegnati nei servizi pubblici/privati indispensabili per poi coprire, quanto pi‚àöœÄ possibile, il resto dei lavoratori e della popolazione.   ORGANIZZAZIONE   La campagna di raccolta ‚àö¬Æ stata promossa e sar‚àö‚Ä† organizzata da un Comitato Promotore/Organizzatore, che si avvale del supporto di un Comitato Tecnico-Scientifico per individuare le strutture ed i progetti destinatari dei fondi raccolti.   Comitato promotore/organizzatore:   Adriano Luci (imprenditore)  Gianattilio Usoni (dottore commercialista)  Loris Basso (Pres. Ente Friuli nel Mondo)  Antoniomaria Bardelli (imprenditore)  ¬¨‚Ä†  Comitato tecnico-scientifico:   Fabio Barbone (Prof. di Igiene Generale e Applicata)**  Francesco Curcio (Prof. di Patologia Clinica)*  Gianluca Tell (Prof. di Biologia Molecolare)*  Carlo Ennio Michele Pucillo (Prof. di Patologia Generale)*  Laura Rizzi (Ricercatrice di Econometria)*  Luca Grassetti (Ricercatore di Statistica economica)*  Felice Pietro Fanizza (Ingegnere/Innovation Manager)  ¬¨‚Ä†**: IRCCS BURLO GAROFOLO  *: Universit‚àö‚Ä† degli Studi di Udine   PATROCINIO   L‚Äö√Ñ√¥INIZIATIVA SI AVVALE DEL PATROCINIO DI:  ¬¨‚àë¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† ENTE FRIULI NEL MONDO  ¬¨‚àë¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä† CONFAPI UDINE  -¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† CONFINDUSTRIA UDINE  (altri Enti patrocinanti ed Istituzioni in fase di autorizzazione)  Le donazioni sono raccolte attraverso l'Associazione Nicopeja Onlus, messa a disposizione dalla Famiglia Bardelli.¬¨‚Ä†  NB: La donazione ‚àö¬Æ deducibile e detraibile ai sensi della normativa fiscale vigente. Coloro che intendono beneficiare di tale agevolazione dovranno indicare il proprio nominativo, indirizzo di residenza, codice fiscale ed e-mail nel modulo di donazione. Tutte le donazioni saranno rendicontate e rese pubbliche periodicamente.

campaigns.title: FONDI PERSONALE COVID-19 OSP. ""CARLO POMA""
campaigns.description: EMERGENZA COVID-19In queste ore, presso gli ospedali di tutta Italia, l'emergenza SARS-COVID-19 sta mettendo a rischio migliaia di vite di OSS, medici e infermieri che, quotidianamente, si espongono per garantire sicurezza, cure e attenzioni ai pazienti colpiti (o sospetti) da questa epidemia.All'ospedale Carlo Poma di Mantova, circa 2300 dipendenti stanno lavorando incessantemente, arrivando spesso alle 12-15 ore quotidiane di turno, senza riposi e senza distacco psicologico.Arrivati a casa, sono spesso costretti a prendere telefono e computer e continuare a organizzare la gestione dei reparti, dei turni e del personale dalle loro abitazioni.Famiglie intere vengono private di uno o pi‚àöœÄ membri che lavorano in ambito medico per settimane, vedendoli rientrare poche ore al giorno, stremati o in lacrime.L'emergenza non lascia riposo,¬¨‚Ä†non consente di staccare nemmeno alla fine di quei turni massacranti che sembrano essere infiniti, durante i quali si lavora pesantemente, si fatica e si suda con indosso mascherine e dispositivi di protezione che spesso causano irritazioni, anossia e altre complicazioni.La vita di ognuno di noi ‚àö¬Æ, senza esagerazioni, nelle mani di quelle persone che stanno sacrificando parte della loro per consentirci di continuare una normale esistenza.L'emergenza non guarda in faccia a nessuno, non d‚àö‚Ä† tregua e spesso non lascia scampo.L'impegno ‚àö¬Æ da parte di ogni cittadino, nel rispettare le direttive del Governo evitando di diffondere la malattia.Un piccolo contributo pu‚àö‚â§ fare la differenza in questo momento, che richiede pazienza e coraggio da parte di tutti.Ogni centesimo ricavato verr‚àö‚Ä† donato ai reparti che si stanno occupando dell'epidemia SARS-COVID-19 presso l'ospedale Carlo Poma di Mantova, in modo da garantire un servizio sicuro, efficiente e con esiti sempre migliori.Non ‚àö¬Æ una semplice richiesta di denaro, ma un investimento per la salute di tutti i cittadini, nella speranza che questa tragedia possa trasformarsi solamente in un brutto ricordo.Gli eroi a volte non indossano una maschera, ma una mascherina.

campaigns.title: Aufkl‚àö¬ßrung zu Coronavirus Covid-19
campaigns.description: Das Coronavirus Covid-19¬¨‚Ä† hat viel Aufmerksamkeit in der letzten Zeit erfahren.¬¨‚Ä†      Man wei‚àö√º, dass dieses Virus die Gefahr in sich birgt, zu einer Pandemie zu werden, der Millionen an Menschen zum Opfer fallen.    Doch wie man handeln sollte, muss jeder sich erst m‚àö¬∫hsam selbst zusammen-suchen.    Im Interesse eines jeden ist es, dass er kurz und knapp informiert wird, wie weit das Virus sich verbreitet hat, welche Schutzma‚àö√ºnahmen entsprechend der fortschreitenden Entwicklung er ergreifen sollte und wie er sich am besten verh‚àö¬ßlt, wenn er mit Infizierten in Kontakt kommt oder selbst erkrankt.      Mit dieser Sammlung hier, soll f‚àö¬∫r diesen Zweck von meiner Seite ein Beitrag geleistet werden, um die negativen Folgen f‚àö¬∫r die Menschheit zu minimieren.      Dieses Programm wird dann sukzessive um weitere Gefahrenpotentiale erweitert.¬¨‚Ä†      Damit diese Aufgabe erledigt werden kann, bitte ich um zahlreiche Spenden, f‚àö¬∫r die ich mich dieser Stelle schon jetzt bedanke.¬¨‚Ä†      Bitte schauen Sie in den folgenden Tagen auf diese Seite, da hier noch der Verweis auf die zugeh‚àö‚àÇrige Webseite ver‚àö‚àÇffentlicht wird.      Auch noch einmal am besten Dank f‚àö¬∫r Ihre Unterst‚àö¬∫tzung¬¨‚Ä†      Dirk

campaigns.title: COVID-19 & DawaNet‚Äö√Ñ√¥s HalalServe Food Bank
campaigns.description: What if you Depended on a Food Bank for your Next Meal?    During these difficult times of increased fear and uncertainty surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic, it is easy to worry about ourselves and our families, stockpiling food   essential supplies in preparation for the worst possible, all whilst forgetting the needy, sick and vulnerable in our own neighborhoods.   The unsettling reality is that many in our neighborhoods and communities do actually depend on a Food Bank for their daily meals. At least 1 out of every 8 Canadian Households faces some form of food insecurity, with more than half of these households consisting of single-income, single-person, the elderly and those living with disabilities. And these numbers are only expected to grow due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, making it hard for those already underprivileged to afford essentials like groceries.¬¨‚Ä†   DawaNet‚Äö√Ñ√¥s HalalServe Food Bank is an important community initiative that provides free bi-weekly Food Baskets to needy   persistently poor families in the Mississauga (Ontario, Canada) area, also offering home delivery to those with limited mobility. Typical baskets include an assortment of fresh produce, fruit, rice/ lentils   legumes, pasta, cereals, fresh milk   eggs, Halal meats, snacks and other healthy food items.   DawaNet would like to remind everyone to be patient, stay optimistic, take the necessary precautions to help protect yourselves and your loved ones against all harm, but to also not forget about HalalServe that provides essential food assistance to the most vulnerable in our local communities.    During COVID-19, please help HalalServe ensure:   Our existing clients continue to receive the basic bi-weekly food assistance we provide them, and¬¨‚Ä† Any additional needy individuals and families in the Mississauga area can be provided assistance via our Urgent Food Assistance program.    Remember, charity given sincerely never decreases wealth. Rather, it helps to increase the blessings in our wealth, and helps ward off misfortunes. Read more.¬¨‚Ä†      Notes:  HalalServe Food Bank   CanadaZakat are social welfare initiatives of DawaNet. DawaNet is a federally registered Canadian not-for-profit organization established in 2000. Learn more at www.Halalserve.ca | www.dawanet.ca |  www.Canadazakat.org¬¨‚Ä†   This campaign is eligible for Zakat, Sadaqa and General Donations. If you would like to make an in-kind donation, please contact us  info@dawanet.ca¬¨‚Ä†   Assistance is open for all needy families in the Mississauga area, regardless of their faith/beliefs.  HalalServe is a grassroots initiative that totally depends on community support, donations and volunteers to help sustain it.¬¨‚Ä† More on Rising Food Insecurity in Canada.   If you know someone who requires food assistance, they can submit an application here. www.canadazakat.org/halalserve | www.dawanet.ca | 1-905-514-1444
