campaigns.title: The Lifeboat Project - Corona virus Relief
campaigns.description: The Lifeboat project has been set up by Changing Minds Kent CIC to support those affected by and currently living in isolation due to the effects of the Corona-virus.   Our Story...   Changing Minds Kent currently provides social inclusion and skills development opportunities for individuals living in Thanet from our social hub, ""The Lodge"" based in Westgate-on-sea.  Usually we provide a safe and relaxed environment for individuals to connect with others, improve their overall well-being through our range of activities such as gardening, sports, mindfulness, cookery and much more.   Right now...   We have had to make the hard decision to close the lodge temporarily due to the corona virus pandemic. As much as we did not wish to do this, the health and safety of our friends remains paramount to us and as such we do not wish to risk opening up and going against social distancing recommendations at the moment.  Having said this, we are not willing to sit idly by whilst we have members of our local community who are living in isolation, struggling to get to the shops, connect with other people or even get out for some exercise.¬¨‚Ä†  The lifeboat project has been set up by us to combat this.   Our aims...   We aim to provide mental health support, advice, anxiety management, food and essentials for the local community throughout the Corona virus Pandemic.    *To offer free delivery of care packages for those in isolation within our local community, including food, toiletries   entertainment (Crosswords, card games, coloring books, etc).  *To establish a phone line for those seeking a friendly chat / video chat if possible.  *To set up a¬¨‚Ä†social media hub for individuals to access for tips on combating loneliness whilst in isolation.  *To grow and adapt the project alongside the ever changing situation to provide support for as many affected individuals as we can possibly reach.   What we need...   We have adapted our premises here at the lodge to include a special sanitization station to be used by anyone of the premises and to ensure any deliveries of care packages and provisions are placed in disinfected bags and delivered by volunteers with gloves and other PPE to a safe place chosen by those in isolation who are in need.  We are collecting Food, toiletries and other basic grocery items to create care packages here at the lodge and would like to provide luxury items such as biscuits, board and card games to put in alongside a personalised card from us to let those affected know that we are all thinking of them throughout this difficult time.¬¨‚Ä†  We are also actively seeking a team of volunteers who would be willing to take voice or video calls from those in isolation to simply be a friendly listener and someone to talk to for those who might not have anyone to talk to at the moment due to the crisis.  Unfortunately with panic buying and shortages being rife, this is no easy task, So we need as much help as we can get!   Anything you can give right now would make all the difference to the most vulnerable members of our community. Please, let's pull together and try to help as many people as possible.     Thank you! :)
campaigns.location_city: Westgate-on-Sea, South East England, United Kingdom

campaigns.title: Help medics defend themselves from CoVID-19
campaigns.description: Why are we doing this?  This operation began as a simple conversation among friends and neighbors about what can be done to help slow down the spread of CoVID19 in the US, especially the DFW area. The conversation quickly heated up as we learned that hospitals and medical personnel were running out of personal protective equipment (PPE). Recognizing how devastating this could soon become, the group could no longer sit still. We decided¬¨‚Ä† to do something to help the local and state medical institutions and personnel prepare for the pandemic. We want to unite the community to raise money and PPE for our heroes, the medical professionals fighting against the CoVID19 for all of us.   What will we do?  We understand medical institutions have protocols in vendor specification and logistics. We aim to avoid disrupting existing order and process. There‚Äö√Ñ√¥s also risk and liability involved. However, we decide to move forward to do as much as we can in the following areas based on demand.   Who are our targeting recipients of help?¬¨‚Ä†  Medical professionals, doctors, nurses, caregivers and their family. We‚Äö√Ñ√¥ll focus on DFW metropolitan but may reach out to Texas state wide as we see fit. High risk groups, including elderly and people who have serious underlying medical conditions.   What will be provided?  PPE with FDA approval. In rare cases, recipients may knowingly accept equipment with lower specification due to lack of more qualified ones. This needs to be explicitly disclosed and agreement signed. Community service to help high risk groups shop or do other errands as needed.   What happens if we have some money and resources left?  There is ZERO overhead for this fund. We're reaching to local hospitals to help. We will donate whatever is left to three institutions: Parkland, Children‚Äö√Ñ√¥s Hospital and UTSW after the virus is contained or the steering committee agrees that the mission is accomplished.

campaigns.title: When life gives you Corona, add a lime.
campaigns.description: The pandemic has halted most things in the United States (and much of the world).¬¨‚Ä† Restaurants have closed or are offering only take-out and delivery options, hotels have almost completely stopped, and bars have been closed. As a result, people who rely on hourly wages or those who rely mainly on tips, as well as local-small businesses, are suffering greatly.¬¨‚Ä† Some have seen their daily income basically disappear and others have been laid off completely.  Even though the government is doing all it can with relief efforts and¬¨‚Ä† some businesses are continuing to pay their workers (a portion of) their pay temporarily,¬¨‚Ä† they need immediate relief to pay for food and other basic needs.¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  There are also many elderly that either don't have the means or transportation to get the food/supplies they need and even if they have both, they cannot do so safely.  It is our goal to raise as much money as we can to help as many people as we can during this time of crisis.¬¨‚Ä†¬¨‚Ä†  Your money will go directly to helping the working class, single parents, veterans, elderly people, local-small businesses, and anyone else we can.

I was originally a photographer. In the United States, I have always paid for my family's living expenses and tuition through my photography work and uber. But the arrival of 2019-nCov stopped my photography business income. The work of the uber driver took into account the need to reach passengers in different countries in the airport. campaigns.title: Benefit Concert for COVID-19 Relief  at Bard
campaigns.description: The coronavirus disease started in December 2019. It was first identified in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei province in China. The study so far shows that it originated from another animal and subsequently spread between people. Symptoms may include fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Up to now, there is no vaccine or specific treatment. Patients are treated with symptoms management and supportive therapy.   Up to Feb 21, 2020, over 75,000 people were diagnosed as patients of coronavirus disease. 2236 people died. Since the first week of the outbreak, the medical supplies have been in shortage. None of the hospitals had enough reserves of medical materials. A lot of medical workers and volunteers were almost unprotected.     As young adults, we want to do something for them. Before this benefit concert, we raised around $12,000 and connected with a hospital in Huanggang. The good news is that the supplies we purchased departed on Feb 21 from Chicago to China. And Huanggang Central Hospital will receive them within a few days.¬¨‚Ä†    Please click the link below   for more info of Benefit Concert for Coronavirus Relief at Bard College:   https://www.facebook.com/ziyue.he.9828/posts/101526228115263?__tn__=K-R      Speech from President Leon Botstein at the beginning   With the generous support of Bard College and Bard College Conservatory of Music, we organized a benefit concert within ten days and the result was so inspiring and optimistic that went beyond our expectation. campaigns.title: Corona Virus Home Test Kits
campaigns.description: Due to 25 years of working in the international logistics industry, and working with giant organisations such as Alibaba, Amazon and ASOS, just to name a few ‚Äö√Ñ√≤A‚Äö√Ñ√¥s... I have been approached by our logistics partner in China regarding a brand new product that is being bought to market nationwide in China. ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä†  This product is a home testing kit for the ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† Covid_19 and SARS-CoV-2 viruses.¬¨‚Ä†  The test result is established within 15 minutes and is a simple swan type test. ¬¨‚Ä†Test results are proven 100% accurate in research results on unaffected people and approximately 92%accurate on positively tested people.¬¨‚Ä†  Whilst accreditation‚Äö√Ñ√¥s have been obtained forCE European standards and approval for sale with China, the test shows high accuracy however no absolute guarantee for testing positive above 90/92% for affected patients.¬¨‚Ä†  We have already full ownership of the logistics and procurement platform to purchase, air freight, and customs clear the products upon entrance into any country worldwide, with the UK and USA, Germany, Italy and Spain being also faster and efficient, subject to the correct permissions on those countries on ‚Äö√Ñ√≤lockdown‚Äö√Ñ√¥.¬¨‚Ä†  We have reserved 4000 units of the product, the first we believe to have access to people outside of China. The packaging and freight preparation has been carried out however we seek funding to pay for the ¬¨¬£40,000 cost of shipping and purchasing this initial trial batch.¬¨‚Ä†  Upon positive feedback we can then have a further one million units within 5/6 days manufactured for export.¬¨‚Ä†  Please take our proposal seriously, there is a urgent and very serious nature to this campaign.¬¨‚Ä†  All statements above can be validated as we hold the necessary paperwork to detail the important information referred to.¬¨‚Ä†

campaigns.title: Help Pix see again
campaigns.description: Hello Friends and Family,   The Corona- Velazquez Family has made this GoFund me page to help with medical expenses for Eduardo (Pix) and his family. Many of you might not know but throughout the years Pix has been slowly losing his vision. At first we all thought that his vision was getting worse because of the time and his age, but during the last doctor‚Äö√Ñ√¥s visit in November 2015 we knew something wasn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t right. The Optometrist we saw said that he could have glaucoma and he sent us to see an Ophthalmologist. We found many of them but none in our network of insurance. At one point Pix was ready to give up and just live with the fact that he would be losing his vision little by little. I finally convinced him in getting it checked out. We found an ophthalmologist in town that would take him ASAP. The Ophthalmologist said we would have to pay for the visit in full and not including any extra test , if required.The first thing we thought was ‚Äö√Ñ√∫How are we going to pay this?‚Äö√Ñ√π $300+ just for the visit and plus the extra test.    After a few test, the Ophthalmologist recommended we get Pix an MRI done due to the test results. He has lost complete vision of his right eye and half of his left. At the time I thought, ‚Äö√Ñ√∫How can he live like this?‚Äö√Ñ√π We were scared but determined to get him the help that he needs. Now we had to find a radiology office that was ‚Äö√Ñ√∫in network‚Äö√Ñ√π once again no luck. 1k out of pocket for the MRI. They told us we could see the results during our next doctor's appointment. It wasn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t long before his doctor called us a couple hours saying we needed to come to his office immediately. So many thoughts were rushing through our minds, what could it be? All this time we thought it was Glaucoma and that he just needed a better prescription for his glasses. We were completely blind sided.   We were then told that Pix has a Pituitary Adenoma tumor that is located in the top center of his brain and it is pressing against his optic nerve which is causing him to lose his vision. We were sent to Stanford to meet with a Neurosurgeon, but were later denied because of our insurance. We then were sent to another Neurosurgeon in Monterey. We weren‚Äö√Ñ√¥t seen there because they said it was too large for him to perform the surgery. After being bounced back and forth to different doctors, lost wages due to appointments , paid hundreds of dollars to be seen by them, we were finally sent to UCSF. Rated top 4 in the country. With that title we were sure that a huge price tag came with it. Our insurance was in network, but wasn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t able to pay it all.    Now on June 7, 2016, Pix will finally have his surgery!! The downside to it all is, we have spent a lot of money in just getting to where we are now. We are struggling to pay for his surgery. The surgery will take place in UCSF and will require pre and several post-op visits. Out of pocket costs, which include the amount not covered by insurance as well as travel expenses, will run approximately $10,000. We have hit a roadblock and we need your help. We are glad that the doctors were able to find the tumor before it grew any larger. The tumor is the size of a tomato now and at any given moment it can damage the optic nerve enough that he can go blind and stay like that for the rest of his life. This surgery is very important because Pix has two small children who he wishes to see every single day while they grow up. It would be devastating to not be able to pay for this very important surgery. Any little counts, all will be greatly appreciated!   Thank you from the Corona- Velazquez Family!

campaigns.title: Fight COVID-19: Provide hot meals to those in need
campaigns.description: As COVID-19 continues to affect our lives more and more each day, countless people find it harder to find a job and put food on the table. At the same time, restaurants are taking a huge loss in revenue, especially the ones whose main business is sit-in dining. Luckily, you can help with both issues at the same time! All the money you donate will go to VolunTeens, a 501(c)3 nonprofit based right here in Howard County dedicated to serving those in need. VolunTeens will allocate all the money to buy hot meals from various local restaurants, such as restaurants affected by the Ellicott City floods. We then donate these hot meals to local homeless shelters and support groups, mainly Grassroots. We greatly appreciate all the funds we can get, and we hope to start fundraising as soon as possible to help as many people as we can. To learn more about VolunTeens, visit our  VolunTeens website . Thank you for your support!

campaigns.title: Children, Elderly, Homeless Coronavirus Supplies
campaigns.description: Hi there my name is Anthony and I work for Kaiser Permanente here in Oakland, CA but this project has nothing to do with Kaiser, this is all my doing. I just had my 29th birthday and am truly blessed to be able to even think of this project let alone put it into action and am just praying that others will want to do something positive for our neighbors with me. I have lived in the Bay Area my entire life and have seen my home town change so much over the years, but one thing that I noticed is how hard it is to live here when my neighbors and the people of our communities do not work together and help look out for each other. I am aware that many people here in the Bay Area do not have enough money to buy items to protect themselves from the Coronavirus or enough money to keep their hygiene up and stay as clean as possible to help keep the virus away from their home or homeless community. I believe the least we can do is go to the homeless communities in the East Bay Area, like Oakland, and its surrounding areas and provide hand sanitizer stations and/or small travel bottles for people to take with them, hygiene products like tampons/pads and soap, can also provide clean water bottles and foo/or food, can provide correct and reusable breathing masks, and anything else that is recyclable and needed by people in the affected areas. I understand the city of San Francisco has at least some plan in place to provide some services in San Francisco, but what about the entire East Bay on the other side of the bridge? The people of Oakland and the rest of the East Bay are usually forgotten when it comes to government funding compared to the help that the older richer brother, San Francisco, usually gets in favor over Oakland and its residents. So I want to do something, anything that I can to help the women and children and elderly that are not and cannot get prepared for this epidemic. I hope you will all join me in this journey!

campaigns.title: Caring for the Elderly During COVID-19 Crisis
campaigns.description: The elderly are at the highest risk of fatality if they are exposed to the COVID-19 virus and are being advised to stay home because of it. Despite this, we will still see elderly individuals out on their own looking for water and toilet paper, anything we might have failed to grab in our crazed raids.   I know these are frightening times, but we cannot reduce ourselves to anything sub-human and forget about those who are in need. Many of us have young children or grandparents we are concerned for, but not everyone has someone to care for them.  With your help, I can purchase any items I am able to find that will be of use during this period. I can distribute resources within my area - Stockton, Ca. - for as long as I am healthy. If you can't distribute money, take it upon yourself to distribute resources to those in need.  It saddens me to see elderly or needy individuals roaming the aisles of bare shelves fearing they won't have the necessary items to make it through the week, let alone the entirety of the COVID-19 crisis.   Please prove that humanity has not been lost. It is in moments like these that we should be aiding one another, not turning against each other.

campaigns.description: During this crisis of COVID-19, it's more important than ever that we come together as a community to fight for one another. This challenge has proven itself to be something much bigger than us individually. With public schools closing and our healthcare system nearing its capacity, people with the least will suffer the most from this pandemic.¬¨‚Ä†I hope to encourage you all to lend a helping hand to those who need it most.¬¨‚Ä†  The Coalition for Kindness is rooted in the belief that there's a light at the end of this tunnel if we put humanity first.¬¨‚Ä†  Every dollar donated will provide direct relief to those who need it most. We're selecting grassroots organizations every week to provide money, food, shelter, child care and whatever it is we need to survive this together.¬¨‚Ä†   In our first round of fundraising, we'll be sending donations to The Food Bank for NYC's COVID-19 Response Fund ( https://www.foodbanknyc.org/covid-19/ ) ¬¨‚Ä†to ensure that food is being delivered to soup kitchens and food pantries across New York City.  We'll be posting our donations and contributions directly here, and on my Instagram page,¬¨‚Ä†( https://www.instagram.com/jeremiahbrent/ )¬¨‚Ä†so you know exactly where your money is going.  Now, more than ever, we must make sure that people are seen and heard. Donate $1, $10, or $25 ‚Äö√Ñ√Æ every contribution counts.  Thank you, Jeremiah Brent  Please note: any gifts or donations will¬¨‚Ä†NOT¬¨‚Ä†be tax deductible as charitable contributions.

campaigns.title: Corona virus
campaigns.description: Our communities are being hit by a devistation at no fault of our own, causing our everyday workers to have to struggle just to stay afloat. Families are slowly going under, and there is nothing they can do about it. This is just the beginning of what is going to come. What savings they do have will be depleted in the days to come. Our job as a community should be to all stand together and give a hand to help them up. Nobody is asking to be become rich all they need is a little help to keep their family together. It‚Äö√Ñ√¥s unfortunate it takes circumstances such as this for us to pull together and help one another out, but I pray that we may still make it through this and come out on top. The whole community.. all for one and one for all... nobody left behind. Let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s show the corona virus what strong people we are and take a stand and fight back. We will not be lost and weakened by this! Instead let ¬¨‚Ä†it make us strong and plant seeds of love amounts our needy communities.. it is spring the time for cleaning and planting.. so let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s plant the seeds and watch them grow into something beautiful that hasn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t been seen in a long time.!

campaigns.title: Covid-19 North Texas Relief
campaigns.description: It all started about a week ago, on March 12th. I was watching the news coverage with my wife Darcy. I found myself thinking about how scary it would be for my wife‚Äö√Ñ√¥s grandmother to get out and try to brave the stores with all the masses of people. With this in mind, I started a Facebook group with the notion that I‚Äö√Ñ√¥d get around 10 people together to help deliver groceries to high risk senior citizens as well as immunocompromised individuals. One week later, the page has blown up to over 7,000 members and still growing. We have countless volunteers and a leadership team comprised of community members from all different backgrounds.  In a time that is so uncertain and can feel so dark, we‚Äö√Ñ√¥ve had one mission and one mission only: to spread hope through taking care of high-risk senior and immunocompromised individuals in our community. But the need has become so much bigger and clearer than we thought it would be.   These community members are lonely, they are afraid. They are unable to leave their homes and are running out of basic necessities like food, toilet paper, cleaning supplies, hygiene items and the list goes on. Many of them are unsure of where their next meal is going to come from after the food they have has run out. If each person in this group made a donation, whether it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s a financial contribution or a donation of items, we can all be a catalyst for change right here in our community.  Please consider a financial contribution and be a part of serving those most vulnerable in our community in the midst of this pandemic.    Goodness is out there, you just have to tap into it.

Yet we must continue to do our work, especially in the face of this pandemic, because of how it‚Äö√Ñ√¥s affecting Black and Brown communities and exacerbating our oppression. ¬¨‚Ä†If you can, please consider giving a donation of any size. Every bit helps and helps us organize against this pandemic, including fighting to depopulate the Cook County jail and to provide treatment, testing, and release to the incarcerated population, including torture survivors and the wrongfully convicted. ¬¨‚Ä†Thank you and be safe.

campaigns.title: Baby Medical Fee Emergency in Covid-19 Lockdown
campaigns.description: This is an Urgent Appeal!   Hello, we are Tom, Annie,   Dandan, the Shelton family.  We're in a quarantined town in the Philippines amid the Coronavirus outbreak, and we're about to have a baby!   Annie is due to give birth on the 17th April 2020, just 29 days from the time I write this.  Our town of El Nido has been locked down due to COVID-19. All tourists have been told to leave and none can enter.    The quarantine has caused our fledgling holiday business to collapse.¬¨‚Ä† We now have no income, and no money to pay for the birth of our baby.   We are 6 hours away from the nearest functioning hospital in Puerto Princesa city.  Our scans show a baby boy, and he's going to be called David Antonio, after both of our fathers.  Thankfully, mother, baby, and our young son, all appear to be healthy, but the life of our baby is at stake.   We need money for:   Pre-natal ultrasound   consultation Midwife for birth Doctor for birth Post-natal baby scan Standby money, for medical emergency Two-way transport to hospital in Puerto Princesa city during lockdown¬¨‚Ä†  Rent for basic room near hospital  At least one weeks food (2 adults, 1 child, 1 baby)  Money to cover our rent for one month which will give us a chance to get back on our feet  The infant mortality rate in Philippines is over 5 times higher than in the UK.     Who are we?   Firstly, some background. Some of you may remember news about us in the  UK national press  , on BBC Radio and  TV News ¬¨‚Ä† (5:12am) in 2018, as well as an article I wrote  here ¬¨‚Ä†.¬¨‚Ä†   At the time, the UK‚Äö√Ñ√¥s notorious ‚Äö√Ñ√≤hostile environment‚Äö√Ñ√¥ had forced our temporary separation due to visa controls on non-EU family members, including Annie   Dandan.¬¨‚Ä†   During a devastating few years in the Philippines, we became the targets of a criminal gang, who's crimes against us included theft, kidnap, and two counts of attempted murder.¬¨‚Ä† After a police manhunt, the gang were arrested, and are now serving life-long prison sentences. But, we'd lost everything, our business, belongings, even our home, and any means to provide a stable future for our family.  We were truly broken.  The lowest point was collecting empty bottles in the streets, to return them to the stores for their deposit money, just a few pesos, to buy rice and fish to feed ourselves for another day. It was gut-wrenching, humiliating, and humbling. It broke our hearts.¬¨‚Ä† Our little boy, Dandan, showed tremendous strength of character through this. He was, and remains our inspiration and motivation, our own little superhero. He is very excited about becoming a big brother to baby David.  We determined never again to face such extremes of poverty, and not let this criminal gang destroy us. But now we have the COVID-19 lock-down to contend with, at a crucial moment in our lives!      The Present   Over the past year, with a lot of hard work, we managed to build a new business,  Banana Grove Backpackers Inn ¬¨‚Ä†.  Until the COVID-19 outbreak, it was a tremendous success. If you read our reviews, you can see that we've thrown our hearts and souls into this business, to build a stable future for our family, at long last. But under quarantine, our income has collapsed.  Until recently, our simple little place was full of happy guests .¬¨‚Ä† Our small income was ploughed back into the business in order to grow and provide long-term financial security. Our expected income was enough to pay for the safe delivery of our baby, his birth, care, and the care of Annie during this final month of pregnancy and beyond. Now that security is severely threatened by the lock-down which could last for months.  Our baby will not wait to be born in 'better times'.  We now urgently need to find money to pay for the most basic necessities; a midwife, medical fees, a pre-birth scan, travel expenses to and from the hospital, accommodation to be near the hospital, food, clothing, medical check-ups, rent, money to pay for electricity to run a fridge and a fan, and even money to pay for drinking water.  In short, we need to pay for every essential that our new baby, and our family will need until our business can start to thrive again.¬¨‚Ä† But we have no means to pay for any of it!  We live very frugal, simple lives. We have moved out of our house and into a bamboo hut at Banana Grove to save money.¬¨‚Ä† We don't have the 'luxuries' of modern living, no car, no TV, no air-con, no oven or microwave, no designer clothes, nor even hot water. We are focused on working hard to provide a safe and loving environment for each other, and a brighter future for our children.  This is urgent. Our family is in real trouble. This is for baby David Antonio Shelton, our beautiful unborn child, And so we appeal to your generous heart, your charitable nature, to your human kindness. Please give what you can to help us get through this incredibly difficult time. Please give what you can to give him a start in life. Without your help, and without the essential care that a newborn baby needs, he may not survive.   (Due to platform restrictions, all donations need to be made via my sister in the UK and then transferred to us in the Philippines).  Please give generously, and share this appeal. We will return what we can, when we can.   With the whole of my heart, thank you.‚Äö√Ñ¬Æ  Yours sincerely,‚Äö√Ñ¬Æ  Tom Shelton

campaigns.title: Fight Against Corona Virus
campaigns.description: We have the money... we have the technology... but it will still take 18 months to find the vaccine for corona virus?!?! I am raising an awareness, what awareness? We have the money, and the resources to fight against this. What's the best way to do it? The best way is to get the top 1% involved. They have the capitals, the connections, and the motivations. Corona doesn't discriminate, it doesn't matter if you're white, black, Asian, or rich.   ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† ¬¨‚Ä† 10 millions is nothing to top 1%. But if it gets their attention, then maybe we can shorten the vaccine development time by half, or even a third. Which can save lives. I'll start my donation of $100. Lets save some lives people!!!!

campaigns.title: COVID-19  Fiber Artist lost Art Fairs
campaigns.description: I (Mayumi Fujio) have been a full time fiber artist since 2018 and have been selling my silk art products through Arts and craft fairs and events around the Bay Area such as Asian Art Museum, Craneway Craft fair, art galleries and Makers Market.  So far every Arts and Craft Fairs I had for the next 2 months has been cancelled or postponed, and I am struggling to pay high living expense in San Francisco.¬¨‚Ä† I was supplementing my income with teaching private lesson for tango but that has also shut down.  I am currently designing my website so that I can sell directly and it should open it's door in the next week or so.¬¨‚Ä†   I am making this fundraiser in an effort to apply for a matching grant from ""The Small Business Relief Initiative"" which is supported by GoFundMe, Yelp, and Intuit Quickbooks.  I need to fundraise $500 in order to qualify for their grant for $500.¬¨‚Ä† For those who kindly donate on this fundraiser, you will receive the same amount you donated as a discount coupon to buy my product once my website is up and running.  This is the detail of The Small Business Relief Initiative:  The GoFundMe.org Small Business Relief Fund will provide micro-grants to qualifying small businesses negatively impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. The Small Business Relief Fund is part of the¬¨‚Ä†Small Business Relief Initiative¬¨‚Ä†: a program supported by GoFundMe, Yelp, and Intuit QuickBooks. The Small Business Relief Initiative¬¨‚Ä† will supply financial assistance and support to businesses across the country by providing grants, tools, and resources to help during the crisis.  GoFundMe, Yelp, and Intuit QuickBooks have pledged to donate up to $1.5 million in donations into the GoFundMe.org Small Business Relief Fund. Until that Fund is depleted, GoFundMe.org will continue issuing $500 matching grants to qualifying businesses. Additional companies are expected to contribute to this Fund in the coming weeks, in order to provide much needed aid to even more businesses across the country.  #SmallBusinessRelief  Yours,¬¨‚Ä† Mayumi Fujio

campaigns.title: Corona Virus Closes Schools; Teacher Needs Help
campaigns.description: I started this campaign for a friend who is a teacher in Japan. His name is Paul Melnyk. Due to the Japanese govt's attempt to prevent the rapid outbreak of the Corona virus they have closed all schools for an indefinite time which will certainly lead to financial hardships for Paul during this time. It is my intention to attempt to facilitate financial relief for him through this campaign until the schools reopen.¬¨‚Ä†  I understand that millions are being affected by this current crisis. I am stepping up to help meet the needs of a dear friend who I know is personally affected by the Corona virus outbreak. Many thanks to any who can contribute to this campaign.

Da ich, trotz meines jungen Alters, durch den Verlust einer Niere von einigen Jahren und andere mir hierdurch entstandene chronische Krankheiten zur hohen Risikogruppe geh‚àö‚àÇre, befinde ich mich seit dem 14.03.20 in Quarant‚àö¬ßne zu Hause. Aufgrund dessen hoffe ich von Herzen auf Hilfe/Unterst‚àö¬∫tzung, um wenigstens einen Monat lang erstmal meine dringlichsten Fixkosten (Lebensunterhalt) bezahlen zu k‚àö‚àÇnnen. campaigns.title: Invest in COVID-19 Vaccine not in Toilet Paper
campaigns.description: COVID-19 (as pictured above) has been described by many Epidemiologist and Virologists as the perfect blend of virus characteristics. It spreads effectively through numerous means of transmission during a lengthy incubation period and kills effectively (WHO current death rate prediction 3.4%) which is 340 times more than the flu (which has drug treatment options).  Harvard studies have shown that containment is not likely, and this virus is here to stay. ¬¨‚Ä†Models predict that by the end of the year 40-70% of the world population will become infected and thus killing over 100 million people. ¬¨‚Ä†Remember that this virus does not discriminate or care if you are a Billionaire, President or poor...it affects us all in the same way. ¬¨‚Ä†There is currently no drugs approved to treat COVID-19. ¬¨‚Ä†  Now is the time to step up and to not invest in toilet paper (as you are flushing away money that could actually make a difference). ¬¨‚Ä†Even world governments are not in my opinion spending money the correct way, which is not to focus almost entirely (dumping trillions of dollars) into the world economies to just slow down the inevitability that global markets will be drastically affected by this disease. ¬¨‚Ä†Instead, invest in stopping the disease by creating a vaccine or drugs to treat COVID-19, along with stabilizing the world economy. ¬¨‚Ä†As a Nurse, I will relate this stupidity to only giving blood to a person with a severed carotid artery...what is going to happen by just doing that?...uhh, you are still going to bleed out, it just will take a bit longer. ¬¨‚Ä†The smart thing to do would be not only give blood, but to repair the severed artery so the person stops bleeding.  I can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t help but think about the over $1 Billion dollars that was donated within a day and a half after the Notre-Dame Cathedral‚Äö√Ñ√¥s fire in April of last year, but the world can‚Äö√Ñ√¥t come together and donate to save lives....hundred of millions of lives! ¬¨‚Ä†  This is the time for the world to come together, raise funds for a coordinated effort to create a vaccine and treatment options to combat COVID-19. ¬¨‚Ä†Together the world can achieve this goal in a timely, safe and effective way.  ALL proceeds will be donated to The Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), which was set up to fight emerging epidemics and is currently needing funds to create a vaccine. ¬¨‚Ä†They have invested $23.7 million so far and anything you can spare will help!  Stop thinking about wiping your butt and focus on saving it. ¬¨‚Ä†Donate today!

campaigns.title: Corona Virus supply chain disruption preventive
campaigns.description: Corona virus is all over the world. This research is how to mobilize the Great American industrial machine to provide the needed medical protective gear.¬¨‚Ä† The research goal is to take empty factories add the needed equipment to start making the masks, gloves, suits and other protective gear.¬¨‚Ä† The research plan is also to mobilize autonomous vehicles and drones to provide food, medication and gear to those areas that are hot zones.  I am starting this now as when the virus explodes even more it will be too late.¬¨‚Ä† Containment prevents the supply chain from operating.¬¨‚Ä† My research goal is to keep the supply chain operating even during containment. At minimum food, medicine and protective gear.  This money is to start this research on how to start this operation to assemble the team and start the Great American industrial machine.  Thank you for your help as you may not only be helping your neighbor but yourself and your family.  PS: Any angel donation, business leader and¬¨‚Ä† manufacturing experts who have the financial means, experience, knowledge and connections to bring this to reality, please join this team as time is running short.¬¨‚Ä†   We need action now!!!!!  Dr Tony Sperry Researcher in supply chain disruptions and how to mitigate them.

campaigns.title: Help HOP Academy survive COVID-19
campaigns.description: Wrestling fans of Nottingham may already know about House of Pain Wrestling, a company that puts on family-friendly shows all around the county, featuring some of the top local talent of the area, and entertaining hundreds of fans and families every month. House of Pain Wrestling recently celebrated its 10th Anniversary. What you may not know is that House of Pain Wrestling as it is today would not be possible without the House of Pain Wrestling Academy, a full time facility that currently supports over 100 people to achieve their dreams and train to be professional wrestlers, all from a former church hall in Radford. Everyone is welcome at HOP, from children to adults, the fit and the unfit, anyone with the desire to train in the thing we all love. The House of Pain Academy has never been run for profit. As the academy itself has grown, from once a week training on a Sunday, to the full time facility it is today, so the need for more funding to cover the overheads has grown. When we moved to the new facility, those overheads became higher. We started putting on more regular shows to generate the income to pay for the facility. Currently almost half of the business's income comes from the 5+ shows a month we run around Nottinghamshire. In these uncertain times, it would clearly be unsafe to run our regular monthly shows, which leaves the HOP academy in danger of financial difficulties. Without the HOP academy, there would be no HOP shows, but it would also leave people with no where to train, and would leave trainers and wrestlers out of work. We get no help from any other organisations, we're a very small not-for-profit business, and as such we have no contingency plan for global events such as these. We will be producing a series of ""no fans"" shows, filmed at the Academy by a group of volunteers from the academy, just for you, for the first time ever. If you enjoy our online shows, have enjoyed our shows live in the past, or you just want to help and would like to contribute, please do so, because we really need your help.

campaigns.title: Music for health - #musicdoesntstop
campaigns.description: My name is Martin Schippers, I am a trombonist with the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra in Amsterdam. Normally, you can find us performing for 2000 people about 3 to 4 times a week. However, due to the recent ban on large events in order to curb a further outbreak of the coronavirus, I, like many of you, am left sitting at home.¬¨‚Ä†   GOAL- POST PANDEMIC : Use the funds raised through this campaign to organize global ""thank you"" events and concerts around the world for as many healthcare and public service workers as possible. These concerts will be performed by local freelance artists who have been economically affected by this pandemic.  Being stuck at home bursting with creativity and not being able to create and perform forced us to think of possible ways to combine the current global situation with music, resulting in #musicdoesntstop campaign and this fundraiser.  Through this funding campaign, we musicians want to raise awareness to support the work of our incredible healthcare and public service workers who are at the frontlines of the corona pandemic. At the same time, many freelance artists and musicians are facing performance and project cancellations. Although this is inevitable and an effort for the greater good of society, this means that these artists are sitting at home without any income prospects for an unknown, and most likely, an extended period of time.   #musicdoesntstop  - We encourage all artists, musicians, music lovers and followers around the world to stand up for our fellow musicians, artists, healthcare and public service workers in this difficult and uncertain time. Share your videos playing your favorite music and voice support for the people working at the frontlines of the corona pandemic.¬¨‚Ä†Also, don't forget to mention the issue of freelance musicians and artists who are living through this difficult time, while their source of livelihood is on hold as their work is being canceled.¬¨‚Ä†  As musicians we live to perform for our audiences, giving them a moment to reflect, enjoy, share emotions, and find support in difficult times. Not being able to perform in the traditional concert halls, theaters, stages etc. does NOT mean that the music in us and the urge to share must stops.   Credibility : Depending on the amount we will raise, ¬¨‚Ä†we will collectively decide on¬¨‚Ä† the number and location of the concerts. Everyone who donates will have a vote in the decision making process. We will l foster partnerships with local concert agencies, International NGO's and musician/artists organizations to facilitate these concerts and provide live-streaming where possible. A team of credible experienced professionals from the music, health care industry, and business world will work side by side to develop a comprehensive proposal and¬¨‚Ä† detailed action plan outlining the steps forward to ensure that your donation touches as many people as possible.  Connect the world through music!  Use the hashtag #musicdoesntstop, mention the website and let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s get this cause trending!¬¨‚Ä†  Please go to¬¨‚Ä†www.musicdoesntstop.com¬¨‚Ä†for more info.  Download and share this GoFundMe page.  Donate to this GoFundMe page or find your own local health or nonprofit organization to support.  www.instagram.com/schippers.martin  ¬¨‚Ä†www.musicdoesntstop.com

campaigns.title: Final Arrangements/Teresa Jackson
campaigns.description: Our dear sister Teresa, selfless and dedicated with a heart for others, succumbed on 3/30/17 to a rare form of cancer which affects only 1 in 5 million and is extremely aggressive.¬¨‚Ä† As with so many women who have suffered through the ravages of an abusive relationship, she was robbed of many of life‚Äö√Ñ√¥s pleasures except for those which her 3 children have brought her.¬¨‚Ä† Working through hardships unspeakable for most people, including several occasions of homelessness and as the only source of income for the past 25 years, her indomitable spirit to provide for her family, drove her to continue go to work under grueling physical discomfort up to 5 days before her passing while in hospice care.¬¨‚Ä† Typical of Teresa, the day before her death, continued to beg us to take her to work for she had to make sure that the company payroll was processed.¬¨‚Ä† Not unexpectedly, those who have had the privilege of knowing Teresa have wanted to visit with her and the stream of visitors was purely heartwarming and delighted Teresa with some coming from as far away as Hawaii.¬¨‚Ä† Unfortunately, the veracity of this illness left little time to prepare and plan for final arrangements.¬¨‚Ä† The family has decided that her remains will be returned to her native country the Philippines where the family has arranged for her to, at last rest, beside her mother in Cebu.¬¨‚Ä† Her two sons have stepped up to take charge of her affairs but are facing challenges as all the kids were living at home and as of this week will not have a home.¬¨‚Ä† It is important to note that her sons have inherited her drive and both are working several jobs and going to school.¬¨‚Ä† However, the cost of final arrangements and expenses of the transition exceed their capacity.¬¨‚Ä† It is the desire of the family to get the boys into a shared apt. and set up for a success; additionally, for them to accompany Teresa back to the Philippines on her final journey.¬¨‚Ä† Neither has been to their mothers‚Äö√Ñ√¥ native land.¬¨‚Ä† Anyone who has spent time with Teresa always left feeling uplifted.¬¨‚Ä† Now let‚Äö√Ñ√¥s get together and left up the rest of her family in her behalf!  Our goal is to raise enough money to help with the expenses of caring for her remains and prepare the kids for a life without their mother, best friend and provider.¬¨‚Ä† Additionally, if funds are available we would like to have them personally accompany her to her final resting place in the Philippines where her loving family is ready to receive her.  ¬¨‚Ä†Undray Jewel Jackson II, (Konkie to some), Teresa's oldest son is designated as the custodian of the funds raised in this campaign. ¬¨‚Ä†He has stepped up and is taking care of all the responsibilities. ¬¨‚Ä†  Life celebration service will be on April 28 and we will update everyone with the details later. ¬¨‚Ä†Again, thank ¬¨‚Ä†you all for your tremendous support!
